This type of stick drift will NOT be diminished by software calibration sadly.I could claim the warranty right now, but apparently I have to ship the ENTIRE Oculus back and Amazon won't pay shipping fees because I have shipped the product outside the US. Meaning that it's probably cheaper (in time and money) to buy an entirely NEW left controller for $69 from the Oculus store and get it shipped than paying shipping fees, being out of an Oculus for god knows how long (According to other users they take somewhere between 2 and 8 WEEKS or longer to get the product back), set it all up once again, and all of that hassle just to most likely, as said by other Oculus owners, get a REFURBISHED controller back.I feel SCAMMED regarding this, but your mileage may vary as I have seen other users with controllers lasting for about 1.5 to 2 years without developing issues, seems like I just got a DEFECTIVE PRODUCT, one that apparently I just have to deal with now. The only reason I would give 2 stars is that, even if I got a defective controller, the experience has been amazing, which kind of saddens me and makes me give it 1 star because I really looked forward to using my headset more often, which will now be an awful experience thanks to the stick drift.
review_title: Left controller developed horrible drift after less than 20 DAYS of use

one_reviews_text:
无法加载媒体。
                



 Great gift for the family,  its so awesome the graphics are pretty cool and the games are great !

Got a humble bundle with a few VR games and this seemed to be a popular headset. So far I'm not overly impressed with the setup but will try it. I have the games in steam and don't want to spend $30 to have virtual desktop. That being said Airlink has been a challenge to set up so far and I feel for anyone who is non technical trying to set this up to work with steam. Will update my review once/if I get it working.I managed to kind of get it working sometimes but you have to uninstall and re-install the PC Quest app in order to get the device to pair with AirLink. Seems like I can't just put the headset on and play, I have to spend an hour removing and re-adding the device, removing and re-adding the software, rebooting systems that are completely fine otherwise. Even the hardwire I tried tonight did not work as expected. Seriously considering returning the unit. The only reason I run out of battery so far is spending an hour removing and putting it back on trying to get it to talk to the PC in any way.

I had the Quest 1 for a year before buying this one. While the display itself is a bit lower quality (read about that online) the extra rendering quality makes the overall experience superior. I see things in Onward that I did not see in the Quest 1.The lighter weight is a plus. The new hand controls have a different feel; I think they are not as comfortable as the Quest 1 controllers. I've gotten used to them now.One downside is that the power cord is only a foot long. If I want to play when the battery is running out I can't do it. So, if you have a Quest 1, save that long cord and when you pass on your Quest 1 to someone else, give them the shorter cord.

I was very very impressed with the Quest 2 out of the box. The setup was surprisingly easy and the VR experience was better than I expected. I was really getting into it when after a month the darn thing died. Searching online I found many owners that had the exact same problem I was experiencing.  There didn't seem to be a consistent solution and many, like me, wound up with an expensive brick,  I contacted Oculus/Meta support two or three times with no response. What to do? Thank God for Amazon customer service.Based on my one month of happy use I may get another Quest 2. I do have $100 or so invested in software.  Then again I could eat the $100 and  just wait for some other company to market a stand alone VR headset.If the thing still worked I would give a four or five star rating. Amazon customer service continues to be a five.Update 4/22 I bit the bullet and bought another Quest 2.  We'll see how long this one lasts.

Product continuously fails to function. Can’t find internet. Internet connection limited. Can’t connect to phone. Can’t connect to computer that it has a usb cable connected to. No customer support online.After hours and many restarts and reviewing  YouTube videos it half works. Slow to load and forces a Facebook account.
review_title: Zero customer support. Doesn’t work out of the box

one_reviews_text: I’ve always wanted VR tech but was always held back with reports of problems with the tech and cost barrier with having to own an expensive gaming PC. I am happy to say that the Quest 2 is the first mainstream and modern VR that is an all in one standalone.I am very impressed with it. From all the features it has including the high resolution screens, comfort, and speakers. The software was much more advanced than expected. I feel like there is so much potential for this tech. Once people try it out they will want to have it. It has many applications for entertainment and real world. I think Oculus is the only main competitor right now and is doing a great job so far. I am curious to see what Apple will bring, but they will have to work very very hard to surpass this. I think it does benefit from the open software with Android. That is a few years from now but will enjoy the Oculus until something better comes along. In the future, I’d like even high res screens, more apps available (which I think will come soon considering the recent explosion in popularity), and increased comfort and usability. It will definitely get better and am excited for the future and possibilities of it. I’d highly recommend the product. Feels like when I got my first Xbox.

I think for the cost, this is the best option out there. It's not super sharp, and I definitely recommend a third-party head strap attachment for comfort and clarity. I think this would be 5 stars if they included a padded head-strap and a little better resolution. Audio is pretty good. Games are fun, although really not plentiful. I love all the cool VR videos and apps that have been created, but there's not a whole lot going on yet.I think the most disappointing feature is that it's not easy to interface with Steam. But having all the data and games built in the device is pretty great.

I love the Oculus Quest 2.  It is a great experience... BUT!The first unit I got within a week had a "cooling issue". I used the mobile app to attempt to submit a support ticket and it looked like it went through, but there was no confirmation or way to see the status or even verify that it worked!  After 2 days I just did an Amazon return (thank you Amazon) and got a replacement unit.Now though the app still shows that old unit as one of my devices.  So I go through the web site to remove the defective device from my account.  You have to click through a bunch of confirmation windows and even enter a code that they email you to verify it is you (again!) only to end up getting "An Unknown Error Has Occurred" message.  (tried that process multiple times on various computers and browsers... you know, because that is the first thing they are going to tell you to do... no luck!So now lets try to open a support ticket about this issue... after going through all the "self help" crap to get to the button to open a ticket I end up on a screen that says "Select Device" and I kid you not, THERE IS NO PLACE TO SELECT A DEVICE!So bottom line is the device is amazing and tons of fun, but you better hope and pray that you never need support.
review_title: Device Great... Support DOES NOT EXIST!

one_reviews_text: I don't like the fact that you have to have a Facebook account to use this. That should be the first thing you read about these,  it's not mentioned.
review_title: You have to have Facebook to use this.

one_reviews_text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my wife in 2021.  She was super surprised and not really sure what to think as she didn't have a whole lot of knowledge about the Oculus.  The unit arrived timely and as described.  She had no problem getting it up and going.  She loves playing games on it - especially fishing, ping pong and beat saber.  She uses it for her "exercise" .  Recommended.

I love the device and the concept of the device. You really get immersed into games and you can be lost for hours. I can deal with the badly designed adjustable strap by purchasing better and more comfortable head strap which I shouldn't with the cost. I can deal with the fact that if you have to wear glasses you have to be careful not to scratch the lenses when taking on and off by purchasing prescription lenses. What I cannot deal with is when you are forced to merge your oculus and FB account in order to setup and use the device. I also cannot deal with this merge when there are no human beings to talk to if you run into an issue with your FB account and even though you have a Oculus device, because it's merged with FB, they can't even provide the support you need. I used my Oculus for 2 months and as of April 2022, I've been locked out of my FB account for 4 months and my device is an expensive paperweight all because I can't get human support from FB.

The product advertises that you can simply "jump right in to vr" this is a lie. When you first boot up your oculus you are confronted by a screen telling you that you MUST download a mobile app onto some other device and pair it with your oculus in order to continue. This is trash. This is supposed to be a stand-alone device. It is still dependent on a third party device being connected. Absolute trash. Do not buy.

As a middle aged female, I was skeptical about ordering this, my son is a big gamer and I never understood the attraction until the oculus 2. I am hooked. Setup was easy. I just made a simple meta/Facebook account and that’s it you’re on your way. This device allows fun from home, you can play alone or with others online games are reasonably priced and the graphics are top notch. So now I’m a gaming/nurse. I’ll probably upgrade and purchase one as a surprise for my son. Bottom line just get it!!!!!!!!!!

I was really looking forward to using the Oculus.  It set up with no problem and connected to WiFi and I thought they were pretty cool.My issue is that even with the glasses insert in, my glasses scratched the Oculus lenses and this was only after my first time using them, probably 1/2 hour max.  Fortunately, my regular prescription glasses were not scratched.Now, they do have third-party options like buying spacers for the lenses to prevent the lenses from being scratched by glasses and you can pay to have prescription lenses made.  However, I planned on using this with my wife who also wears glasses so prescription lenses aren't that great of an option.However, I was so turned off by this that after consulting with my wife, I decided to return them.My recommendation for anyone who wears glasses is to buy the spacers first to prevent any damage and then if desired, go the prescription route.

We've had an Oculus Quest for going on two years now, so I was super excited to upgrade to the new one and see how much better it was. I have to tell you...the original while heavier and hotter had a way better strap system to keep it on your head. Every time I'd go to use the Quest 2 I'd end up with a headache or my face would hurt. Trying to keep it from slipping off your face means making those fabric straps super tight, which just makes your head hurt. I finally ended up buying an elite strap (not the offical Oculus one, but a nicely padded one that hopefully won't break) just so that I could use my Quest 2 comfortably. The charging cord that's included is also super short as compared to the original Quest, no doubt so that you have to buy a longer one and spend more money. In all, while there were some improvements made from the original, they also changed things for the 2nd that made it so that you have to spend more on accessories just to be able to use it. Very disappointed in Meta.
review_title: Original Oculus Quest was way more comfortable

one_reviews_text: I am not a hardcore gamer. I like to play something fun from time to time, but I am too lazy and cheap to keep up with gaming tech and I absolutely hate it when I realize that my 3.5 year old laptop is too old to play something I wanna play.On the other hand I like handhelds and I have bought most of the last several big ones that have been released. I am pretty happy with handheld graphics and quality of games.All that is just the lead up to saying I like the Quest 2. Easy to get into, plenty of quality content both free and paid. I like Rec Room for free, Pop One for paid. There's evem esoteric stuff like Altspace with group therapy sessions and open mic nights. A lot to explore id you had the time.Anyway, I am happy with the purchase. Worth the money. Headset fits me well, no pain and not blurry. I dont have the elite strap and dont need it. I am just a normal guy and am happy with this.

It’s impressive how much it can offer for such a low price. Have issues like low resolution screens and even lower resolution offered to us when playing games or workout apps to the point that I was thinking if person in front of me didn’t just came out of Minecraft and trying to teach me how to break blocks with gloves. Sometimes guardian was following me instead of being in one place.. very frustrating. More and more things that are bad like small Field of view or not intuitive adjustment for lenses that are also getting foggy extremely quickly for me. Nevertheless that might be like nothing to many people. I could live with all of that because the thing is incredibly powerful and outstanding for the price with hands training, mixed reality, holograms or just flexibility with the chip already inside that can handle a lot. I just couldn’t find time or space so decided to return. Overall I would feel bad to give it less than 5 stars. Well deserved.
review_title: Very well made headset for v

one_reviews_text: Respecto del envió: Llego en perfecto estado (por lo que se puede apreciar) y listo para funcionar, además de que llegó antes de lo esperado.Respecto del objeto en si, ha sido bastante entretenido tanto para mi como mis padres. Es algo difícil de configurar al comienzo, y creo que a los adultos puede que les cueste más pero no hay mucho problema ya que hay mucho video tanto en español como ingles que explican como configurar algunos aspectos.Recomendaciones y avisos:Si tienes un BUEN PC y Steam (en mi caso) puedes llegar a acceder a más juegos algunos gratis incluso. Si no tienes un PC prepárate para gastar un poco de plata, ya que la tienda del Oculus la considero algo cara para mi bolsillo.Si usas lentes prepárate para sufrir un poco, vas a ver borroso pero seguirá siendo jugable xdRevisa que tu IPD (interpupillary distance) este dentro de los limites del casco que creo que es 68mm, si tu IPD es más de eso NO compres el producto, no podrás jugarlo.

I was provided with access to this Oculus Quest 2 VR by my son. He assumed I wouldn’t like it because it is VR and therefore scary. Couldn’t have been more wrong. It’s a great way to get exercise without boring machines that double as clothes racks or walking a block only to feel excruciating pain in my feet and back.Oculus comes With great programs but you can also purchase even better ones. Some of the programs such as Supernatural give you 30 days trial before billing your credit card.The Oculus is very easy to use (and I am a very stupid computer user). It has all Levels of programs and great tutorials. You can use it for exercise but there are many other other uses as well which include games, travel to amazing places, and TV. I’m even getting ready to try out a painting program.If you are going To use it for exercise but are a little leery of the price, I found it cheaper than the exercise machine/clothes racks.I definitely recommend this VR machine.
review_title: Exercise for people who have difficulty with pain and walking or machines.

one_reviews_text: Headset failed and wouldn't reboot. Followed directions on Oculus website to correct, including factory reset, and nothing helped. Contacted customer support chat and they had me go through the steps I already went through following their online steps. When that didn't work, they wouldn't move forward without me sending them video showing I followed the steps - I've never heard of anything so absurd. When I asked to speak to a supervisor, I was told the supervisors don't talk or chat with customers. I refused to jump through the video hoop, and the agent ended the chat.At the end of chat I had an option to request an emailed transcript of the chat, which I did - I did not receive one.I don't blame the agent - this is clearly a serious issue with how Oculus views customer support.
review_title: $400 paperweight.  Headset died - Terrible (none) customer support - Look at other brands

one_reviews_text: The field-of-view on the Oculus Quest 2 is too narrow compared to something like the Valve Index. With the Oculus 89 degrees, you feel like you have a TV on your nose versus the true immersion you get from the valve Index with its 130 degrees. I really think the Oculus does a disservice to the VR community at large because the experience (even with current technology) can be so much better than what this product delivers.I can definitely appreciate Facebook's efforts at making a simple, easy-to-use, all-in-one product that just works out of the box. This probably makes it a good product as a general purpose novelty for use with family or friends over the holidays or something. If you actually care about VR technology and don't mind taking the time to configure a few things, the valve index will offer you a superior experience. It's not even close unfortunately.Returned.
review_title: Good for a novelty experience. Bad for actual VR.

one_reviews_text: After purchasing the Oculus Quest 2, I sold my Xbox the next week. This takes gaming to a whole new level that "flat sceen" gaming can't create.It's mind blowing how immersive and fun this product is. Being able to play anywhere without cords is the future of VR and Oculus 2 does this right.There are a lot of fun games, Eleven Table Tennis, Onward (an FPS Shooter), mini golf, and loads more depending on what you are looking for.You have to experience this new level of gaming trust me. It's great.

Oculus was the company that brought us VR. They pushed hard via donations to make it a reality. They ended up bringing one of the biggest gaming minds to the mix John Carmack. Then all of a sudden facebook bought them out and all of their promises turned into lies. Like exclusive games not being a thing. Lie after lie after lie and the end result is the quest with its name changed to Meta. Basically throwing Oculus under a bus. Its hard to be happy, positive or even like this whole transition. It leaves a bad taste in everyones mouth that was involved and sadly seeing Oculus just turn into nothing is heart breaking.Glad others have picked up on the VR market because the Quest is not the way to go. I gave it 3 stars because its affordable but other than that just bad market all over it.
review_title: Eh I bought this as the Oculus Quest 2 not sure what Meta is all about but I don't like it.

one_reviews_text: i'm sure the games are great also, but just started it up and was on my prime video content quick. Star trek is AMAZING to watch. I can't wait to try more video content on it. I would suggest it for anyone that is interested in being able to sit in a chair or walk around inside with it. But make sure you have someone close by if you are using it for games so you dont run into walls.

Had this for about 2 months before the left controller just died completely. I sent it to Oculus for RMA. That was over a month ago. They said they'd send a new controller on December 28th, but that never happened. They DO NOT have phone support. Everything is through chat only and they always give you the same response to any inquiries on the ticket. They're "escalating it to the Logistics team". I've never experienced customer support this bad before. If you're going to buy this, DO NOT send anything to them for RMA. You'll never get it back. Find another way to get the issue fixed.

yes i know the promise that it wont be required, but it is not there. until that the review remains 1. i cant stand facebook('s mass manipulation). but but but i have to submit to the genZ desires. it should have a minecraft app natively as well.its nice though, but too many drawbacks.dont try to tget "support" unless you can wait 2 weeks plus to hear.
review_title: hate the fact it requires a facebook login

one_reviews_text: I love playing my games on my laptop.  Should say "loved".  I like "escape room" type games that make you use logic and reasoning to figure out solutions to puzzles, locks, etc.  I had no idea what I was getting into when I first put this thing on.  Just plain WOW.  I'm now IN the game and it's an amazing experience.  I haven't had this much fun in a while.  Would HIGHLY recommend, although I guess you have to love gaming to begin with but if you do......Cons:  You have to have a Facebook account to use.  I've heard they may change that to just being required to have an Oculus account.  Not yet though.  The headset is a little bulky.  I'm going to try a upgraded head strap to see if that helps.  Some games will take a little getting used to as far as motion sickness goes.  If you are into logic with adventure, I can't say enough about The Room and Red Matter.  If I never buy another game again, I would say the experience of playing these two games was worth every penny for the purchase of the Quest 2.

So far I've had fun with this device. It works with SteamVR, and through that engine you can load other things. I was able to get the VR vivecraft mod working so my son could try minecraft VR.The learning curve to VR is steep and it makes my eyes tired. I am a little susceptible to motion sickness but thus far haven't experienced any from the quest 2. I don't play for more then 30 minutes or so at once.It is a lot of fun but I am not any good at most games so far.I am impressed with the quality for the price. With a 2080ti graphics card it works okay.

Worked for about a week or two. Now I get a persistent issue where it takes a while, and repeated attempts to get it to start, even when charged and if it does starts it has issues playing a couple of games… ie it has Audio, but no visual. As I originally only got it so I could play those games, this is a major concern to me

This device requires a Facebook account. When facebook purchased oculus they promised it would never be mandatory to have a Facebook account. Then they reneged and made it a requirement. As a result, my Oculus is a worthless piece of plastic . Boycott Facebook, Instagram, and Whatsapp; all of them are part of Facebook and are harmful to the interests of privacy and civil society.
review_title: This device requires a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: I have downloaded over 10 games, and I still have room on my Oculus.  If you run out of space, you can just uninstall old games you are not playing.  The VR experience has been fun.  And most of all I like giving my guests the VR experience.  Oculus has a pretty good support team, you can chat with online that will help you though anything you might have question.
review_title: 128 GB should be good enough for most people

one_reviews_text: Had for a couple days now and playing  some of the games is so immersive you can easily lose yourself in them. The biggest con of this is the original head straps are no way meant for a long duration and I would even say short duration. I admittedly have a huge head but even my 13 year old brother could only play play for a short time as the original straps w/ oculus feel like they are sucking your eyeballs out. You will have facial pain for sometime after playing.  Everyone's head shape is not the same and I don't think they truly factored that in when developing straps.  Would HIGHLY recommend buying on brand or off brand elite / comfort strap when purchasing this.
review_title: Great VR BUT BUY THE ELITE STRAP !!!

one_reviews_text: Amazing!  This is the next level.  This is not just a toy or gaming system.  It's a tool who's potential is just being realized.  I use it for mostly for exercise.  Virtual reality boxing is free with the device.  It's a great workout!  Additionally, the educational possibilities are endless.  A virtual walk through Italy over a text book any day.  I also saw the Foo Fighters, Roots and Snoop Dogg in V-concert free.  This being said, it also emulates reality in that to experience different and more exciting things One has to spend money.  If you bought a playstation you would have to buy games anyway.  Also, you will have to join Facebook. I opened an account just for Oculus.  Now I get 4 text messages a day about facebook friends I don't have.  I can see why people hate Facebook, I mean META.

I would say this is good. There are some fantastic immersive games that just take a completely different spin. Resident evil is amazing on this. I have a psvr and the quality of this is better! Unfortunately there are so many cool things that they could do that they have not. The app library for movies is terrible! Barely anything I use is supported and the things that are, work terribly. Certain apps barely load and when they do, they barely take advantage of the 3D or VR. So essentially it does the job when it comes to games and the browser but everything else could be way better if it was better supported. Many people complain about the Facebook sign in. Who cares? If you don’t have Facebook, don’t get it. If you have Facebook, then don’t complain because I’m pretty sure everyone does not read the terms and conditions anyway, so what difference does it make.

Amazing headset, no complaints about the product whatsoever.My problem is with the $50 Promotion.It only appears in small text below the listing how you are able to acquire the $50 gift. I assumed the gift would be presented after check-out, but nope nothing since I "didn't enter the Promo Code"... really disappointed that it wasn't more clear how to redeem this Promotion and I kind of think this was intentional so they wouldn't have to shell out the $50 to folks like me who do not always read the tiny fine print at the end of the product. So I got screwed out of the $50 I though came with the unit and honestly influenced me to buy it.Buyer beware, ENTER THE PROMO CODE BEFORE YOU PURCHASE!!

As much as I absolutely despise Facebook, I have to admit, you can't beat what you're getting for the price. The next step up from this is around $700-$1000, and is very minimally better. If you want to get into VR, go with Occulus. If you can't bite the bullet for Facebook, just wait for the prices to drop further. Also, the Facebook account thing has inconsistent information floating around. You have to make an Occulus account, not a Facebook account to use it. There is a massive difference that people tend to ignore completely. I made an account and not once did it show up on Facebook, even when searched. OCCULUS ACCOUNTS ARE SEPERATE FROM FACEBOOK!
review_title: High End VR for a Low Price

one_reviews_text: I really had a hard time believing that a "pc free" VR headset could be so awesome. I have never been so happy to be wrong. This thing is awesome! I have a PC and I mostly use it hook up, But I don't have to and I love it. The mobile versions of the games definitely look like bad compared to the steam versions. But I love being able to play while not home. I upgraded from the Samsung odyssey plus and it is a crazy good upgrade for the price. Definitely worth the price.

Bought this for my kids for Christmas and they loved it. They have asked for one for a few years now and we have not had the funds to get it for them. When Amazon offered this on interest free payments, I jumped on it. My kids entire Christmas was made! They couldn't believe they finally got that expensive toy they have begged for, for a while. So thank you for offering the payments, without that we couldn't have done it. They love it so much I have not gotten to play much but I did get to do the roller coaster simulator briefly. I had to sit down to do it, it was so realistic that when I attempted standing up I was getting dizzy. Not in a bad way, just felt real and thought well I don't ride roller coasters standing up, maybe I should sit down. I also like the fact that the games seem to be more affordable than other gaming systems.

This product is amazing for its novelty with 'VR'. For new 1st time users it's as if the Big Bang characters had morphed into your room and were playing episodes of Star Trek. The idea or concept of fully immersive VR doesn't seem to have caught up with the hype. It is more like looking through your old viewfinder from 70 years ago.  And most of the games available are wipe downs of the same killer games that have been around forever but now are seen through your view finder. It's too bad so many of the games are intended for the millennial crowd instead of applications in immersive VR for adults. And I feel like I am playing with my children's leggo sets for the avatars. Be aware this is first of all a toy, and it's not marketed to an audience that can do much thought encounters.
The tracking was bad, i had to create a new facebook account as it didnt accept my current one.  It allowed a roommate access.  Bad choice.

If you're thinking about getting an Oculus Quest 2, get an Oculus Quest 2. I wasn't really aware of it until just late last year and then received one for Christmas. In short, it is awesome. Just the tutorial apps blew me away. Having had it for about a month now, I've found tons of other apps (some free, some paid) that make it well worth the cost. It's also helped me get back to working out on a regular basis as it has a lot of apps that get you moving but don't feel like a workout. Be aware that you may need to spend more money on accessories, though. The battery only lasts a few hours and the stock strap and face cover are just okay. I wear glasses and use the spacer and AMVR lens protectors and that set-up works great, but there is trial and error on getting the headset's fit right.

I've had a chance to play with it a couple of times and all I can say is WOW! I'm a 60 y.o woman and love the v.r world. It comes with a tutorial that teaches you how to set it up along with amazing free games.

This is a very interesting headset however it can be very confusing for non-tech people. And the charging system in it is terrible. The charging cable and charging box does not like to charge the headset I’ve had to make adjustments in order for it to charge so I believe the charging Cable  system is bad.The head system is very heavy on your head you may notice that you get sore spots and can only be worn for a small pieroid of time . We did purchase all the extras including straps and everything to make it more comfortable and I still get sore spots.Otherwise the virtual reality games that you have to purchase extra are expensive. But the VR reality of it is good but very cartoony. I think it’s a very interesting system but it needs some quirks fixed

Great VR headset!!! I bought this for my 13 yr old son and needless to say we all have taken over and enjoyed.  We love the quality of it and clarity of the headset.  Super comfortable.  It makes you feel you are win another world for sure.However I gave it a three because . If you are playing or allowing your child to play on it, please make sure that you mute yourself and turn off notifications and invites from friends especially if your little one is playing.  I had an incident in which my son was playing a game and told me he could hear two kids fighting over the VR and taking turns.  You could hear their private conversation at home.  Needless to say I had to recheck my settings as well but it was on the other end.  Please beware.  Keep your privacy and  little ones safe❤️

you may have guessed I have a rather wide face based on the headline, but I assure you I'm no Shrek!  the OQ1 fits my head just fine. After trying this for 2 weeks, with headaches and cheekbone aches all the way through, investing more time into this would have been nonsense. so I returned it, went back to Quest 1 and I have to say, I'm not missing the benefits of Quest 2 all that much.I've also tried a few facial interface, but that creates problems with smaller FOV.  the PID adjustment will not stick, wearing prescription lense mount further destroys FOV, super blurry images to the corners. in fact, the blurry images around the corners was a downgrade from Quest1 IMO.the sharper resolution didn't really do a lot for me, nor helped in sense of immersion because of those damn FOV issues, blurry corners and the general pain.I hope they decide to accommodate people with wider faces with their next revision.
review_title: built for people with narrow heads

one_reviews_text: I have absolutely enjoyed the heck out of this headset. It's fun and the fact that someone on my budget could afford it is really something. I wouldn't have had a VR set if it weren't for this being as affordable as it is. There are some shortcuts clearly taken to help keep it affordable but the actual VR hardware is amazing. Visuals are clear and immersive and it keeps up with my movements very well. If you don't have the money for something like an Index or Vive but want VR this is a great choice. It's also pretty sturdy. I've punched my table so hard my knuckles bled and the controller barely had a mark on it. You also can't tell I've headbutted my desk multiple times trying to pick up guns and rotwiener cores lol.Lets get complaints out of the way first:• The original strap the headset came with is 100% the absolute worst part of the headset.Do yourself a favor and snag the Kiwi Design head strap while you're here on Amazon. The original strap squeezed the heck out of my head and if I loosened it the headset could flop around a bit causing blurry graphics and just being uncomfortable for a different reason. Due to that constant squeeze it gave me some nasty headaches usually after 2-3 hours of gameplay but sometimes much sooner and they could last the rest of the day. While they're nothing compared to a cluster headache for pain they were still what I'd consider bad.• Air link was awesome and worked great but was broken within a week of receiving the headset likely due to a patch (0.37 I think).I didn't get to enjoy it and the only potential bit of troubleshooting I have left to try as far as I've found is a factory reset which I'm reluctant to do. I bought a 3rd party link cable which is working well enough for me but I'd really like to be able to take my gaming to my living room where I have much less risk of punching or breaking anything and have some room to physically move around.• I don't really like having to be signed in with a Facebook account.I don't think this is going to change anytime soon if ever though.I've played Hotdogs, Horseshoes, and Hand Grenades (H3VR), Blade & Sorcery, Pavlov, and Legendary Tales with my headset. I've played around 76 hours since I got it and aside from the headaches problem (which I've solved recently) it's been absolutely amazing and immersive. I've also used it to watch youtube, streaming shows, and movies. I absolutely love the thing for every use I've had for it so far. It's an absolute blast to experience actually fighting an opponent yourself whether it be that sniper in his tower or a bunch of knights. Just through the games themselves there's an amazing amount of stuff to experience but adding mods makes it even better. This headset can get your foot in the door to worlds you've always wanted to see in person at a pretty cheap price compared to it's competitors. Past video game levels, fantasy settings, all sorts of places to see and things to do.An aspect you might have been thinking about is this is a great fitness tool even without dedicated fitness apps. Before you realize it you'll be sweaty and tired from swinging your arms, moving around, and holding your arms in front of you for surprisingly long periods of time. Pretty much anything you do with your VR will involve some level of activity and the gaming will almost certainly help kick your butt into shape. You should still visit the gym and make sure you're eating right though.I have only done gaming through PCVR and SteamVR. I have not tried any of the games for the headset on it's own nor do I expect to anytime soon. If you're looking for info on them then sorry but I can't help you with that.There's several improvements I'd love to see either through future patches or future products. Probably the easiest would be the ability to verify and repair to latest patch the headset software from settings (if it's there I haven't found it). That way if my air link problem is software based I could fix it easily without having to do something like factory resetting the thing. If not then that's one more troubleshooting step I can cross off on my own fairly easily. In the next model or with an accessory if it's possible one thing I'd like is a second dedicated charge port allowing the use of a link cable and a charger with more oomph than a PC's USB 3 port would typically have for longer play times both at the same time. Another thing I'd like is a fabric cover. While the silicone cover is nice and stops the foam from irritating my face I'd love to have an official machine washable fabric facial interface cover that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.
review_title: Could be better in some aspects with a few changes but still absolutely worth it!

one_reviews_text: Let me say first off, I didn't realize how unfit I really am LOL this is one of the coolest things I've ever done or used in my life. Hands down. It's personally a great way to workout in your own house, and feel the full effect. I've been boxing and I can barely make through 2 rounds on hard without dying haha Climbing #2 is freaking awesome, and very interesting. The graphics are incredible, and trust me when I say that.Make sure you have enough room in your area, and know your surroundings. I already broke my sealing fan because I was trying to jump in the climb game and I hit the fan LOL. Personally, I can only go about 45 minutes to an hour and I have to take a break. It really messes with your vision so definitely be careful with that. Know your limit, and enjoy it. Games are really expensive, and hardly no free games. So budget your money on it. Definitely read reviews before purchasing anything. Other than that, it's amazing and I'm very excited to explore more. You get a ton of free videos and can explore so much! The background theme is extremely amazing! I hope this helps!

The Oculus Quest system is a great VR console for the average person. Its affordable and a new technology.I reccomend it, though I do want to note the requirements of a facebook is dangerous thing and should not be praised, even if you don't mind it. Please get a alternate account for VR if you do, and make privacy and authentification settings airtight. It is very common for personal accounts to get targeted for a plethora of reasons. Attaching a payment method to social, public media is a bad idea. Be careful.However, this review is not about the console itself, but Amazon. After receiving my package, I thought things were odd. For instance the sleeve was ripped and poorly tapped back together. The inside was also ripped. The contents, aside from the main electronics, were all over the place, unsecure. Initial thoughts were shipping was rough. However, there was more. Dust on controllers, the pull-tabs already removed and in box, and I happened to google an unboxing video. This had been unsealed and opened. I bought a new verion, from Amazon as the seller.The second thought was someone wanted to test it, maybe something happened, but it was still brand new. However, if I saw this in a store, I would look for a nicer box out of concern for quality. This is not "new" to a collector of gaming tech! This is not new to a happy child on their birthday or holiday.Upon further research to see if I was an unique case, I found a discovery: Amazon receives returned items, and often markets them as brand new. In some cases this can be fine - wrong unopened item - and I believe it's better than some companies practices of discarding the item for profit, but it is lying, untruthful, and plain scamming.I will likely be keeping this, as I'm privileged to afford this and need it for a project, and later it will be a hand-me-down for my mother. It would only be likely recycled again or just thrown out.It works perfectly. Nothing is damaged at all - its truly new! But there have been times not like my experience that other items have been found inside instead of the intended headset. I also believe that with the market how it is currently, with illness and shortages, it was likely sold at a "used" price compared to some other places. I even looked for a used one, and couldn't find one (I don't personally care for this exact system). So it's fine for me, and I can save someone else from being scammed by this system.With my newfound knowledge, however, I will not be buying things from Amazon again. I suggest you be careful also!

Quest 2 lost a star because it isn't big enough to fit over my glasses well, even with the larger faceplate Oculus offers, and because setting up Link to a computer takes several minutes and requires navigating the Quest 2's menus and the PC menus, which means your taking the headset on and off a couple of times. Compared to the Oculus Rift S I already owned, which connects to the PC immediately and fits my head well, it is not as friendly towards PC gaming and larger headed people with glasses.It still gets 4 stars because it's an affordable system that can be used without a decent gaming PC.If you are a PC gamer with some money and want to play VR primarily while connected to your PC, I would advice buying a different headset.If you're on a budget, don't have a gaming PC, and/or don't have a large head or wide glasses, Quest 2 is a  good choice and will save you money with the added bonus of being able to travel without being plugged into a PC (at a cost of some computing power), so you can take it on vacation.The ability to be a travelling/standalone system is unique to Quest, so if that's important to you add another star to my review.If you're wanting to play primarily on PC and/or have wide glasses, subtract a star from my review.
review_title: Bad if you have a large head or play connected to PC. Good otherwise. Great for vacation.

one_reviews_text: I wrote a previous review about my NC75 Pro Headphones- they are awesome.  Recently, my headphones stopped working as I was listening to them; I had only had them for less that six months. I couldn't figure out what happened. I read the instructions to see what it could be, but couldn't find anything. I contacted Srhythm on their website through email and explained the issue.  The company/Staff was great in helping and supporting the issue.  I was told that the problem could have been a defect in the headphones.  I was very pleased and satisfied with Stella's, and Eva's quick response back each time I emailed. All they wanted me to do was send them the order number, and a video of the problem. I did that.  The next email I received was letting me know that I was approved to receive another set of headphones with the attachments included.  Delivery was 5 -7 days- I received them in less time than that.  As I write this review, I have on my new headphones listening to my favorite music.  I recommend buying from Srhythm- they do respond back in a timely manner, and care about their customers.  They responded in a positive manner and resolved the issue.  I'm back to my routine of enjoying and using my NC75 Pro headphones. I am a happy camper.  Sincerely, Ursulla (very happy camper)

It's really a pretty cool experience. Even a lot of the free content through the TV app is cool.Like, you can experience cities from the vantage point of a drone flying over them. Or people paramotoring far from civilization.The games are also pretty immersive. I hadn't played games in quite a while, but I've been playing more on this because it's more engaging overall.The main benefit of the Quest though, is that it's really cheap compared to other VR headsets and has a larger library of games. The Varjo Aero might be better, but the basic headset costs $2K, and then you need additional hardware to make it work.The Meta Quest 2 gives you a pretty good experience for $300... Unless its IPD adjustments don't match the width of your eyes.  But for the most part that hasn't bothered anyone I know too much.Your eyes also seem to adapt some after you've used the headset regularly for a bit. I used to find it a little blurry in one eye but now it almost immediately seems clear when I put it on.
review_title: I've bought three of these for friends so far...

one_reviews_text: Let me start by saying that this item is amazing! I bought it for my 11 year old,  tried it myself,  and I was amazed.  You do need a Facebook account to use it,  but that's easy to set up and get going.  Games cost roughly 29.99 to buy,  so that's an extra cost, right off the bat,  on top of this product cost.  My son has an average size room,  and it was easy to set a boundary so he didn't smash into a wall while playing.  The only bummer was the rash he got on his face from the headset. We tried the silicone piece that came with the headset,  tried wiping the headset down, the rash got worse until the headset became unusable.  I guess only a small percentage of people are unable to play for that reason,  but I wish someone would have left a review letting me know it was a thing.  Good luck!!
review_title: Loved it,  watch for face rash

one_reviews_text: I see so many people writing reviews about glasses. The headset actually comes with an extension clip that allows people with glasses like myself to play, if people would actually read the directions and see what it is, moat probably throw it away, thinking it's just a piece of garbage plastic. With the extention I can even where my snow boarding glasses, that are huge, comfortably.Buying a new headstrap is essential, the device is very front face heavy, and uncomfortable with the in box strap, but there are literally hundreds of after market alternatives, make sure you pick one with a battery for the counter balance.Make sure you buy some sort of protection for it, grips and some sort of rubber/silicone face cover, as well as lens protectors and a storage case, the device itself is extremely sensitive to light, and even a slight scratch on the lenses essentially destroy its use.If you plan on using it alot, some sort of external power supply, the internal battery is good for about 2 hours. You can pick up a 30MaH portable charger for 20 bucks, carry it in you pocket with the 3-4 ft usb-c wire, and it will power the oculus for 24+ hours of play.Now, the oculus store is ok, not great, there are some A-list games, but the store itself is rather limited, watch a tutorial on how to sideload via developer mode and then you will have access to 10s of thousands of apps and small indie developers. Also, using the link and a PC gives you access to the steamVR library of games, way better products than available on the oculus store.If your new to VR, it's one of the few areas where the software is way behind the hardware capabilities. So alot of apps aren't graphically great but have amazing immersion.All in all, this is the best VR headset on the market when you compare hardware specs, compatibility with the oculus store, sidequest, steamVR, ect, and price. The comparable HTC Hive is $1100.
review_title: Ignore the bad reviews when it comes to glasses

one_reviews_text: So i was gonna get the htc vive pro 2. But at the advisement of my buddy who has one he told me how vr is in a weird place and to just get the occulus 2 its good enough and wont be over 1k. So i did. And plan on upgrading in the future. But bro. This thing is dope. You HAVE To get an upgraded headstrap tho its a must. But i got the one made by KIWI and its awesome. This headset really is great. I got it to use tethered to my pc which is great. But even the standalon headset is good man. I was really blown away. Yes ypu can play games and watch vr vids and all that and even do stuff like meeting in virtual spaces and stuff. But we all know the real reason to get a vr headset. You diety dog. Shame on you. But yes that works like a champ too.
review_title: You know exactly why youre getying this you filthy animal.

one_reviews_text: I was not aware that the Oculus required a Facebook account to use the device and that Facebook would be able to sell my data. Returning this immediately!! No thank you!

I have been having a ton of fun with this VR set but found myself frustrated when it suddenly wouldn’t charge after about a month of use. Talking to customer service and searching the internet I found out sometimes if you try to charge immediately after a long playing session, the internal battery will not hold a charge because it it overheated. The device never feels hot, so it isn’t possible to know whether or not your battery is overheated. Best tip I can give is always give your device at least 20 minutes to cool before plugging it in to charge. I know, that adds time and is annoying but it’s the only thing I’ve found that really works. This is a consistent problem from what I’ve been reading. I hope Meta/Oculus figures out how to prevent this in future models.

I got the Quest 2 and was exited to get started with it. Went through the setup and made a facebook account to do the setup. Was pretty annoyed that I needed a FB account to use my Quest but whatever. After I got done with the setup the Facebook account instantly got disabled. With that I cant use the Quest besides going into it and looking around. Screw Facebook. If youre going to force me to use it DONT LOCK ME OUT FOR USING IT!!! If you have a facebook account already and use it im sure youll be fine but if you dont have account be aware that you'll probably have the same issueEdit:So after going to support that didn't help at all cause it's a Facebook issue I just reset the thing and made a new account and no issues with that. And I gotta say not having to deal with wires sbd being able to play anywhere is very nice. I have a HTC vive with wireless but this is a way better wireless experience. It's just a shame the Facebook requirement really effected my initial opinion on it and makes gard to recommend to anyone who don't already use facebook. But ill give it 3 stars cause of the ease of use

The system was very minimalistic, simplistic, and easy to setup. Think of this as a console since most free games will start to get boring relatively soon, so be ready to purchase some games for it. Also kind of sucks that it requires a Facebook to use. Otherwise it is an amazing system and the fact that it’s wireless is a complete game changer! Highly recommend.

While charging, I had it plugged in for about 10 minutes and it almost caught on fire. Thank God it was not plugged in while I was sleeping. Now my whole house smells like an electrical fire. Not sure if I’m going to be reimbursed but I’m going to reach out directly to the company. This thing should come with a warning. I did not know this was very common in till after searching on the Internet. Hopefully this prevents Someone from being hurt or killed
review_title: Careful not to burn house down!!

one_reviews_text: I bought this as a replacement for my Oculus Rift, primarily for the increase in resolution but also a little bit for the wireless-ness nature of it (fully intending to use the Air Link option). I really only play three games with VR:  Beat Saber & Thrill of the Fight when I want to work out, and DCS when I want to nerd out.The good:  the device certainly has a better resolution and overall better picture quality than my rift did. With the rift I could pick out individual pixels almost anywhere I looked and that is significantly improved with the Quest 2 and I really have to look hard to start noticing the individual pixels. In DCS I can now clearly read almost all the dials in the cockpit whereas before I really had to look closely at each one. The headset is also slightly lighter which is nice and you no longer need separate tracking cameras which has reduced clutter on my desk (and the number of connections required to my computer - from 4 down to 1).The not so good: If I want to play Thrill of the Fight or Beat Saber (both games I have already bought via the Oculus store): I have to buy them again; OR use the Air Link mode. Unfortunately, the Air Link mode breaks Thrill of the Fight (apparently the room-scale Guardian information does not get transferred to the game correctly via Air Link - an Oculus bug) and Beat Saber ends up being extremely choppy and not enjoyable at all (this is on a 5Ghz Air Link wifi connection and about 4ft from the wireless router). I have read that it's better if you're using wired mode (which also fixes the Guardian bug) so I will try that (why in 2022 can we not make over-air connections as reliable as wired ones?).The plainly terrible: The headband/strap is atrocious, I don't know who designed this or who let this through quality control. It doesn't fit, the top band is almost always just flapping around and the headset ends up resting on the bridge of my nose. There's no headphones on the headset (more like some tiny speakers in the headband that give you a very faded audio experience... like you're listening to something from across a room).  The default padding is inadequate (especially since it's absorbing the weight of the device as it bears down on your face). While I also don't mind the redesign of the controllers I have to ask... why? Did changing the position of the loop really make things better? Cos right now it's just causing me endless problems as 2 years of muscle memory using the old controllers need to be retrained.Conclusion: it does improve my DCS gameplay experience which is the primary reason I bought this; so I am "happy" on that account. However the loss of the little things, from the in-built headphones on the headset, the general poor quality of the head strap, to not having to rebuy my games in the same store and the same account have really put a downer on things. I expect better for something nearly $400. I hope that re-wiring it with a cable will improve at least some of the issues and while being wired isn't ideal; it's also not the end of the world for me (especially if it fixes the problems I have).
review_title: Improved viewing quality, decreased usability compared to Rift.

one_reviews_text: I’m a mom of 3. Bought this for Christmas for my 15-year-old son, but my daughters & I loved it so much we ended up buying another. We love Beatsaber and Job Simulator the most. I’ve tried some horror walk-through games, but they make me seasick still. I’m hoping I’ll get my “sea legs” soon lol. The biggest downside is the weight of the headset, in my opinion. It’s a bit on the heavier side. I’m assuming in a few years there will be more lightweight models,  it for now this totally suffices.
review_title: Loved this so much we’re purchasing 2

one_reviews_text: Overall this product is very average.  Packaging is very nice though!VR is very cool.. I think in a few years.. maybe 4-5.. VR is going to be a very very fun experience with visuals that will WOW a person.  Right now, those types of "WOWs" are limited to VR sets that are $1000.. this reasonable $300 VR set allows a person to have a nibble of what's possible and what might be coming to the future with  a very low visual quality.When watching youtube VR.. the videos are very very low quality.The limited eye adjustments of only 3 will have a lot of people looking at blurred VR.There are requirements that people need to follow in order to use this hardware.. requirements that are unreasonable, but reasonable enough for most people.
review_title: Very average VR experience with unreasonable requirements

one_reviews_text: While I do believe VR is the future in gaming I don’t think Occulus is it. Although  comparatively low priced it falls short for many reasons: It’s always blurry, creates eye strain , too heavy, uncomfortable head strap, too few games, doesn’t really facilitate glasses, randomly glitches etc etcIf not for the pandemic we would have seen Xbox & Nintendo VR by now and while PS VR is technically available getting one at a fair price is difficult at best. Consoles are bought for the games that are available for them and the Occulus library is too sparse.Clearly consumers want VR and will tolerate even crappy VR like Occulus while waiting for The Real Deal. However it will ultimately end up in the graveyard 🪦 for poor tech-as it should.

The oculus is a visually stunning experience the minute you put it on you are taken into different worlds and will definitely forget where you are. The games range in price from $10-$60 there are family friendly games and advanced adult games that are actually scary! Pretty easy to figure out with the tutorials and you don’t need to use the TV at all I would say the only downside is that you need a Facebook account which it seems they just use for trying to promote the product

The quest 2 is awesome. It’s a computer! You can search the web in 3D, watch p***, play awesome games with a non toxic community. It has some absolutely amazing features….you can even connect your computer to it and work in 3D with your colleagues. I am hard to please and I was blown away. It’s not “gimmicky”; sure the games are still being developed, but the more users they get, the more games will come out.I work out with this!!! Even the lightsaber game will give you a fun workout.Buy one, you won’t be disappointed…unless you have a 2000$ computer and can run the big boy VRs.Just my 2 cents.I walked around my house at night with my headset on, dark as heck, and ate, took a poop, all while watching Netflix.

If you use the quest for exercise, expect it to be blurry 1/2 the time. I use the quest mostly to play beat saber and these problems are not solvable mostly due to triggering system problems when trying to work around blurry issues. Two major sources of blurriness: fogging and headset moving down on the face due to its weight and sweat making the silicone pad slippery.To reduce fogging, hang out in the same room with headset for 15 min but don’t do any exercise during that time. Your face and the headset need to be close to the same temp. This will reduce fogging but won’t eliminate it because exercise causes you body temp to rise.To keep the headset from blurring, you can try tightening the straps but, that will eventually trigger a system issue where the headset will temporarily go black and/or pause the game. Adjusting the headset while in game can trigger the same issue.Removing the headset and wiping away sweat can cause multiple problems such as fogging, loss of guardian, going blank or triggering of other system issues. If it works, it will quickly slip down again going blurry.I have tried the standard and elite strap. My next experiment is to try a counter balanced strap.Note: I have not mentioned the multiple system issues that combined with the blurry problem will eventually cause me to give up and let the quest collect dust.
review_title: Plan to spend 1/2 of the time playing while blurry

one_reviews_text: My 15yr old son asked for this as his bday, at first I was hesitant that he wouldn't really play it since he loves his PS5, BUT THIS HAS GOT HIM OFF HIS BED AND OUT OF HIS ROOM! He uses it in the living room where there's more room, and he is active!! He's probably lost 10 pounds and this helps him exercise, he's NOT overweight or anything but he can be pretty lazy sometimes, and I love to watch him. Even tried it myself and it was pretty amazing!

Right out of the box, the Oculus Quest 2 is easy to set up. The controls take a little getting used to but the interface is very user-friendly. I was downloading apps in no time. Expect to spend between $10 to $40 per app. The games tend to be more expensive. Although I'm a gamer and originally bought the VR headset for gaming, I spent the first few weeks exploring the world, creating art in Tiltbrush, and marveling at watching my favorite shows in a virtual theater. The headset is comfortable to wear (it has an extension for people who wear glasses) but after a couple of hours I start feeling it for sure. Which is fine because that's about how long a charge lasts. I love this headset and I'd recommend it for anyone wanting to explore VR at an affordable cost.
review_title: VR has come a long way

one_reviews_text: The headset was uncomfortable and very difficult to get on or off. I wear strong glasses, which apparently don't go well with the set. The image was very blurry except in the very center; if I shifted my eyes to anything around the edges, it was impossible to make anything out. The straps holding this think on your head are ridiculous. They were tight, uncomfortable, even painful at times. At the price this thing goes for, one should not have to pay more just to make it possible wear it. Sound was good, and the technology is solid, but the construction was not very good. After I took it off (after maybe ten minutes of wearing it) I felt dizzy and nauseated. Finally, there's that old bugaboo: you have to have a Facebook account and basically sign away your privacy to use this thing. Overpriced and poorly thought out. I am very, very disappointed, and am sending it back later today. IF they can come up with a way to make it wear comfortably without having to shell out more money, and IF they can come up with a way to make it viewable for someone who is highly nearsighted, and IF they don't want me in the Facebook system, then maybe I'll give this another chance someday. But for now, I want nothing to do with it.

We have the Quest 1 and now the Quest 2.  They have done such a good job on this device.  It is a huge step forward.  Being a gamer, this has been my go to device for VR.  My son has an Valve Index, and this quest 2 keeps up with it albeit a minor step down, it does everything, plays everything I through at it.  Nuf said... our family loves the Quest 2, and we use it with our Steam VR games and Quest Store games.  Great entry into VR if you have not tried it yet.  HINT: do watch all of the How To and Tips videos on youtube before purchasing and setting up.  They will be a huge help to get over the learning curve.  It is easy to set up but, if you want to really get the most of it, watch the youtube tips and tricks on it.
review_title: We have had so much fun with this headset

one_reviews_text: This is the best video game system I've ever had! The visuals are breathtaking and the games are so immersive and enjoyable. I've actually purchased two of these 😄.Google Chrome cast is a must. It's very annoying when you can't see whats going on in the headset. You can cast it to your phone in the oculus app, but of course, that's a very tiny screen.3 best games to start with:1. Beat Saber - a rhymn game where you slash blocks to the beat2. Moss - an action/puzzle game with a very captivating storyline.3. Super Hot - a game where you fight red glass people. A little tense, but so fun!You can find all of these games in the oculus store

I am not a big gamer, but I am truly enjoying the fitness app Supernatural.  It has got me moving (and liking it) for the first time in a long time.  The Oculus is amazing, and I'm sure I have only scratched the surface of all it can do.  I only took off a star because I have had to buy several accessories in order to use the headset comfortably while exercising.  I have purchased a headband, face masks, anti-fog spray and a fan attachment.  The fan attachment works great at keeps lenses clear.  Also, the subscription to Supernatural was an additional purchase.  I think it's worth it to make exercise fun. Overall, I really love the Oculus, but be prepared to spend extra $$ on apps and accessories.

The first one they sent me was acting up right out of the box. It kept losing tracking and couldn't recognize guardians. I went through every possible troubleshooting step by myself and with meta customer care and they wanted me to send it in and said that would take a couple months. So I just had it replaced through Amazon and they sent a replacement in one day. The one I have now hasn't lost tracking once and works great. If you have problems with yours I would just return it through amazon and skip the whole manufacturer customer care thing because that wasted hours of my life and was very frustrating. Overall this thing is pretty cool 😎
review_title: 1st one was messed up, replacement works great

one_reviews_text: I love, love, love…….. this! I workout every morning and every night! I can see a change in my body and my mind. I love doing the meditation it helps clear my mind keep me focus and helps me with sleep. If you a person that just loves working out at the gym but because of the pandemic you kind of concern of going back this is the best next thing to get to work out at home. If you love dancing this is the next best thing to get or just love having fun on video games and stuff this is the next best thing! I think I only have one downfall on the system is that trying to fix the time on it. The best thing to do if your time is wrong on your oculus is still look it up on YouTube. It took me a couple of days to figure it out but I found out how to do it. Overall I love it me, my daughter, my sister, and soon my nephew loves it!
I forget Facebook is a software not hardware company

I have never experienced VR before. Setting up was easy once I knew what to do. The sound quality is surprisingly good, the headset is comfortable, I wear glasses and it's a little snug even with the glasses spacer but my glasses are slightly bigger than the recommended size. I usually only play VR for an hour or two so the battery life lasts long enough for this factor.This headset is my new favorite hobby, game system, activity, etc.For the price, and the fact it requires nothing to set up, this experience cannot be compared to. VR is a beautiful technology, and I have never been happier with this purchase.
review_title: A world changing experience for the price of a game system

one_reviews_text: First off, Amazon says I have to prove I didn't receive the $50 gift card - looks like I'm not the only one that didn't receive one. The quest is great when it works. I've had to factory reset once already to solve a black screen issue. I would put it on my head, adjust it at any time and it would go black and beep, need to shake my head around to get screen back or reboot. Frustrating when you're in the middle of a game! Also, it goes to sleep when watching a movie or guided meditation and it constantly wants me to setup the guardian area again. A factory reset helped the black screen issue for about a day. I'm RMAing this one because I don't think something should have to be reset within the first week of use and don't think I should have to prove to Amazon that I didn't receive the gift card when they can see others are having the same issue. Very frustrated with Amazon. I'll buy another one, but not from Amazon.
review_title: Never received the $50 gift card! Had to factory reset within the first week due to black screen

one_reviews_text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He used it for boxing workouts. After a month or so, the Oculus got stuck in a boot loop and wouldn’t turn on … just kept trying to boot up without success. He went through Meta support. He was told to box up the device and mail it. He kept checking in, but weeks later the replacement hadn’t arrived. It finally did, rebranded as Meta Quest 2. It worked for a few days, then it got the black screen of death. Support has taken days to get back to him, then they finally replied and told him to do a factory reset. He’d tried that before he contacted them. So far, he probably has been without a working device longer than he’s had a working device. And he’s been extremely frustrated in his dealings with customer service. This whole experience has been unacceptable. It was a splurge gift that he should be able to enjoy. Instead, he’s spent a good portion of the warranty period without a working device.
review_title: Keeps breaking, dealing with Meta is a nightmare

one_reviews_text: You've bought this. You're excited by it. Can't wait to get into playing, and exploring. You've bought a bunch of accessories. Official accessories. But, then you use it.The biggest flaw in the engineering of this unit is, ventilation. There is no fix for it, via Oculus. There are a few third party companies that offer face plates that might help and 1...and I mean "1" small mountable fan unit that sucks hot air out to help with the lenses fogging up and you sweating like you're in a sauna.C'mon Oculus...which is now no more, or atleast absorbed by FB/Meta. You couldn't have constructed your own accessorie(s) to eliminate the issue??So, if you are considering it. Just know that you may get away with using it for an hour without starting to sweat. And, forget boxing or using the workout/fitness apps.All in all the experience, though dampened by the ventilation issue, is fun. The ability to not be tethered to a wire nor a lit of Oculus store apps, is my fav plus. Hook it up to your capable pc, and play other pc vr compatible games.
review_title: This gen of VR is...a SweatBox

one_reviews_text: I knew winter coming to Minnesota was going to be hard for me to stay active once the snow came. I purchased my OCULUS for exercise benefits and I’m loving my exercise time. I was surprised how intense of a workout I could get in the middle of my living room. The effects of the Virtual Reality are amazing and beyond words- to put this contraption on my head and have it transform my home into a roller coaster, dance studio, jungle, homeless camp…it’s not just about games.

Best Gaming of my Life!  And I paid 25 cents to play Pong back in 1973!My first purchase of VR and boy I'm glad I waited.  Impulse bought this because of Resident Evil 4 and Halloween!  Now I just need to wait a few years for the technology to leapfrog so I can play Red Dead Redemption and Grand Theft Auto in VR!  LOLMy big complaint, I can't wear that headset for more than 1 hour due to discomfort from the strap and weight on my skull!  But this is probably good because it makes one take a break and snap back to reality!
review_title: Best Gaming of my Life!  And I paid 25 cents to play Pong back in 1973!

one_reviews_text:
无法加载媒体。
                



 If you want to start your journey in VR it's the best choice. Additional pron is you can play wherever you are.Cons: strap, as for me it's not good for long games.

I absolutely adore this system.I downloaded the Supernatural app to use with it, and now I actually look forward to working out.It gives me a full-body workout that’s actually fun.Also, it’s easy to use. I just turned it on and followed the instructions.If I had one suggestion for the manufacturer, it would be to make it a bit lighter. It’s a bit heavy for me.Still, highly recommended, especially for people like me who live in super small cold towns, where winter seems to last forever. It’s so nice to immerse yourself in another world or sunny location!Highly recommend!
review_title: Best way to work out ever!!!

one_reviews_text: I am pleased with this gaming system. I can use it to exercise with, and my son has made many “friends” in the virtual world with it!  He’s home schooled and never really met friends since the pandemic started when he was in pre-k, and he’s never technically been back to school. I would recommend this for anyone who is usually a couch potato, or who just wanted to see the world without having to leave their current location.
review_title: The most fun inside the home, ever!!

one_reviews_text: I had the 256GB "the 128gb was out of stock at the time" along with the Oculus Link Cable.For the first 1.5 hrs it was great but i got a low battery warning even with it plugged in to the PC.i decided to just let it sit while i had some dinner to see if it would charge up using the link cable.i closed all the software and just left it plugged in with PC running and it slowly drained down the battery.I then charged it up with the included charger till the light went green.after i set it back up i noticed it slowly draining the battery just messing around with settings in software.after 12 hrs of playing with it having to charge it every 1.5 hrs i boxed it up and sent it back.I also tried it on a different computer that had a USB C connection for the link and the same thing happened.I guess i will have to get one that dose not have a battery and is only powered by the PC.
review_title: I wish i had gotten a good one. but i was one of the few that got a bad one.

one_reviews_text: I bought this to have an updated vr, i bought the oculus cable for pc, well it doesn't work well with windows 11 apparently. Wish i would've known before but that's my own fault for not looking into it. Hopefully they'll fix that soon, other than that it works great. Just wish i could play my steam games more efficiently. They should port steam to the oculus so people dont have to pay for games they already own, ive managed to use the experimental airplay and it works but has cut out from time to time. But the fact that you can play vr games with no cords is pretty cool and makes it very portable obviously. Just be aware of the windows 11 compatibility issue.
review_title: It works kinda-Windows 11 is janky with it

one_reviews_text: First: delivery to Russia took 3 weeks. Item arrived well packaged, customs taxes were around $15.The headset itself is a mixed bag.From one side, in *some* apps the immersion is amazing. But those apps and videos are extremely rare. You can only find really immersive videos in the Oculus TV app. They look like 8K 3D, and they are very impressive.There's a lot of 360 degree videos on Youtube, but Quest 2 can only play them in 4K. And in this resolution they look like if you run lowest quality 360p heavily compressed Youtube video on your 50" TV. I mean it's ugly.Those (seemingly) 8K 3D videos from Oculus TV mostly require to be downloaded before playback. And their resolution looks like 720p on 50" TV. Definitely not amazing in terms of resolution, but still very immersive. I can only wander how immersive will be 12K and 24K 3D videos in the distant future.The main problem is... I already watched most of these videos in a week. There's nothing left. All other videos even in Oculus TV are between bad and ugly in quality.On the "home screen" (or home ambience) everything looks like...well... if you had a myopia.The headset often "forgets" the safe play area, and shows positioning errors. A couple of days ago I had to reboot it twice to get rid of this error.All in all, it feels like both technology and content are still in the early development stage. Maybe in 5-10 years it will really become a mature product, but now it's more of a concept or demo.I didn't try Quest 2 linked to PC because I don't have a compatible PC.And the games... well, those I tried to play look like back to 90's. Visual quality is from bad to mediocre, gameplay is extremely simple and limited, but pricing is like AA titles on PC.Notice: I use Quest 2 as a standalone headset. This is my first VR headset, I have nothing to compare.
review_title: Good piece of tech still in the early development stage

one_reviews_text: Charged the headset and when powering up, there was nothing, but blue and red horizontal lines. We could hear the clicking of the menu and the starting music, but no video.Sending it back for refund as we also didn't notice that a Facebook account is needed to even use the thing. Who uses Facebook anymore?

Estamos MUY DESILUSIONADOS Y MOLESTOS CON LA COMPRA DEL OCULUS QUEST 2, la 1ra vez anularon la compra después de unos días, y decidimos hacer de nuevo la compra porque nuestro hijo de 11 años insistió. Realizamos la compra del producto y todo iba bien, incluso al hacer seguimiento DECÍA QUE LLEGABA  EL 29 DE SEPTIEMBRE. Ayer, mi hijo todo el día feliz esperando su Oculus, y creíamos que sólo se habían retrasado en repartir en Chile, pero en la noche nos llegó un correo diciendo que sería reembolsado el monto. Nosotros no queremos el reembolso, QUEREMOS EL PRODUCTO y sentimos que LE HAN FALLADO A NUESTRO HIJO Y LE HAN CAUSADO UNA ENORME PENA. Queremos una explicación al respecto, porque nunca habíamos tenido problemas con Amazon y esta vez el daño ha sido hacia nuestro niño.
review_title: POR QUÉ REEMBOLSAN Y ANULAN COMPRA DE OCULUS QUEST 2 SI YA TENÍA FECHA DE LLEGAR  A CHILE

one_reviews_text: This is a great product. Amazing capabilities. HOWEVER, it should come with a serious disclaimer regarding people who suffer with motion sickness. I tried. I really tried. Used motion sickness medicine, tried only sitting down while using it, chewed ginger candy, limited my time every use. After more than a week, I was getting sicker and sicker using it, Also felt very claustrophobic with the goggles on. Regretfully, I gave up and ended up returning the device. Found out that this is a problem for some people and I should have known. Oh well, it's still a great product if you can handle it... I can't do merry go rounds or coasters or cruises either.

This review is after using the system for 2 days. You would think after paying so much money for this system that’s there’d be some free games, but no.Everything cost moneyThe cheapest game cost $7.00I bought it for the supernatural game/exercise, that cost $175I’m not a gamer, so maybe my review is bias.Also A fully charged system last about 2 hours of play timeI’ll be returning it

This VR is absolutely amazing!! When you put it on, you can’t see Anything else, your so completely immersed! Although, when you want to walk around, it shows you every detail around you!! It is so worth every penny! If your looking for a VR headset, this is it! You do have to have internet connection to update & download your games. However, after downloading the games, your speeds do not effect the game! I have satellite internet, & while it takes a While to download games, once downloaded, it plays just as smooth & seamless as if I had high speed! Now, I don’t know about playing any games with other people online too, we haven’t tried that yet.
