Im very tiny The headset is a little heavy for my head so I typically don’t participate very long but it was a gift for my boyfriend and he doesn’t complain about it at all he plays for hours sometimes it is night and day compared to the cheap ones you put your phone in or even the PlayStation version or others iv tried my one complaint is you need a realli fast computer to download and play some of the games which we don’t have and I wish their were a place for a memory card but I guess everyone finds a way to make their money somehow above all tho it’s an amazing headset n tops the competition and then some it’s also insanely better then the first quest by far

I really enjoyed it at first, being a newbie to VR, and it ran as intended. After about a week I needed a new faceplate, some screen covers and a battery back-up. The AirLink works okay, but not consistently enough so I had to buy a long UsbC cord. Then the left controller stopped working completely, and I had to shell out 75$ to replace. The right controller this past week started stuttering and I have to jam a piece of foil between the battery for it to not disconnect in the middle of play. I also find that the headset does not fully shut down and drains battery throughout the night, so it basically always needs to be plugged in if I want to pick up and play whenever.When it works, it's super fun. I can play for hours with a back-up battery. The games are a bit pricey on the Oculus Platform, so you'll mostly be playing SideQuest games and Beat saber for now.
review_title: Needs additional accessories and DIY tricks

one_reviews_text: Congratulations, you saved yourself a few hundred dollars! Now, just sign away any ownership you thought you would have over the device because Facebook now owns you.You 100% need an accurate Facebook account tied to your name and phone number, so enjoy the new robocalls and spam texts that accompany this. And best part is: you have no control over the device. Any mods, or other custom content, goes against Facebook's rules, so have fun with their rules forcefully incriminating yourself into make a false developer account to unofficially avoid these. And when they block your 'facebook' account, your Oculus account (which should be separate) will go with it.There's a reason this is cheaper than the competition, and it's not just the resolution, strap quality, or other issues you will immediately face out of the box.

Bought two of these, spoiled I know but wanted to be able to play against/with one another with family and friends. Easy setup just need Facebook accounts which for some may not be right.First one worked fine for awhile then the headstrap broke so need to replace it and the oculus branded one is not cheap. Then the left toggle starts to drift. We think the sensor gets dirty so some alcohol is supposed to work but if not may have to replace.The second oculus we ordered was good for about a day then the left toggle didn't work at all and no matter of reset or cleaning worked. Thankfully we just got it so it was an easy full replacement of the Oculus for a new one which was an easy and fast process.Other than that, time will tell but I think the more use, the more wear so I'd imagine more replacement parts but they are fun for what they are.
review_title: Great gaming experience but hardware itself becomes a problem

one_reviews_text: Say what you want about Zucc and his company but they brought VR to the big leagues. This headset is sweeping through my family and friends like a plague and now we're all golfing together every night.The headset is infinitely customizable and there's a billion accessories for it. Plan on spending another 300 over the next 6 months on improvements!

The only problem keeping this thing from reaching perfection is the absolute necessity of having a Facebook account in order to use it. Especially with Facebook's recent trend of completely deleting accounts with little to no actual investigation when a person gets hacked, or an image gets taken out of context.  You lose everything. Your entire game collection everything you paid for, gone in a flash.  And then you're just stuck with a brick with straps.Buyer beware of that one, but otherwise, fun for social games, portable is heck, excellent for wireless PC gaming use, metaverse is pointless garbage.

The price of oculus quest 2 is unbeatable, and  since I don’t have a PC this is definitely the best stand along VR headset I can get in the market. Biggest con is the resolution is low compare to other VR headsets, I would get dizzy if use it for too long. Hope resolution can improve in the future models.
review_title: Resolution is low compare to other VR headsets

one_reviews_text: Unless You want to be Plugged into the Facebook Metaverse, DO NOT BUY THIS.  I can't get into the app without a Facebook Logon, and after some research figured out that everything is linked to it.  Meaning if I ever lose access to my Facebook, Hacked, Banned Etc, I will lose access to any games that I purchase.  I regret this purchase already, 9am on Christmas Morning.
review_title: MUST HAVE FACEBOOK ACCOUNT TO USE

one_reviews_text: I believe this a great VR set for people wanting to experience VR at an reasonable price, but it does comes with some perks too, that is the games $$ , accessories, eye fatigue.Pros :- fun playing games with friends.- tetherless ( no cables)- reasonable response time.- no other accessories necessary.- customizationCons:- out of the box is not the most comfortable.- games can start becoming costly.- graphics lacklusting. ( Mobile graphics).- needs gaming PC to enjoy the full benefits.- field of view is a bit narrow 89°
review_title: Great VR experience for entry, but subsidize.

one_reviews_text: I jumped on the Oculus train after trying one out. I am very careful with all electronics as I know they can be sensitive. My oculus came in original packaging and had the protective film over the lenses. I charged it, put the better head strap on and the face shields. The last thing I did was remove the film. It appeared the lenses were dirty from the factory. I have transition glasses so I used my microfiber glasses cloth to clean them. The were about 3 noticable spots on the right lens that won't come off and are right in my field of view.  For $400 I cannot accept this, & tried multiple times to clean the lenses. Also things in VR seem very grainy into they get right up super close like an old man trying to read small print. If I do this, the objects are crystal clear, but only when super close. What's this about?Also, 2 hour charge time for maybe an hour of play time..... Not a great ratio.Not completely impressed.
review_title: Spots won't come off right lens

one_reviews_text: Ante todo quiero decir que es un producto excelente, no hay spoilers, realmente el análisis va a ser positivo.⭐️Puntos fuertes ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Excelente diseño, desde la caja/empaque hasta el casco y los joysticks.Minimalista, pero elegante.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El hardware es muy bueno por el precio, XR2 de Snapdragon, 6 GB de ram (es mucho!), pantalla 4k, sonido envolvente, y sobre todo: standalone! Es decir, están pensadas para jugar de forma autónoma, sin necesidad de cables porque tienen su propia batería!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Los juegos son muy divertidos, he probado el Beat Saber (el juego TOP del que todos hablan) y es fabuloso, pero también testeé el super hot, y es increíblemente inmersivo, muy pero muy divertido!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Los controles con precisos, perfectos casi, el reconocimiento de movimiento es milimétrico, y todo responde de maravilla.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El sistema Guardián es impresionante, puedes delimitar tu área de juego, incluso puedes "escanear" tu sofá para jugar cómodamente en él.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El sonido es muy bueno, realmente suena bien, me gustaría probarlo con audífonos.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️La batería dura lo suficiente, se echa en falta carga rápida (sobre todo porque utiliza conector usb-c).⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️La pantalla es muy buena, incluso funciona a 120hz!💥Puntos no tan fuertes💥Las correas no son muy cómodas, toma su tiempo ajustarlas. Es casi una compra obligada una correa de mayor calidad.El punto justo de visión es variable dependiendo de cada persona, pero su ajuste es bastante complicado, toma su tiempo y varios intentos.Se echa en falta una funda de serie para protegerlos (no les puede dar la luz del sol, o se quema la pantalla, atención con este detalle!).Los controles deberían tener una referencia física de R y L (derecha e izquierda) es fácil confundirlos.Deberían incluir algunos juegos precargados, o bien algunos juegos de regalo al comprar el equipo, para poder utilizarlo y testearlo a full, antes de pasar por caja.⚠️Exige utilizar una cuenta de Facebook, la privacidad se ve completamente comprometida, además, si la cuenta es dada de baja por la empresa, se pierden todas las compras y dólares invertidos en la misma, mucho cuidado con eso! ⚠️----------------------------------------------------------------------Conclusión.Es un producto superior, a un precio muy bajo en relación a lo que ofrece.Indispensable para todo gamer, es mucho más divertido que las consolas de sobremesa, y el efecto WOW es totalmente real, es otro mundo, y la experiencia es alucinante.Le pongo un 9, es un producto casi perfecto.Súper recomendado!

Even with new batteries, both controllers will short out. Guardian will show error as if it's not detected when not moving from the area. Controllers will glitch in game play as in they won't detect movement at certain times. If I take out the new battery for the right one and put it back in, it works fine for only about 10 minutes then says check battery & disconnects again. Charge on headset lasts about 30 minutes if that. Noticed when first purchased battery lasted on headset for 45 to 50 minutes. Manufacturer makes it difficult to request warranty help.

We bought this for my son's bday yesterday.  He got a really bad rash after wearing this headset for 1 hour.  I Google this, and it seems to be a common issue.  The mfg needs to not sell these with a known high allergy padding...

I understand that there may be different degrees of motion sickness. Some may be able drive, & the second you look at the passenger seat your stomach just says nope. For some people, oculus has been able to help. With the intensity light idea they put in this v.r. computer. However, they are not able to help everyone. After over a week of trying, just going into a chat room setting down or standing, 7ish minutes and, well I'll save you the details but, after time in the restroom it was naptime and a trip to ups. It's a great item if your stomach can take it.
review_title: If you get ANY motion sickness......

one_reviews_text: So this is my first time ever venturing off into the VR world, and I tell you this product for me is a winner.  I like that it's wireless, second I like that it was pretty easy to figure out, and lastly it was easy to adjust my head and eyes.  Set up was easy on this and I'm a true beginner with this product, and it's amazing the things you can do in the VR world.  I highly recommend this product to everyone.
review_title: New to the VR thing - But I really like this!

one_reviews_text: if youre wondering...yes its worth it and u should get one. mostly use it for exercise. beat saber and the boxing and workout apps are worth it. i got the 128G i think and its more than enough room for all my apps. no need to get the higher capacity. welcome to VR my friends

Excellent VR, I have tried most of the VR's in the market and I can say the Oculus Quest 2 is the very best out there. Excellent immersion, a very complete and robust marketplace. Being Android can't go wrong. It's excellent for gaming the VR quality games, it's quite good for reading, great for watching videos. Comfortable navigating with the super responsive controllers and quite easy to type on the virtual keyword.The headset is quite comfortable and adjustable to your eyesight. If you wear glasses it has an additional extension you can put but I felt it was putting too much stress on my glasses and they might break so I don't wear them with the Oculus. But unless you have considerable sight loss you probably won't need to wear them with the Oculus.*Downsides:* as good as it is the technology of VR is still extremely limited and it's pretty much just watching a big screen around you like if you were in a planetarium. You will not feel the level of realism or immersion of Cyberpunk genre Science Fiction. We are decades or maybe even a century away from that.The headset is comfortable but if you wear it for over an hour it starts getting very uncomfortable and some people might get headaches.It's still mostly a gimmick to have fun. For work, meetings, or "adult" practical use is mostly useless.Some people will have issue that you are forced to use your Facebook account.Different profiles / accounts is kind of tedious. It's probably best for single person use.If you are in stationary mode it's good for watching videos or reading. But to fully experience it or game with it you need lots of space, 6.5 sqft so be conscious of that before buying.
review_title: Excellent VR, probably best on the market

one_reviews_text: After using this for a month, I think you're fine with getting the base model. And it's nice that you can "return" anything you download if you don't like.Pro Tip: if you get motion sick, point a fan at your face as you play. It really helps.This is the Atari 2600 of VR - the one that opens the floodgates for the amazing things to come. It's time to jump in.
review_title: It's the tipping point - time to buy one.

one_reviews_text: An experience unlike any other and who cares it needs a fb it's a device from fb creators LMFAO other than that for the initial u never see fb again. You feel like you're there. I've never been a huge gamer till NOW. I've also never spent so much money so happily before it's well worth it. You will work your body out for hours and not even feel like it because you're having so much fun. If ur thinking about it.. buy it.
review_title: Dont listen to the others this thing is great af

one_reviews_text: I love this product, so much fun to use really good quality. Theres is one slight problem though. Sometimes there is a screen when you turn it on saying something about signing in again and it always says your passwords wrong when you go to sign in and I haven't been able to use it lately. Hopefully that can be fixed and I can start using it again. Other then that 1 slight issue very fun to use, and definitly recommend!

I am a 54 year old married man and we are having a blast. Just purchased before Christmas and have no regrets so far. I think it's definitely worth the price. Battery only last 2 hours so getting a VR battery pack is nice. They fit easily on this headset and you don't even know you're wearing it. The VR system is user friendly and easy to navigate. I don't normally ever have motion sickness and love roller coasters - flipping around and all that. On the VR, I can't do it. I get motion sickness sitting down and lose my balance standing up.However, all the other games and fitness apps are great. Love boxing and first steps is fun. VR is the wave of the future.
review_title: Easy to use - needs nothing else

one_reviews_text: Privacy concerns aside this is a great platform and clearly is the future of gaming. Not so sure about the whole metaverse thing. I prefer the real verse truth be told. The big issue is it being linked to facebook. I had been off of facebook for years but had to re-enable my account just to set this thing up. Hopefully the promised non-facebook accounts will be forthcoming from "Meta". Otherwise for $300 this thing is insane. The Star Wars games are amazing! Its like you're in the movie! Its just a lot of fun and a lot more physical than your run of the mill console. Highly recommended!

This was a Christmas gift for my husband who is very hard to buy for.  He has downloaded 3 of the programs and has had fun with them. We live in a rural area and our internet speed is not the best. Therefore he says the graphics will be better with stronger internet.  It's fun to watch him, especially when viewing the Space Station.

Tech support from amazon and Facebook is completely useless. Had this for three months and it developed a freezing issue every few seconds. Amazon passed me off to meta (Facebook) and meta keeps trying to make me do troubleshooting methods that don’t work and now they want video proof that is impossible to provide. I’ve been disconnected three times from chat and each time they want to review chat logs and then they disconnect. Save your time and money. It’s not that great of an experience even when it does work. Way overhyped.

"Santa" brought this for my two children ages 7 and 11.  What Santa did not foresee was that Dad would end up spending more time on it than the kids.  From the games, VR videos, this device is really amazing.I got the one with the larger memory and I'm glad I did as I suspect that we will use this a lot and add more and more games and videos.  I find that some fast moving games can start to give me motion sickness after playing on it too long, but that's not necessarily a bad think, otherwise I'd be on it all day.Great fun product for all the family.

Upgrading from the CV1 to the quest was a great decision.The resolution is great, screendoor effect is almost imperceptible.Airlink is the last touch that VR needed, being able to turn around without having to worry about tripping on cables is really freeing.The only thing that my original CV1 beats the quest is the integrated sound. You will want a good wireless headset with your quest.Great headset for a  great prize

First,I didn't want to get it after hearing other reviews. My 13 yr old son really wanted it, so it was a gift. Very cool, but I told him you'll start doing crap like it's reality. So after 20 minutes he's nauseous bad! Literally at the toilet. Then he was playing a game where he's an ape and has to move himself with his arms to walk... So what happens when he stops playing? He starts walking down the hallway moving his arms like the ape. Lol whatever.. he doesn't want to return it but definitely can not play long. He still thinks it's cool.
review_title: My son became sick within 20 minutes.

one_reviews_text: Im honestly shocked at how great the Quest 2 is and bummed I waited so long. I was a relatively early adopter of the PSVR but this destroys that device in ergonomics. It’s also wireless so you can turn around full 360° without worrying about wires, which gives a lot more immersion. Tons of content. Bummed I’ll never be able to play Half-life Alyx because I’m not a PC guy, but for the price, this VR headset can’t be beat!
review_title: Solid VR experience even without a PC

one_reviews_text: It arrived so quickly and was super easy and quick to set up, you just need to make sure you know your log in information on your FB account and your wifi info. I bought this for one particular game but discovered many more uses for this such as watching TV and movies and fitness programs as well. I'm so Happy I decided to buy this. Comes with headset, charger cord and plug and one left handle and the right handle. Was playing within mins and find myself loosing track of time. I highly recommend this device! I'm planning on buying a carrying case for it and some grips for the handles next.

This is a joke right? The visual quality is terrible, there is nothing immersive about the quest 2.  Even worse the forced Facebook integration is stupid.  Oh cool, I can use the oculus store so nothing I own works on it. Worthless e waste.

I bought 2 of these units and both had the same issue. The left lens had a major blurred spot on it right in the line of vision. I tried all 3 settings, cleaned the lens (yes I removed the protective plastic film) and even had someone else that has an Oculus try it and said they saw the same blurred spot on both headsets. The other issue, not as many good games to play unless you're into fighting and shooting games. I was looking for flight simulations games and something other than fighting and shooting. Found Richie's Plank to be fun but hard to play with a blurred left lens.

I am not thrilled about the quality,  its very hard to adjust to your eyes and does not have ability to change the focus to make it sharp.  You not notice it when you look at entire screen,  but if you want to watch movie or open browser it will be not perfectly clear,  and you will have not fun using it :(  I think the idea is good but the technology needs better quality parts ! Mr. Z  had 10 years time to make Oculus better ! lenses should be like on binoculars high quality glass adjustable ! Not cheap plastic !
review_title: not sure if good for your eyes :(

one_reviews_text: I've been looking forward to virtual reality for a long time but the games just don't do it for me. I don't even care about Facebook or how comfortable it is, I just wish there were better games.In a nutshell it feels like 95% of the games are pumped out with the exact same style artwork, mediocre music and sound effects, and not a lot of depth. After only playing a few titles you start to grow sick of it. There are only a few "real" games available on this system. If there were even a system that recreated your favorite old school 8-bit games in sudo-VR it would blow this system out of the water. They really missed the mark on what makes a game good.

Oculus has advanced beyond the original versions that I has some years ago. I take it with me when I travel and use it for fitness (Supernatural app, etc ) and Tripp for meditation. Doing the 3D puzzles is on a whole different level. It is my favorite thing!
review_title: My favorite for fitness, meditation, and entertainment!

one_reviews_text: I love this thing and enjoy using it to watch movies using Netflix. The don't have a ton of vr but you can watch a movie as if it's on a large screen.I am 52 and it was fun learning how it works. I like using a couple different art programs for 3d drawing. It's simple but awesome for drawing using some programs that they are improving as time goes on.I also like playing pinball. Youtube vr is great.The head band on it can be a bit difficult but maybe I have a weird face shape. I make it work.

I got this VR headset because I thought it would be fun to play some games on it. However - what I use it for most often is to play Supernatural, which is a workout game. It has really helped me to change my relationship with fitness. If you are even remotely thinking about and have the means to buy one I highly recommend it.

I am not a fan of facebook, I started with PSVR, then went to the vive cosmos elite, then to the valve index. The big thing that those other headsets are lacking is good wireless support, which the quest has.  I didn't want to like it, but the feeling of having no wires, controllers that aren't bad (once you get the knuckle straps) and decent resolution.. It's really good especially when you consider the price it starts at.  The main thing that I wish it did better in is FOV, it's not bad, but it isn't as good and the index, which is fair when again, you consider how much it costs and what you get.
review_title: I hate that I love it

one_reviews_text: What are you doing? Yea I’m talking to you the person behind this screen. Why are you looking at reviews when this has pretty much 5 stars (4.8). Only thing people say negative about it is because FB login. Who the hell cares. If you can’t beat them join them. When I’m dead they can have all my info I won’t need it. Now the oculus is definitely the best bang for your buck. Battery last about a good 2 hours but you can charge and play it at the same time. I would recommend getting a guard for your remotes. There plastic and like to bang around a lot. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Best experience in my opinion and yes I have glasses and they fit comfortably. But other people are different obviously. If you have the money I would definitely buy one. I’m going to be buying another here shortly. 5/5
review_title: WHY ARE YOU LOOKING AT REVIEWS???

one_reviews_text: The reasons I bought this and not the Valve Index+$299 Oculus Quest 2 (plus about $110 of accessories) vs. a $999 Valve Index set+Medical grade silicone face padding+WirelessWhat I recommend new users buy-A 10,000mah battery so that the frame rate can be pushed to around 120hz and gaming sessions last longer ($30). Just strap it to the back of the head strap-A pro head strap by Kiwi ($40)-Prescription inserts if you wear glasses ($40)What I wish the Quest 2 had-Better software and PC compatibility... I have troubles connecting the microphone and the desktop app is buggy. This has been a problem for a while and its surprising the issues haven't been patched-bigger vision "sweat spot"
review_title: Wireless, fun, immersive, sensitive to the skin

one_reviews_text: Facebook is cancer in my opinion and this headset requires an account.I will be returning this shortly because the cancer of Facebook has no place in a normal human's life.
review_title: Forces you to sign up for Facebook in order to use.

one_reviews_text: I read so many reviews before I made this purchase. They were everywhere and I had to find out for myself. I’ve done VR in the past when it wasn’t all that great along with 3D stuff. The old stuff always gave me. Headache.The oculus quest 2 is so much fun and does not give me a headache. Some games are better than others. The options are there for anyone. The only thing I don’t like is sharing it with anyone to enjoy the experience.Great buy. Accessories are available, they seem a bit to pricey for what they are though. But you don’t need them right away.Good system for sure.

This virtual reality headset makes me feel like I am living in the future. I don't hate the console style monetization as that encourages development of new games, despite the high price tag. At least for now there is no subscription service and that will suffice for now. Besides there are many great free games as well, such as Echo VR and Pavlov Shack Beta.The stock headset comes with an ok strap and lackluster battery life both of which can be remedied with more money for an improved strap, some of which come with batteries.Virtual Reality sickness is very real and you will most likely experience it in your first couple games where your body movement does not line up with your character movement, such as in Echo VR. This problem doesn't exist in Beat Saber or Super Hot and you can exclusively play stationary games if you so choose.Overall, the Oculus (Meta) Quest 2 brings virtual reality to the masses with a plethora of super cool features, hand tracking and passthrough are both pretty good. However, the relatively low price point gives it some drawbacks that are acceptable at this stage of the game.

I think this isnt something most people will like, want, need or should bother spending the money. the holiday advertising pretty much sold me on trying it, or say, i had to see what it was all about. I just want you to try someone elses, then decide if you want to spend $300. thing is cool, but we have had for a month now, and i dont think we bothered recharging it yet... just sitting in box. waiting for a guest to come over who might want to try it. NOT for us. but certain, works well, cool, neat, all that, but i would rather just go outside.
review_title: Honest - I dont get why - right now why i needed this

one_reviews_text: I was told by a friend to go with the $299 setup. it was the best way to go for the price. its also a very nice option if you have never used a VR headset. I mean some people can never get used to them and others its no issue at all. you can buy the more expensive setups but the elite strap eventually breaks. i was told "IF" you enjoy playing in VR and have no issues you can upgrade to a more expensive setup. im glad i went this path. I can research for a more expensive setup later. not in a rush since this Quest 2 has been an excellent starting point. We've been having a blast in our house with 2 of them. at least 1 is being used daily. 1 is stand alone and the other is connected with a pc. both run great with no issues.
review_title: Awesome first VR experience for the price!

one_reviews_text: Okay so if you encounter this review you may be surprised why I have not blindly given this product a solid 5 stars.First things first, the pros. It is an overall good and functional HMD. Unlike the compeition, it supports both standalone software for those that do not have a VR ready gaming PC. PCVR connectivity is pretty much plug and play if you do decide to go through that style of gameplay. It also has a wireless option if your home network can support it.Another thing is that setup is extremely easy. Inside out tracking is pretty decent and does not require basestations or lighthouses for tracking unlike the competition. The resolution is higher in comparison to the previous iterations of Oculus HMDs. This HMD is a good entry level VR headset.Now for the cons. Off the bat, the stock strap is not really good. I can see children and adults with below average head sizes being fine with the headstrap but, for an average or larger adult head size, you won't be able to play for more than 30 minutes without the headset putting strain towards your cheekbones. Other cases have reported irritation to the ears. The only solution to this would be to invest in their "elite strap" which in my opinion, should have been the stock strap. To be honest, a 3rd party halo strap would be a better investment than their OEM elite strap.Now for the facial interface. It is sandpaper to the face. If you ordered this HMD prior to having an included silicone cover, expect to get face marks and rashes. Although the new silicone cover has prevented further problems, it is still not comfortable as the cushioning is still too firm on the interface itself. Expect to spend more for a 3rd party facial interface.Now for gameplay and experience. Remember how earlier I mentioned the increased resolution from previous Oculus models, it does not matter now. If you are someone who is planning to solely use this HMD for PCVR/SteamVR, you're gonna have a hard time wondering how this is an upgrade from other HMDs on the market. The amount of compression and artifacts I have noticed playing is just beyond acceptable. I do not understand why Facebook (or Meta whatever) decided to solely use USB C to encode both audio and video through the headset. They could've at least made use of adding a display port (or even an HDMI port for all I care). The increase in resolution is useless at this point. Even if you change and max out settings through their desktop app, debug tool and 3rd party Oculus tray tool, those same artifacts and compression in image quality is noticable. The HTC Vive has a better PCVR experience than this considering that it is older. I can understand that the main purpose of this headset was to be a consumer friendly standalone headset but for those of us that bought this thinking it would be a step up for PCVR gameplay, I am sorry to say this but we were scammed. I am hoping that the developers do realize that is a problem and consider investing a good portion of their time finding a credible solution. If you think about it, the hardware power is there with the Quest 2, but the software implementation and execution is extremely buggy.Finally defects. Unfortunately, when my Quest 2 arrived, it came with a defective right touch controller. The issue was that the thumb capacitor was not sensing thumb movement. This is gamebreaking if you play games with hand gestures. Moreover, my unit came with dead pixels when bringing up passthrough mode. Although not game breaking, it was still annoying. After looking through some online forums, these seemed to be consistent problems with other people. Luckily Amazon offered to exchange my unit for a completely brand new one free of charge.Overall it is a functional HMD and a steal for the price but it still has a long way to becoming the greatest HMD on the market. More importantly, PCVR experience. I would advise the developers to look further to improving PCVR as a significant amount of people bought this for that sole purpose. With rumours of a Valve Index 2 in the works with supposed standalone support included, Oculus needs to find a way to keep up.Update: I just received replacement Amazon sent me to replace my defective unit turns out to be much worse. There is rattling components inside and I was advised by support to replace it again due to risk of short circuiting! I am actually worried that something might blow up while I am playing. I have downgraded my rating from 2 stars to 1. If the 3rd replacement is still defective, I am refunding ASAP. I don't know if it is just me but the quality control has been poor so far.
review_title: Its Functional but needs more changes to keep up, especially with PCVR. Quality Control sucks too!

one_reviews_text: Go to oculus webiste and go to support, make sure to open a chat window, dont call them or do an email, because quite frankly, you're as impatient as me. The chat window option is hard to find for support but if the gods bless you then you will stumble upon its beauty. Right off the bat (being impatient) open the ticket with what you want done, unlinking. The way I finally got support to do it for me was not making it an option, I made it clear I was not requesting to unlink, I NEEDED to unlink, it was a NEED. Not a request. You paid 299 for this bad boi and you deserve some authoritay. I also made it clear that oculus was my issue (bamboozled them) saying I wanted to unlink my oculus from my facebook, not vice versa, and not is that it was possible. That it was happening. When they ask the reason, say "I unfortunately cannot disclose that information." You are welcome :)
review_title: How to unlink your fb account (may take multiple attempts)

one_reviews_text: Nice product but wasn't aware I had to put the code at the time of purchase to receive $50 gaming credit. Pretty low of y'all, considering that was one of the things that drove me to purchase a system. I'm not happy.
review_title: Great but....cheated out of my $50 promo code

one_reviews_text: So idk. So Ive owned the samsung Odyssey plus going on 3 years and i wanted better tracking.The goodThe oculus quest has better graphics when using the usb link cableIt is wireless and works using wifi but the quality goes up and down based on the wifi connectionTracking of the controllers is a lot betterThe link cable is thin and light compared to the OdysseyThe badNarrow field of view compared to the OdysseyFace hugger, narrow face opening compared to the OdysseyNarrow field of viewWeirdly positioned focal point its at the bottom of the lenses so the headset sits more on top of your head as to straps to your faceThis focal point is very small and if the headset moves you loose focus or if you look away from centerThe IPD adjustment doesnt go wide enoughThe controllers are small, too smallBottom lineBetter technology worse ergonomicsOdyssey on top in the pic

Awesome beginner vr headset!  Great fun for anyone who wants to start getting into vr games.  Pretty good battery life for an all-in-one system and for the immense power needed to play games like this.  Not the hugest selection of games, but there are absolutely games that make buying this headset worth it!!  Some games you need to have connection to a computer which you can do by getting the vr desktop app or by connecting directly to your computer with a cable.  I recommend cooking simulator vr, blade and sorcery, zero caliber, and foreVR bowl :) great games could play these all day!!

I got this as a gift for my partner. We have played beat saber and Some other games. So fun. But my favorite is the YouTube VR and Prime video VR.Seriously you get to experience a a whole new world. Even non VR videos are on a huge screen that takes up all your vision.PS… Adult Entertainment VR on this is more intense than words can describe 😉👍

The oculus itself is a decent piece of tech, though the eye resolutions are a bit rough and streaming VR videos is a bit buggy. The major issue is with Oculus Link, attempting to use this feature causes immense and disorienting stuttering and freezes in the headset. I scoured the support page, reddit threads, and other forums and there seems to be no solid solution for this issue. I tried a dozen 'fixes', including starting my pc offline and wiping oculus' data and redownloading it after a restart. Until oculus link functions, I cannot recommend this device.

Haven't played video games for years. Got this to keep myself occupied while working out of town this winter. Mainly just play two games normally. Contractors which is the best online shooter game I have ever seen. Thrill of the fight is a boxing game that give you quite a workout in only about 20 minutes. I did deduct a star because the headband that comes with it sucks and battery dies in about an hour and a half. I had to purchase a halo style headband and a power bank with short cord to make this better.
review_title: Love this thing. Needs some improvement though

one_reviews_text: My son loves this he said the quality was very very good and the ability  to watch movies is fantastic. The games are great and you truly do feel like you are in the cockpit when you are flying the plane in the war games.
review_title: This was a gift for my son he's 43.

one_reviews_text: Been using it for a month now, I’m a VR Fanatic, I got the PSVR and is nothing compared to the Oculus Quest 2, the features are amazing, the way you can text your Facebook and instagram friends was good, the store has daily deals, built-in microphone and headphones, is just crazy, I thought I needed my phone connected to the oculus all the time but no, this is a whole new console! Connect it to wifi and you good to go! Watch YouTube, Netflix, web browser or TV.The phone app is just to Cast gameplay and download clips/screenshots you take during game in my opinion because the rest you can do it on the oculus.•The only problem I been having is the weight, after a few minutes my neck starting to hurt because the headset is too heavy for me other than that I have no complains.

I am pretty late to the party about the Quest 2. I only started to become interested in VR ever since my sis got the Valve Index. But I couldn't get one because of the skin irritation people got from wearing the headset. But ever since they announced they will bring it back twice the storage for the same price, it was a no-brainer decision. Then I heard rumors about a new Quest headset getting announced at the end of October. Oh well, I love using the Quest 2 so far. But, if you have an intention to get a Quest headset right now, I suggest you wait until what Facebook has to say.

Good product for non-glass wearer.Very unfriendly to glass wearer: it claims to be fitting for 142mm wide frame, mine is around 135mm, barely fit it.Squeeze my glasses so hard and feels extremely uncomfortable.I compared the width with my galaxy VR (bought a few years ago), the galaxy VR is almost one inch wider than the quest, no wonder it feels so uncomfortable.If you are a glass wearer, please be prepared to buy prescription lens for this.

With upgrades and computer you can stand up there with the best setups. If you are interested in joining a virtual world like VRChat but havent yet. Just buy one of these. If you have computer with a rtx 2070 or better... Definitely buy one of these. With some accessory upgrades this can be a great setup.  You can start from just one of these and work up to whole setup. Its a perfect entry point.  Buy the virtual desktop app and you have a fully wireless pc vr setup. But a BOBOVR halo headstrap and battery and your good to go for hours.
review_title: Best entry level VR experience out now.

one_reviews_text: Great product. Used it for almost 3 weeks. $299 is not much expensive compared with a full set of Index VR($999). Of course, to play games on desktop, index can bring much better experience to players. However, comes to flexibility, Quest 2 is the best for now. No base station is required, just set up the guardian and play at anytime, anyplace. There are many games on oculus store, but they are not very attracted to me. I mostly used it to play desktop games as a replacement of index, my experience is great. Can go wired (oculus link, charging while playing) and fully wireless (air link).Overall, if you are that person like me, want to try VR but don’t want to invest much on it, Quest 2 could be the best option. I don’t like the Facebook company but I appreciate the Quest 2 develop team. They keep adding new features in each experimental update.

These are not worth $300 each. Its a shame you spend $600 and have to purchase 2 copies of the games to play them together. We have spent 2.5 hours on the phone with Customer Support, and absolutely zero help. They finally admitted that the system is broken and the expect it to work by 5/1. Save yourself some money and stick to Xbox.

It’s super fun and the graphics are amazing :)! I was afraid it would be too heavy but it’s very light. It’s comfortable to wear, but I would recommend a $30 elite strap because the white fabric strap gets very dirty and you can’t clean it nicely. An elite strap it also very helpful for active games. The battery time for the console isn’t very good, but there are cons to something as light and power consuming as this. Some elite straps have battery packs, but it’s probably not good for you to be in vr over 2 hours anyway and it might be uncomfortably heavy. The experience of vr is a MUST HAVE, and for 300 bucks and 128gb it’s a STEAL! If you plan to play games like beatsaber, definitely get controller protectors. I am impressed with their durability (I have SMASHED them super hard against each other and my walls) and they haven’t cracked yet but i’m going to quick buy some covers now to be safe. Over all, pretty much all cons are expected results of the pros, and I would recommend!
review_title: Very fun with a few expected cons, still a MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE!!!

one_reviews_text: The image quality is good.  The controls are comfortable.  If you're looking for mobile VR, this will probably work, so long as you don't require a large library of games, because this device has only a handful of decent titles, and the rest of its library is of extremely low quality.Battery life is abysmal.  Device has serious power management issues.  The oculus link cable is advertised as charging it while you use the device.  This is a lie.  A blatant, bold-faced lie.  Don't waste your money on it.
review_title: Looks good on paper.  Serious issues in practice.

one_reviews_text: I take the device out of the box, connect it to my homes wifi, and the thing refuses to install an update. Stuck at "Update 1 of 2 0%" for over an hour. I contacted support over the internet on my PC and they told me to do a factory reset. The thing is literally straight from the factory. But I gave them the benefit of the doubt and followed the instructions for a factory reset. I reconnect to my home wifi and....still stuck at 0% update. I'm not sure what else to do. This was a birthday present for my son.

In terms of the technology, this was everything I had hoped it would be.  The sound is amazing.  The graphics are crisp and clear.However, like many others, I developed a rash on my eyelids and around my eyes, despite using the silicone cover that was provided.Also ... if you wear eyeglasses,  the headset can be downright painful even when using the provided eyeglasses spacer.These two things were so bothersome they made the headset unwearable.  I'm so disappointed that I had to return this product.
review_title: Fantastic Technology.  Poor Design & Choice of Materials.

one_reviews_text: My 13 year-old son said this was his coolest Christmas present! All the adults have enjoyed playing it, too. We explored the world through the Wander app. We had so much fun watching each other, and got some great laughs. Beware if you add the roller coaster. I can’t believe how real it feels. I had horrible motion sickness after that one though. I seriously couldn’t believe that I felt like I was going down the tracks of a coaster while standing in the living room.The only downside for me is that most of the games that he wants cost around $25 or more.It does come with free games, but he gets tired of them pretty quickly.So parents heads up about the games. After you pay the price to buy the VR set, your kid is still going to be asking for more. If anyone figures out how to get a discount code for games, I’d love to know!Another positive would be that it’s actually getting my teen out of his room. He comes in the living room with me to play his games.

I was hesitant to make this purchase, as I was unsure what all I would need to get started, having never used VR before. I had been under the impression that one needed a gaming PC or equivalent console to be able to hook up just to be able to use it, and I was pleasantly surprised to learn this was not the case. I purchased this item almost immediately, and it has not disappointed! The effects and graphics are excellent, the tracking tech is decent, and there are several demos and free apps to get you started. Overall, this was an excellent purchase for a very reasonable price, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to get started with VR!

If your looking to get into VR, this is a great stand alone system. Have had over a month and still not bored of it yet.You can connect it to a PC if you want. I went with the higher memory so I wouldn’t have to worry about storage when buying games.The only down fall is the battery life. Out of the box without adjusting anything, and it ran for almost two 2 hours. Mix of simple games and setting up.Now with increasing hertz refresh and playing games, it last about 1.5 - 1.75 hours. To play longer you can purchase the small battery packs (work great also) to extend the life.The headset only storage is the box it comes with. So don’t throw it out. They sell a kit with better head straps and a battery attached. That is my next purchase for this.Overall very good product and happy with it.  For my first time joining VR this was perfect. I can even take this other places and play with friends. Just be ready to pick up 1-2 accessories and have a Facebook account.
review_title: First time VR people read this review.

one_reviews_text: I would give this Headset a 5 star but there are some pros and cons.Pros:1. Very user friendly, it gives an option to skip tutorials for more experienced users2. Inexpensive compared to other headsets especially standalone with no wires3. The built in speakers are amazing!4. The controllers are very durable, I’ve hit my walls on accident multiple times really hard, and they still work fine5. Very customizableCons:1. Even with the glasses spacer it is not very friendly for glasses users2. Lenses fog up INSANELY quick3. Built in battery life only lasts about 2-4 hours4. The stock headset straps are really uncomfortable after long use and the headset doesn’t really sit securely5. This has only happened a couple times to me, but it is a serious problem. When playing, the headset loses tracking of the controllers for a couple seconds, then they work just fine. I don’t know if this is from smacking them up against a wall or the sensors problemBesides all of the cons, this headset is DEFINITELY worth it. I got addicted instantly and it’s a great way to work out and play games at the same time. It is a PERFECT gift for anyone. I recommend buying a couple additional things like the elite strap and a charging dock, other than that, this thing is amazing! 10/10 would buy another.

The Quest is great and we are quite enjoying it but I am pretty certain the package I received was used. The charging cable was outside of the included accessories box and strewn across the top of the headset and controllers. The included silicone cover had some random hairs on it that looked to be from a pet, and the enclosed instructions cards/manuals were haphazardly inside the box. the item itself seems to work fine so far, but was still surprised to receive such a pricey item packaged like this.

This is a great learning tool for kids and adults alike. It is fun, entertaining, and a great device for acquiring knowledge. I am able to watch my favorite movies on Netflix or go to Autotrip for a fun but challenging workout.  I can also meditate out in the stretosphere on the Tripp app.  I have learned different meditation techniques; such as, focus, peace and relaxation on this  app.  There are so many things to see and do. I think every household should have an Oculus quest.

I have a good time with the quest.  I use it more for fitness but do play some games with friends and I've been starting to use it for work.  There is a lot more to do with this other than gaming.  However, if you wear glasses I would highly suggest get an updated prescription and buy prescription inserts.  I did not use it for months until I got some.  The original quest had far better room and better p.d. adjustments.  If you try this with glasses you will have comfort issues and easily scratch the vr lenses.
review_title: It's fun but if you wear glasses...

one_reviews_text: This occulus is a very entertaining gadget. You can travel the world with some of the software that it picks up via internet and facebook. It also has 3d games that you can play and it is truly an imersive 3d experience. You can also watch movies on it from Netflix, Prime, Utube and others. Very entertaining for the price.

LO BUENO:Simplemente la mejor compra en gaming que he hecho en años, en cuanto a independencia, tecnología, calidad y precio.Estéticamente me encantó, colores sobrios, muy buena calidad, si nunca habías probado la realidad virtual como yo, te sentirás muy inverso en los lentes, tanto así que hasta golpeé todo lo que tenía a mi alrededor sin querer, y tanto a los lentes como a los mandos, no les ocurrió nada, ni un rasguño.Con la memoria de 256 gb, más que suficiente, super fluido, rápido, cómodo, INTUITIVO sobre todo.LO MALO:Esto la verdad es que es más personal, y no para todos, sino para la minoría, encontraremos que el sistema elástico de las gafas, resulta muy incómodo, hasta llegar a doler la zona donde se apoya en nuestra cabeza.De igual forma la esponja donde apoyas tu rostro, en lo personal es molesta, y me causó dolor y un poco de irritación en cortos periodos de uso, lo bueno es que viene con una funda de silicona, muy fácil de colocar y soluciona TODO, literal, muy bueno y viene incluido.El aparato, luego de mucho uso y de exigirlo con juegos que piden un poco más que el resto, se calienta, hasta llegar a dar calor en la zona de los ojos, lo cual es muy entendible si lo estamos exigiendo de forma independiente. Desconozco si sucede lo mismo cuando lo usamos con PCVR.Puede ocasionar mareo en un principio, en lo personal, bastante, hasta tener que acostarme, porque la vista la sientes super rara, sientes el cuerpo raro, ves tus manos y piensas que no son tuyas, un mareo increíble, que por suerte solo me sucedió en un principio.COSAS QUE SON REALES PERO NO AFECTAN:Los gráficos no son nada increíble en algunos juegos, que si bien hay que entender que es un sistema que los corre de forma independiente, estos no son gráficos de ultima generación ni mucho menos, al contrario, hay juegos bastante pobres gráficamente. Sobre esto, nada que preocuparse, ya que la inmersión es tanta, que los gráficos es lo último en lo que te percatas, literal, puedes tirarte muchas horas en vrchat por ejemplo, y los gráficos seran lo de menos.El tracking o seguimiento del cuerpo, es solo de brazos hacía arriba, pero muy buenos, así que ni lo sientes, en lo personal si compraría más accesorios para trackear el cuerpo, pero desde luego no es nada necesario.Eso es todo, si quieres comprarlo, en lo personal es muy bueno, además es increíble que me salga el doble de barato que comprandolo en mi país y encima siendo la mejor versión, incluso pagando la tasa de importación.PD: el envío fue lo mejor, era envío gratis y me llegó en 7 días,  un amigo realizó la misma compra, envío gratis y le llegó en 4 días, nada, la mejor experiencia en todas sus partes.
review_title: La mejor compra que he hecho en años

one_reviews_text: We love it so much that we got 2 more so we can have friends over and he/she can use the third one. It was not hard to follow the onscreen instruction to get it set up, but it was a bit confusing at first when trying to pair with your phone. You definitely need facebook for now to be able to sign in and use it.The games are fun, we play a lot of mutiplayer games, and for those who suffers motion sickness like I do (I have ringing ears and vertigo, get yourself a fan blowing at yourself plus take some of those verb liquid for motion sickness that you can rub behind your ears), they will help or get games that have teleport feature.The headset is bad, consider getting a more comfortable headshet or it will feel very front heavy. The bettery life for the head unit is about 2hrs. while the batteries can last over a month of here and there using it.One thing though, if you PLAN to share the quest 2 with another person, the 128g will be divided by 2 users (meaning, each user will have 64g of space for games and such), and if you have three people sharing one, it will devide the space for 3 users... so you have limited space. That said, if you plan to share it with 3 users and creating 3 acounts on one quest 2, you can set primary and share that to the other two users within the headset, and if that's the case, get the 256g one for 3 users sharing would be my suggestion.

Lets me first start off by saying if it wasn't for the painfully short battery life on this thing, it would be 5 stars. My only other complaint is the elastic band. I have a lot of hair and it slips off my head a little too often during high movement games like beat saber especially if you start to sweat, the headset is front heavy and starts to slide down your face which can really jack up your vision during some games. Constantly having to fix it isn't really convenient. However, all that aside, the quest is fun and works well.

The adjustable straps that help tighten/loosen it around your head is a nice little touch. The only thing that i dislike about it is how fast it dies. Playing it continuously for two hours minimum drains the battery significantly. On the contrary, it does not take long to charge back up to 100. Another thing i like is the amount of battery life the controllers have. The controllers come with batteries already in them and do not die quickly. Another thing, the tracking is pretty good. There are a few glitches here and there but as long as you are in proper lighting the tracking works great.

Not gna lie. I was a bit skeptical to purchase this from Amazon instead of in store, but it was my only option for my sons birthday since our local game stores didn’t have them in stock at the time. But I must say, when I received it in the mail, I was shocked! Came sooner than expected, packaged beyond well & very secure in box. My son loves it & has had ZERO issues with it since purchasing. HIGHLY RECOMMEND 💯

The Quest 2 is the way to go VR. Wireless is really awesome. I already had the wired version which I thought was terrific, but wireless is much better. The thing I like best is that it contains a web browser. I can watch Netflix, log onto my Facebook account, virtually anything I can do with my laptop, I can do with Quest 2. It also is backward compatible with my old VR set, which allows me to use all of the Apps I bought for it. I just turn on my laptop and link my Quest 2 to the laptop using the app that comes with Q 2. Couldn't be happier.

First Time With VR Easy To Setup for direct use, But Facebook Instantly Banned My Account When I made It, and due to it being the weekend I had to wait till Monday (I think I set it up on Friday evening), it works well but I was pretty upset that it took so long to get it ready for PC use. I wish the battery would stay alive while using it in my PC, perhaps I need a more powerful USB power port as the wall outlet works fine with perpetual use (though I can't tolerate it after like 2 hours). It's cheap, works and it's not a bad first experience. If you don't mind facebook as a company I guess you won't mind this one.
review_title: First Time With VR Easy To Setup, But Facebook Instantly Banned My Account When I made It.

one_reviews_text: Facebook deactivated our 2 accounts after only 3 days of having the oculus, making these very expensive paper weights. The reason they deactivated us was they didn’t recognize our new computers that we logged onto FB. There isn’t a support chat our number to call to get it fixed either. Maybe they would have reinstated us but it’s scary that we could have spent $1000 on games and they can just deactivate us with no reason at any time. Facebook is cancer. We knew singing back on FB for this was a bad idea and should have followed our guts. It would have saved us a lot of trouble. We’re just going to hold out for the Apple one coming out this year.

This is amazing! My boyfriend absolutely loved is as a Christmas gift. Because the quest 2 is a mix of a console itself and a VR headset you can hook up to your computer, there are pros for buying games either through the oculus store or through steam. I suggest getting simple party games through oculus (ie job simulator) and buying games that can be modded on steam (ie boneworks).However, while there are some games that don’t require any distance moment (such as walking/running) a lot do and they’re very disorienting if you get motion sick. A pretty good indicator of whether or not you’ll be sick when playing on the quest 2 is if you get dizzy watching videos that are POV/spin frequently (ie the movie Mad Max)
review_title: Perfect gift if you don’t get motion sick

one_reviews_text: This is a great entry level VR headset for kids and adults.  Like others have said the only downside is that you need a Meta (Facebook) account.  If you are tech savvy you can create a simple gmail and Meta account that does not get flagged. (Very easy if you are worried about privacy).  Told they will be removing this requirement in the future.  Provides hours of fun.  Highly recommend getting the Link cable so you can connect to pc and play other games.  May actually buy another just so we can play against each other as a family or when the kids have friends over.  Definitely recommend as you will not be disappointed for the price.
review_title: Great entry level VR for both kids and adults

one_reviews_text: The virtual reality videos are awesome and the roller coasters are like being there.  However, the headset is uncomfortable and digs into your face.  I tried all kinds of adjustments and researched it on the internet but could not get it comfortable.  Also, a couple of the movie apps didn't work.  So, I  returned the system.

I don’t typically get motion sickness, but boy oh boy, Oculus has made me queasy a bunch of times. So do it in short time frames consistently.Also if you have glasses, it’s a bit tricky, even with the headset accommodation. I thought I’d exercise some but my glasses just fog up and the fit is odd.So I’ve enjoy the 360 videos (relaxing) on YouTube and I loved the rollercoaster (until I got motion sick).It will take some getting use to. But I love it even with the quirks.

No issues aside from trying to cast it so I can watch my husband play and vice versa but that's an occulus issue not amazon. It does make me motion sick and my husband as well and he normally doesn't have that issue any other time. Take some dramamine and it helps some. The games are super short and expensive but again that is an oculus thing not Amazon.

I always buy something just-for-me for Christmas, and this is what I chose. I was hoping that all the hype that I heard about this, would be correct. And boy was it ever. I am 64, and love this gadget. The games, OMG, so real. I love that Saber Beat game, and I love the Jurassic Park World, just unreal on how this fun game is for Seniors..haha, I can even do my exercise without going to the gym. Now I can spend more time in home during the winter and have loads of fun. Thank you for this Amazon, You rock!

OMG, this is the bomb! I never care for video games or understood what the big deal was about them until I play the Quest. This system is awesome. It allow me to step out of reality for a few minutes. I find myself staying on it until the battery dies. I truly enjoy this game system.  I even brought all the accessories so I would not have a reason why I couldn't play or enjoy the full effect of the scenarios. It is something worth experiencing.  It is a good investment.....at least it was for me.

I had been waiting for a headset that balanced mobility and affordability before I jumped into the VR world, and this is it!! Having the whole system in the headset is a big game changer, and the battery life is long enough to get some good plays in (and short enough to remind me to take a break!). I thought the memory would be an issue, but 128 is plenty for the current VR game landscape. Overall super satisfied and would totally recommend!

-Much heavier than the oculus rift. You'll be feeling it on your face the entire time.-No earphones; another step down.-Extremely fragile components-Cheap plasticy feel. Seems like they cut corners in production.-Setup is a nightmare. When trying to pair it to your phone, as required, be wary of it bricking your device like it did mine. One factory reset and half a dozen attempts later, it finally connected for updates.-Charger cable is the shortest I haver ever seen-No visual indication on the plugs or ports what is right side up; bend an internal pin and you're paying for repairs or buying a new one.-Glasses spacer leaves about an inch extra where you nose should be, if you're secretly a bird then its just perfect for fitting your beak-Controllers are weirdly shaped. They don't feel natural in your hand at all.+ It powers on quickly+ The visual quality is a step up from the rift.+ The airlink allows you to connect to your pc without any additioonal cable, albeit with high requirements from both system performance and net speed.+ The calibration of Guardian was quick and painless compared to the rift, with obvious improvements in functionality. You're given the option to physically map the floor location,  and 'spray' on the boundary lines from a distance.I would suggest looking into other options in addition to the quest 2, then choose what features and drawbacks you can live with.

Once you figure things out (or, as I did, let my kids figure it out, then show me) the Oculus is a blast.  It is one step closer to the Oasis (from the book Ready Player One) (don't bother with the sequel book, it stunk).  The unit controls and hand controls are simple to use, and the pre-loaded games are enough to get going right out of the box.  Need a separate device if you want to cast to a tv, but they are inexpensive.  As a surprise gift to the family at Christmas, it was a big hit.

Yeah, its freedom unlike never before, but theres only like 20 games, if you want more games, real games. You have to do a bunch of extras to attempt to get more games hooking it up to a pc buying extras to maybe get more games, then you dont have that freedom anymore. Not enough game demos. The movement is idiotic especially in resident evil 4. The list goes on the prices for games are way to high. The free games suck. Is it worth the money, no. Watching movies or browsing the internet is just a big screen far to close to the eyes. Nothing about this product is magical. Am i writting this review to be helpful, kind of, but no. Im here to complain. Why would a couple of billionaires care if the product sucks. They get money no matter what because people pay for it to suck, then tell people its so good.

This is the perfect headset for anyone looking to get into virtual reality. It only takes 10-15 minutes to set up, and is very easy to use. It's wireless, and you don't need anything else to get playing, just the headset. Within 10 minutes I was fully set up and playing a climbing game. If you have a VR-Ready PC then you have the option to use a feature called Airlink where you can play PC-Exclusive games on your Quest 2 wirelessly. I definitely recommend buying this headset, especially at the amazing price of $299.Some games I recommend: Eleven Table Tennis, The Climb 2, Superhot VR, Beat Saber, Gorn, Rec Room, VR Chat, Pavlov Shack, and Boneworks (PC-Exclusive)

No one should be forced or given an option to own a product after you join their platform. Should be free to do that therefore I’m returning it back.  So sorry I wanted it so much then the requirement of having to join a social platform that I’m not a fan of!! You can have it all day long!!!zuckerberg. You can’t block me for speaking my mind!!

I bought two sets for my Sons family . EVERYBODY loves them. The neighborhood kids are always at my Sons playing anyway and I knew an extra set would come in handy ! But there are still kids and adults waiting to try them out. I have some and it is awesome . I can see myself getting into a game with people from all over and not wanting to stop. For one of my grandsons it was so real to him , that in one of the games he walked off a cliff , and he he fell to the floor,  his legs giving out because he ,for a few seconds, thought he was falling.  Oh just when you get yours be sure and get the head lining piece. It makes it so much more comfortable. I don't see anyone not liking this . It should come with I feel , since it doesn't , its well worth the few bucks !
review_title: The future is here , and Oculus is just the beginning!

one_reviews_text: I don't use this headset a whole lot, but it's still pretty cool. There just isn't a lot of content yet, and the content that is there costs money, so I mainly use it to watch anime and talk on VRChat, which is free. For what it's worth, the graphics are really good. I remember playing a VR game with a headset back in the 90s at a carnival or something, and this blows those old graphics out of the water. Tech really has come a long, long way. Now the question becomes: Is VR going to be a passing fad, or will lots of people start using it in their daily lives? As of now, I use it maybe once or twice a week, and I can't say I'd ever use it more than that. Then again, though, that's what I said about Facebook back in the day, and look where we are now.
review_title: Not a ton of content yet, but it's pretty cool.

one_reviews_text: 1 month later and I'm troubleshooting how to get past all the software workarounds to get this device set up with a game. If you buy another game through another vendor, please note that this device is NOT going to make things easy for you. Nothing has been streamlined at all.In theory, the Quest 2 makes perfect sense. In execution, I'm still trying to hook up Steam VR to make this smooth.If you're looking at this for Steam VR, consider anything else.

I love the Oculus Quest 2 so far - mostly.  Connecting it to my PC via the link cable (USB C to 3.1) or AirLink both give me problems.  There is also some confusing info on the support page, however the product itself is really solid. Good visuals, lightweight, controllers work very well.  Everything so far has been impressive from watching 3D movies, to games (like RE 4 VR).At $299 it is well worth the money just don't plan on receiving any promotions that amazon promises with it. (Not Oculus)
review_title: Pretty Great Product...Promotional $50 credit never received though.

one_reviews_text: State of the art item that seems so much more advanced than the original oculus rift. No wires, sensors to set up, nothing. Just turn on and play. because the headset itself is the console. The spacer for eyeglasses is what sold me, but if you have a large glasses, maybe try buying prescription lenses (yes, that's a thing!) for about $30. You can insert the lenses and play without your glasses! Hoping more games come out soon. Especially social interactive ones where friends can play with you on their phones.
review_title: i've been waiting for this all year

one_reviews_text: I first got into VR several years ago with the original Vive, which I paid $600 for. And at the time that was a good price. But what many of us in VR agreed on is that while the tech is great, we need more people using it. We need more gamers and developers in the VR space, and $600 on top of a gaming PC, with a wire leading to the tower and laser devices to screw to your walls, it was never going to happen.The Quest has solved all of this. At a price point of $300 for the newest quest, you absolutely cannot match this value with any other VR hardware. On top of that, you don't need a gaming PC at all; this system is ready to boot and play for any adult or child right out of the box. This is absolutely revolutionary. And since we have the privilege of buying in 2021/22 instead of a few years ago, you're paying $300 (or less on sale) for a headset that is more capable in every way than the Vive I paid $600 for a few years ago. Compared to the Vive it is lighter, cooler, more comfy, has more naturally ergonomic controllers, and here's the big one: higher pixel density and virtually no screen door effect.You are stealing this device from facebook for $300.

I am new to the VR world. I am so amazed at how great it is. I love that you can do other things besides play games. Directions could have been a little bit clearer on certain things but I figured it out thanks to YouTube. I do recommend getting the elite strap with battery. You’ll need the extra battery life and it’s more comfortable.  Also get a better silicone VR face mask with the nose enclosure. The one that comes with it doesn’t have the nose enclosure and you can see out if you look down by your nose.

On the better side is the improved optics.  On the worse side is the head straps.  There are many more, but since I only use the VR for a few thins, I give it a 4 for overall and the improvement over the first version.  I DO NOT APPRECIATE having to log in via Facebook.  THAT SUCKS and makes we want to drop this to 2 stars, but that seemed unfair.

I'm a 63 year old man who doesn't play games, but I love this product. Being able to go anywhere in the world and walk around in vr through the Wander app is just amazing. Watching movies on Netflix and Amazon is like being at a theatre and the Youtube vr videos are great. Watching some of the  regular hd youtube music videos is like being at a concert or seeing a musical live.I think this is a steal at $300.

I bought this so that I could play VR Chat on the Oculus since PSVR didn’t have it. It’s quite amazing, the graphics itself are amazing and the best part about it is that it’s all WIRELESS so I don’t have to worry about tangled wires or tripping over them. I never understood why people were so frustrated about using a Facebook account, just either use your Facebook account or create one and that’s all, it’s not like it’s stealing your information or asking for your whole phone number or SSN. It’s such a simple setup and an even better VR Experience. I cannot wait to start playing Resident evil 4 VR on here. Best $300 I ever spent!!!!
Was supposed to get a $50 gift code and never received it. Very disappointed I didn't get what was advertised to me other than that the oculus quest 2 is great
review_title: Was supposed to get a $50 gift never did

one_reviews_text: I have not been able to log into my account for about 2 months now. I enjoyed it while it was working but suddenly I couldn't log into my account to access the games I purchased. There is no phone help and i did try email help but never received a response. Buy at your own risk.

It's blurry, looking through it is the whole point, so it's trash. Adjusting it didn't fix it. Others have complained about this so clearly they don't care. Good luck with your horrible metaverse Zuckerberg, here's $300

Completely useless and I am not complaining about a Facebook account.  This thing has allot of issues.  Controllers not working, blurry, loose tacking easily, not to say there is not much to do with this.  Every VR headset has issues.  Today’s technology is not ready for this yet.  Hopefully these issues will be fixed in the near future.  Warning do not buy a VR headset right now.  None are worth buying.  Stop using it because I get frustrated with the issues.

I bought 2 of these for my kids for Christmas.  They both worked without any issues, very easy.  Just charged them up, logged into Facebook (used my account for both of them without any issues, didn't have to create 2 accounts), and the kids were off and playing!  Excellent video and sound.  It is nice that I was able to log in to my FB account on both, and when we download a new game it gives the option of installing the game on both or just on one.  I HIGHLY recommend these with no reserve!

The Quest II is built solidly, if you want a budget VR headset for a child this would be it. It's standalone which means no gaming PC is required but one can be connected should you wish to play SteamVR games.But this is at the cost of requiring a Facebook account for regular use. This is non-negotiable and is an absolute travesty. I have tried out the little loophole method of installing an older Oculus app on the phone but all that resulted in was the VR headset automatically factory resetting after each power down and restart.Go away Zukker.
review_title: Excellent Hardware, Garbage Facebook Account Requirement

one_reviews_text: I love this device. I've only had it for 2 weeks and wasn't sure if I was going to like this but so far I am enjoying every game I purchased and I'm enjoying the VR experience. My favorite games are Beat Saber, OhShape and Synth Riders. If you want to burn some calories and have fun at the same time then these are just some of the games that'll help you do so. The only con is the battery life, I would recommend a battery bank to prolong usage. So far, so good. I'm satisfied with my purchase.

Just love it. The epic roller-coaster makes you feel like your really riding one, but don't have to wait in line. The bowling is awesome I now have a bowing ally in my house. Even if you don't play games there's a lot you can do take tour of places you never been. Put you in the movie scenes possibilities are endless there also alot of free apps. I highly recommend it.

This has overtaken my life! I use this every single day! I LOOOOOOVE the supernatural workout app!!! It makes working out so much fun! I love being able to watch my fave movies and shows like I'm in a movie theater an I LOVE that I can connect with my long distance friends and family over games and movies! I. LOVE. THIS!!!!! Oculus has changed my life!

I have been doing exercise video games for years to keep me moving.  This year I just could not do those cds one more time.  Boring!  Finally bit the bullet and got me a quest 2.  Well I’m boxing ugly opponents and ghosts , I’m slashing boxes with a saber, I’m rock climbing, riding rollercoasters  and even meditating.  Best decision I’ve made in awhile.  And I’ve only had it for a few days!  Picture is my home base - a ski lodge in the alps or someplace.  So cool.

My son uses this for VR chat and loves it.  I play shooter games and beat Saber and I love it.  Neither of us have ever had any issues with motion sickness or stuttering.  I just bought a second one so I can do the fitness and meditation stuff when I want to.  I love the different backgrounds you can use and the fact that you don't have to use the controllers, you can use your hands without buying any other gear. It's very 'Minority Report' for me. I love it!

To put it simply, this headset is great if you want to play supported apps on the device itself. Anything outside of that is luck of the draw. I primarily bought this to pair up with my pc as affordable as it is in comparison to other VR products. My computer is up to spec for VR and I have a USB C cable that transfers 2.5 GB/s. It won't work as they say it will. I have heard through the internet that others have had similar issues as me. Airlink worked for the first day I had it but no longer works either. Tried ensuring my pc and software were as up to date as possible, reinstalling drivers, different cords, reinstalling drivers from device manager, disabling discrete graphics, etc etc. Trust me as a programmer/IT guy I tried a good 8 hours of various troubleshooting but it will not work. Avoid this product if you are buying to use with a PC. Your mileage may vary but I was only able to connect and use it once through airlink and only once at that. Also last I checked their support page is broken so good luck getting into support. Extremely disappointed on the false advertising of how simple and easy it is to use with PC. I'll choose differently next time.
review_title: Good luck if you want to use this with your PC

one_reviews_text: I wear glasses and I can't get these to focus properly so that the image looks sharp. When you use the headset with glasses you also can't move your eyes, you have to look straight the whole time or the image will become super blurry. If I put in contacts it works pretty well though.I would give it 3 stars but you are required to sign up for Facebook to use this, I'm strongly considering returning it just because of that.
review_title: Not good if you wear glasses

one_reviews_text: The tech is very good. As many have said head strap changes , battery add ons may enhance your experience. Biggest cons: don’t expect to put this on the market and expect kids to not ask for this, especially if they see it in another household. That is what happened to us.  The lack of timers/ parental controls on like on every other major platform is a major problem. It’s coding a lot of fights to turn it off, and my kids have manage to download inappropriate content despite trying to watch while it is casting on the TV ( the tv doesn’t show someone’s peripheral view and everything they are clicking on)

Intellivision turned me off gaming in the 80’s until the Oculus Quest 2.  All my friends had Atari with a joy stick and red button.  My dad thought I needed to be unique and play with a keypad and circular disk.  6814 pass.  6815 punt.  DAMN IT!  You know how many second down punts I’ve had in my gaming career?!?!  And 6913 drop the ball.  WTH?!  When is that a play you call?!?!Just got an Occulus Quest 2.  This thing is awesome!  Highly recommend it.  WAY better than the Intellivision of 1982.
