 Very entertaining. Graphics are realistic and definitely makes it seem like you are in the game.  Also received my item 2 weeks earlier than expected.  Highly recommend!

I stopped buying game consoles when they started the big lie of backward compatibility and prices went insane. I still own my last console a still working NES. I came across the Oculus and read info on it and finally received one for Christmas. What an awesome peice of hardware. I've been having fun doing all sorts of things in it including playing with a little mouse in a game called Moss. There is so much to do even without buying anything besides the Oculus itself!

This headset is terrific. I need to wear glasses most of the time, but this headset works fine without them. The resolution is great for the most part, thought text is a little hard to read if it's further than around 60 centimeters away, and the controllers feel great. I have 3 gripes, however. Firstly, the FOV is quite bad and I often get annoyed by how little I can see with my peripheral vision.On top of this, the headstrap hard to adjust and feels like it might fall off my head at any moment, and moving my head at any significant speed bumps it around and I have to readjust it (on a side note, I would recommend using the top strap to hold it on your head. Don't keep the headset pulled onto your face with the side straps. Those are to stop it moving around).And Finally, there is a lot of light that gets let in at the bottom of the headset and is quite distracting.In conclusion, the software and hardware of the headset itself is almost perfect, but the things surrounding that are less-than-stellar. I'd certainly recommend this headset though, as it is very cheap for what it is and only requires a single cable to connect it to your PC if you want to use Link. On a sidenote of using Link, don't use the cables on your case. Use the ones on your MOBO. This stopped my link from constantly crashing and reconnecting.

The device works as well and smoothly as i'd hope, but the fact that all things in the market place are no less than 12 dollars, often times more than 20, makes it feel like I payed 400 dollars for something i can explore inch by inch. There are free things like VR chat, and roller coaster vr but it's not worth 400 dollars. The games I paid for were amazing and fun, but I'd appreciate a little more than just watching tv in vr and trying to get VR chat to stop closing.My biggest issue however is the inability to be flexible for mods and custom works that are legal. I spent almost 2 hours googling and reading to only come out with a headache and countless pages on how to set up a group for making and selling games and content on the store, just to download mods and expand my fun with the device.Overall I'd say you can buy it as long as you have the 400 dollars and about 60 or 70 dollars extra to spend on the marketplace.
review_title: It works, but the options are limited.

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Oculus because my Grandfather has one, and let me try his out. Beat Saber is a GREAT workout. Unfortunately, the Oculus Store doesn't let you use Gift Cards. I try to limit how many places have my card info. Nintendo eShop, PSN, XBox Live, Google Play, Apple Store... they ALL have gift cards. Oculus does not. I had to connect it to PayPal to have ANY kind of security that I actually trust. This is ridiculous.

You should, you must experience the VR !!!And Oculus Quest is the cheapest way, i think... Its own games are great, but you can also buy the same games from Steam Store and download into the console. Yes it like a console, and another great thing is, it is standalone, you don't need any cables or something else.When you want to connect to PC, you can establish a connection with Airlink. It's also wireless!! But the disadvantage is Airlink drains the battery very well, like drinking it :)I've tried the Euro Truck Sim with a beta VR uptade and I'm shocked... Because when you watch the VR videos on YouTube or similar platforms, you couldn't see the true VR vision, because the monitors draws only 2D views, but in the VR set, there is a 3D modelled view, and it feels also very real.When i played ETS, i feel like i'm in the truck cabin, and i tried to touch the steering wheel :)I recommend every player, it's a great product.

Trying on the quest 2 for the first time was a very awesome experience. I had trouble making everything look clear. If i tried turning my eyes to look at something it would look grainy/blurry. I would need to turn my head to directly look at what i wanted to look at with clarity. I got the hang of it but after using it for 3x, about 30mins to an hour each time, i would always feel nausea/motion sickness. My eyes would feel strain as well. And if your wondering i would set the headset off my eyes and onto my head throughout the playtime, either during loading times, death in games, or just to drink some water or talk to family. I never thought a gaming product would make me feel sick like this. Im use to playing on my ps4 for more then 2hrs.Other than the nausea i felt like there was a lack of content on the store to purchase and very few youtube videos you were able to watch from. Also i imagined more control over my animated hands in a few games and free trails but you were restricted to a few hand gestures... it was a nice experience still and definitely on the right track but i will wait untill the technology is there to make the vr feel more immersive and enhance the visuals.
review_title: Pretty neat product but i would get nausea after using it

one_reviews_text: Got this for my husband for the holidays. Our kids get two weeks off for the holiday break and between the 4 of us, I think it was used pretty much all our waking hours. The graphics were way better than I expected and my kiddos used it so much, their arms got a workout! Because of Covid, it really did help pass the time and the boys surprised me as they did not argue for more time, but were excited to take turns and share their experiences after their turns.

Entertainment:  great time.  Lots of fun.Comfort:  without the extended battery pack, the headset is somewhat uncomfortable and front-heavy.  Additionally, those prone to motion sicknessmay have issues with certain games.Game store:  good amount of games and content available

I saw some videos on social medias. I thought it was another video game such as Nintendo switch. Everything is 3D and 360 degrees! I'm mind blown! I'm an avid of among us game! Cannot wait til it gets released to this! Excited my sister will be buying one for herself! Beat saber is my favorite way to get my anger out. Hoping to try supernatural soon!I'm not sure where the negative reviews comes from but give it a try won't hurt! 🙂

The battery charge on this device doesn’t last very long and the charging cable is too short. The other thing that is very annoying is how you can’t play without a Facebook account which is unsettling because of how much info the company collects from you….

This thing is awesome! I love how not only can my son or I enjoy playing games, but the family can also. There are many multi-player games and single player games and you can play a ton of them offline!The only thing is for a new product I think it messes up a bit often. It crashes at least once every few days and will randomly black out as though thinking the user took the headset off often.My family has been using it since Dec 24, 2021.

Honestly I've been looking into VR for a long time, and this has to be one of the best ways to enter the VR scene. It performs incredibly well standalone; as well as when connected to a high powered pc. This is the best cheap option for VR that exists.The whole Meta thing is a bit of a bummer, as having to have facebook to use it is a bit rough. But those shortcomings are not something to hesitate over. This thing is WELL worth the money.This isnt high end VR, but thats not what its for. So if you're in the market and are looking for something cheap and easy to use, GET THE META QUEST 2 NOW.

This is not the first time I tried vr. But before it's with my phone. This one set with hand I can actually hold a pingpong ball with left hand and right hand with the bat. I feels good. And for the shooting game. It changes everything. Can you imagine shooting like John wick in another game. Although, the resolution still not natural enough. You still can feel the pixels. And if you watch movie . It's like we are back to 90s. anyway. It's still a good investment for beginners

I've toyed around with VR here and there since the late 90s. Prototypes at science centers to the Nintendo virtual boy to cell phone kits to the Oculus rift developer and consumer models. All have been enjoyable, but the virtual boy and cell phone models were too basic, and the prototypes and rift being tethered limited the immersion. Finally, the quest 2 comes along gives a really great experience both as a stand-alone device for more basic games and a wireless pcvr device for the higher end games. Right now it's the best option available for great vr experience. Highly recommend.

I've had so much fun with this thing.  Such a great value.  Hoping the next version has additional cameras for tracking as I play a ton of first person shooters and when you have your trigger hand up where it's supposed to be, the tracking is subpar as there really is only one camera that can see your controller when it's up there by your chin.  So your gun will start moving around without your hand moving.  It's super obnoxious 5% of the time.

What an absolute POS. I solely bought this because I was so thrilled to play resident evil 4. It played it amazing for the first week I had it. Let it sit for about 2 months or so as I had to move and had other things such as work to take care of. Now turning it back on it’s plagued by updates that won’t finish and games that won’t update either. I’ve hard reset it everything you can imagine and it’s still a brick…. Also no way to clear app cache, meaning any game application that you have that it decides it can’t open or play anymore has to be re downloaded and good luck with that. It’s a shame. You’d think a tech giant this big would know better? I guess the moral of my experience is it’s great in the beginning but don’t ever let it sit or it will brick itself with mountains of unnecessary updates that the system can’t recover from.

I never thought I would enjoy virtual reality. It always looked clunky and outdated. Once I signed into my new Oculus Quest 2 my opinion was swayed. The graphics have come a long way and more and more innovative games are being released every day. I can feel like a real life Alien-hunter or medieval warrior. This was the prefect gift for me, an avid game who is looking for something ew and surprisingly enjoyable.

I never thought i would own one of these, then i saw some guy on Amazon showing how he never expected to love this thing either, but i must admit it’s so awesome, movies videos on YouTube which is great on this thing. 3D is phenomenal seriously, watch the short clip called “Lost” pretty amazing stuff. The variety this thing offers was not expected. I love it

Absolutely amazing but uncomfortable. Awkward strap and it gets hot fast. Within my first few minutes of playing it it got so hot I had to turn it off. Needs some kind of ventilation and it's messed up that you have to spend so much more money trying to make it more practical. Light weight controllers but feel very weak. Blurry unless sitting 100% perfectly. Guardian gets stuck so low and even resetting it won't help. Only fixed it twice. Maybe I received one that just wasn't as how it should be. Worth the money but most definitely flawed.

Everything about this is really easy to use and super cool...except my head/neck did get really sore pretty quickly.My son saved up and got it for himself -  I won't purchase anymore electronics as he already has a switch, Xbox and (an old neighbor's) play station, but I have to admit it is really fun for me as well. There are apps for meditation, exercise, social platforms, games, movies and more. There are a lot of free ones and the pay apps are very reasonable.The 2 things for parents to be (pretty) cautious of are the social platforms and the time allowed in vr.

I LOVE IT!!!! However, two hours can fly by super quick when u are having fun. Otherwise, it was the best purchase I've ever made. I'm still getting into it but it's totally worth it. I get so lost in Beat Saber it's unreal. It's a massive stress reliever for me. Id definitely buy again.
review_title: Only 2 hrs of game time and battery dies

one_reviews_text: I loved playing with my son’s VR that I wanted my own so we can play together. I loved how it felt like I was in my own world from some people that you think they are friends and they aren’t. Anyway lol. I have a blast playing with it. Walk around Mini Golf it’s a blast. No rainy weather or driving to get there and also seasonal weather don’t changes lol. Thank you everyone for your making this. I’ve always loved playing games since Atari 2600. My first

Am absolutely WILD about this gadget!  I get all my housework done so that I can drift off into "virtual reality."  ha!  My husband got one too as he loved it immediately.  I can't tell you how calming this is to put on and even just sit in the lobby.  It's like another world.  I'm 53 and my husband is 60.  We are madly in love with these things!  We're going to get the bowling app soon and start playing each other.  AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!

Disappointed the way this product arrived. Box ripped, parts of item thrown back in box, obviously it was returned and sent back out without the condition of the product even checked. This was bought as a gift for my son and arrived the day before his birthday.  I did give it to him and he says it’s functioning properly, no damage, he had to factory reset it someone else registered the product in there name. If your going to resend returned products to other customers as a new item then inspect the item and make sure that’s the way it’s arriving, it’s a pricey investment to arrive the way it did. Im giving it a lower rating because of this not because of the product itself.

What can I say?  It was the perfect gift for his 13th B-Day.  Everything about it is fantastic.  I still can't believe how far technology has come.  It's truly amazing.  Back in the 80's, this is something I dreamed about as a kid and it's finally arrived.  And much better than expected.
review_title: My 13 year-old son absolutely loves it!

one_reviews_text: I got this not really knowing what to expect.  I can tell you that every person in my family loves this!  The graphics for many games are absolutely amazing!  The "Guardian" also works well so you're not bumping into things with the headset on.  The only thing I don't really like is that you need a Facebook account, or need create one.  Other than that, this product really surpassed all my expectations.  They got a real winner with the Oculus Quest 2.

This thing is ok for kids not for for pc gaming its garbage needs to be constantly connected to internet otherwise it won't work it's like it needs to constantly collect info from user if you want it for a kid it's good expensive but good if you want it for pc games don't waist your money and another thing the oculus app is full of spyware most likely so if want a ton of spyware on your phone and your pc go ahead get

So I got this for a Christmas present and have loved using it almost everyday!!! I love how much you can do with it and how much fun it is!If you have anything that needs to be done, DO IT BEFORE YOU PUT THE HEADSET ON! LOL Anytime  I put the Oculus on, I play some games and watch some videos or movies and then t thing I know it’s 5 hours later lolCouple things about this particular brand I am not fond of is it does not Bluetooth to my Samsung TV without a chrome cast. If I cast it to my iPhone, I have to mirror it that way to my TV but the quality is horrible and the sound does not cast to TV still. I also wanted to use my new MacBook to stream or play online games through headset but have not found a way to do that without having a gaming PC. Also I am not impressed by the Battery life AT ALL! I feel like I am. Hanging it more then I get to use it if I do t have it plugged in while using it. Just kind of kills a lot when your in the middle of a game and you battery is low and 5 mins later it shuts down.

It is actually insane how amazing and futuristic this device is. The surround sound is great, the movements are flawless, the battery lasts long enough. It did make me motion sick (I lived on a boat for 3 months without getting seasick but this got me), I followed a tip and played in smaller increments until I got used to it. Now it doesnt make me sick at all. The headset could be more comfortable but it is not uncomfortable. The lenses get sweat on them because the mask is "hot." You dont really feel like its hot but at some point you will notice you are sweating. A good workout but it does make the lenses need to be wiped every so often.Still, five stars. This device could have many more issues and it would still not lose a star. It is so insane for its price, and just as a device in general, it should get 15 stars.
review_title: This is insane. You would not believe how real it seems. The motion sickness goes away quick.

one_reviews_text: The oculus quest 2 is great. The charge, though only lasting 2-4 hours is more than enough time for me. Shooter games like onward or Pavlov are very good. You need the oculus app and a Facebook acct. but it wasn't too terrible to setup. When I first put it on it updated which only took a couple of minutes but that might vary depending on your internet. You need a bright room for it to track properly so I recommend getting a bright light. The gap in the nose area doesn't bother me but there is a gap there so when I'm playing and I turn towards a light it distracts me. The graphics aren't the best but you can't expect too good of graphics from a tiny screen being magnified. The controllers are comfortable but once your hands get sweaty it becomes a little uncomfortable

I bought these for my kids but I am enjoying it as well. The visual/picture quality is stunning and really gives a reality feel to the experience. Being able to virtually experience different parts of the world I can't get enough of! Highly recommend this for kids and adults. Although I imagine for a child younger than 8 it would be too heavy and too large for fitting. I have to keep adjusting the strap for my 8 year old but it does fit his head.

I have found navigating through the system is somewhat difficult.  My biggest problem I have with the Oculus is the quality of the visual.  I find it blurry no matter how I adjust the unit.  The battery does not last long.  I played for about 45 minutes yesterday and the battery was down to about 50%.  I was also starting to get a headache from the blurriness.  I think this would be 5 stars if the videos were crystal clear.  I think I will be returning it.

This thing is amazing. It definitely takes some getting used to. I’m not prone to motion sickness but man is there a learning curve. I grew up on boys my entire life and my stomach has gotten a little queezy from this. It is loads of fun though! Our whole family plays from 5 years old to 30. We love it but you have to buy a head set that fits all which is separate and a case :)! Highly recommend this! So so fun!
review_title: If you get motion sick don’t buy this

one_reviews_text: I recommend this to any person that is interested in using VR, everything is right there for you!! You dont have to use anything else to download content and 128GB lets me play more than 6 games so far. I’m in love with it and my family had so much fun with it, you definitely get your money’s worth. But the only thing that gave me trouble is chrome casting it on roku, that was tough and I had to order a google chrome caster so hopefully that will work, will try to update y’all about it. And You’ll need to be in a well lit space to play, you can’t play in the dark or a really dimmed area. But day 2 of having it and everything is good, it also came fast with same day delivery didn’t recall the order nor cancellation. It’s perfect. 5 stars, hopefully this review help you guys out for Christmas!! Happy holidays

DO NOT BUY.Great fun at first, but Facebook banned my account without explanation or no means of recourse. This is becoming more common and can happen to anyone! All the games (that aren't cheap) are now worthless and my Occulus is essentially a brick. HUGE waste of money!*EDIT*After contacting Occulus directly (and over social media) they were able to re-instate my Facebook account. Still it was a very long and frustrating experience
review_title: DO NOT BUY! Find an alternative VR headset!

one_reviews_text: Difference between this one and it’s predecessor is quite unbelievable. I was able to put the headset on draw perimeter I would not walk out of.  kept it five minutes and returned it because it was so real it freaked the crap out of me
review_title: So real I returned it, because it freaked the crap out of me

one_reviews_text: The quest 2 is by far better than my rift s. Every time I use my headset, I forget there is no cable so it is odd to me but freeing. The responsiveness is amazing and the feel of every thing is great. It fits my eyes just fine, but I won't guarantee that it will fit everyone's eye size. Double check the space in between your eyes are supported by the quest before buying it!

You should buy the oculus quest 2 if you want:-Terrible facebook integration-Bad hardware-Buggy and barely working software-The worst customer support you have ever seen, they actually don't care at all about you-Bugs and glitches with the software that have been discovered well over a year ago still not being fixed and with no signs of being fixed-Cool experimental features with the only caveat being that they barely ever workIf you are looking to get into VR, do not buy this headset. It will only disappoint you.
review_title: The Worst VR Set on the Market

one_reviews_text: I play in VR literally every day, and honestly, the only problem I have with this particular headset, is it's inability to track in the dark, (without some sort of assistance)It's so annoying, because I really love playing horror games, and games like phasmophobia in the dark,to get more immersed in the game, and while it does try really hard to track you, and surroundings in the dark, don't expect it to hold up for very long, besides this issue, this is actually a decent VR headset.
review_title: It's a VR Headset, not bad, but not great either.

one_reviews_text: Pro: The Headset is fantastic and work perfectly. Battery lasts for about 2 hours on a full charge which is more then enough. Love works well on PC with a Link Cable (Even with 3rd party cable). Airlink works somewhat ok, however it is still in beta.Cons: Why does Meta require that I use Facebook to use the headset that I paid for? It is ridiculous that I don't get the option to turn off social settings. I have an Oculus Account, but Meta forces you to merge it to a Facebook account. I would have given this a 5 out of 5, but Facebook can't resist on getting access to personal data. If Facebook got rid of that requirement, this would be the best headset to buy on the market.

This is so much better than PS VR in terms of setup, connection and visual quality. The freedom of movement without any wires and tracking is amazing.AirLink works great, no complaints from me.Battery lifetime is acceptable, but it can discharge pretty quickly just lying there.The ability to view the actual space around you with external cameras is a lifesaver.The stock head strap is abysmal, the headset is practically constantly weighing down on your face, and you need to adjust it every couple of minutes.It's nearly impossible to wear it with glasses, the frame is just not big enough.It has some issues correctly identifying floor level in seated position. And if there is no setting for this in the game, you will view the world as a leprechaun.I don't like the required integration with Facebook, but it is what it is.All in all I'm very happy with the purchase, the device is marvelous for it's price. I like the PC VR games, I like the standalone capabilities and what I can do with it. I just need to get a new head strap.

I've played VR before, but it's always been done with the whole set-up: gaming computer, room sensors, etc. I was nervous about the idea of a standalone system, but the Oculus Quest 2 did not disappoint. I love not being tethered to a cord. The battery doesn't last longer than a couple of hours, but I never play too long at a time anyway so it's not a problem. It provides a very immersive experience and I love it!

For an item that costs $300, I expected more than this. Me and my children played on the oculus for about 5 hours when it needed to be recharged. After charging, it would not detect the left controller. Kept saying that the battery was low, even after replacing the battery. Yes, I was using alkaline AA 1.5v. I tried unpairing and repairing...tried it after keeping the batteries out for 5 minutes. Tried factory resetting the headset. Nothing works. I can only surmise that the controller is faulty. After some searching on the web, I find out that this is a very common issue.Then, when I go to report a problem...."Oh, we'll get back to you in 1 or 2 days." No number. No live chat. Just support tickets. Horrible customer service. I would skip shelling out the money for this system until they get this fixed. It's completely ridiculous.
review_title: Only worked for a few hours

one_reviews_text: We love it. The graphics are amazing and the games we've checked out are such high quality. The whole family can find something they like. Even the menu screen is super impressive. Don't buy games to use with vr ( many of those require special vr such as ps4) but... you can buy & download the games directly on the occulus to play so get get larger capacity one!  Also, you can play with friends from their own house!

Simply amazed by this product. I will admit it’s my first VR headset. So I do not have a lot of technical review to share,  or compare.Wife and I are very struck by the quality of the material , The capability is incredible, and even the packaging is superb and well presented. Just a high-quality product at a seemingly very fair price point. Contemplating getting a second one.Oculus was recommended to me by a buddy of mine in the tech field. This was a home run.

I bought this for my 13 year old. I hoped that it would add a fun element to our homeschool PE routine. It definitly shakes things up. I love it almost as much as he does. If are going to engage in any hard play, do yourself a favor and buy one of the cloth covers for the silicone lined face mask. It prevents moisture build up while you play. Awesome VR experience!
review_title: This virtual reality machine is a whole lot of fun!

one_reviews_text: This is the first vr headset we've ever used and it is awesome. It works great as a stand alone and connected to gaming pc via oculus connect or app. We did purchase the more comfortable head strap and it was worth it. Would suggest using in 15min increments at first to get used to it. The guardian "app" works great and keeps you safe in play area. Would highly suggest getting this vr headset, it has something for everyone's enjoyment.

It was very disappointing when we received the unit missing the charger and found two or three inch long dark hairs on the facemask. Clearly seems to be a returned unit when it should have been new.  We packed it back in the box and took it to UPS an hour after we received it. Still have not received the refund.  We want to try again but not until we receive our refund.  Not sure if this is an issue from the manufacture or from Amazon.
review_title: Missing charger and found inch long hairs in box and on face mask

one_reviews_text: So works great or worked great. had it for like 2 months and was fantastic till the left controller stopped pairing. Did all the troubleshooting. No physical damage to the unit. Just defective. Ater 4 straight hours of a massive amount of back and forth between amazon and occulus support , Amazon said they were willing to replace the unit but I have to ship it to them from SA out of my own pocket. Simply wanted a replacement controller that wouldnt cost me a arm and a leg. Support was terrible. Kept passing me from person to person. Kept having to repeat everything. Why am I paying out of pocket for defective under warranty products? NOT IMPRESSED AT ALL!
review_title: WARRANTY SUCKS AND SO DOES CUSTOMER SERVICE

one_reviews_text: My son enjoys the product It is pretty cool and the graphics are better than I expected. However, it's also a little heavier all the headset than I expected and obviously very front heavy. But it is a remarkable piece of technology. And there are an ever-increasing amount of actual games to play Not demos and proof of concept type things although there are plenty of those. I mean legitimate games that you can play alone or with friends for many hours.
review_title: Wow this is cool, but heavier than expected.

one_reviews_text: If you've ever considered VR, you should buy this. So much fun and games like Beat Saber and Eleven: Table Tennis are not only fun and entertaining, but a small workout as well. Visually this look really good. Controls work well as far as I can tell. I don't usually play for longer than about 45 minutes, but it makes me sweat really hard. Love, love, love this system. You need a Facebook account, but most people already have one. Buy it!

This was a drunk purchase, but I'm happy with it. Resident Evil 4 is awesome on it. Can't play for very long (maybe an hour or two)c, as it kinda ruptures my disposition but I don't like to play video games for much longer anyway.

General opinion: more than satisfiedNegative:- glasses fog up (sometimes)- small screen resolution: the pixels are small, but they are still visible. Need: 2x the resolution- there is no eye tracking function, which is important to create the right focus on the image and for comfort.- if you learn something you need use information for real notices. It is not comfortable.  Transperent mode is bad now, but it's working.- there are few settings and apps yet.Positive:- changing the distance to the text is useful for the eyes- it's a good way to make ideal work environment. You can control visual and auditory stimuli. You can do an ideal room.✅- helm don't allow wrinkle your forehead. It's interesting)- you can use it to get rid your social phobias.✅- there are a lot of experimental function: hand tracking, second transperent mode with augumented reality, attaching mouse, mode with increased frame rate.Need addition tools:Bluetooth keyboard, comfortable helm mountThank you, guys!
review_title: Low screen resolution: the pixels are small, but they are still visible.

one_reviews_text: I should have done more reasearch on this item, as it is the most inexpensive VR headset it was an attractive buy, however what they don't explicitly tell you is that you need a Facebook account just to open it.  I bought this for my son to use with video games and as he is a child, I was not about to get a facebook account for him to use it.  I also do not have a facebook account as i do not condone spying and collecting personal data.  If I had known the device would be dead in the water without a Facebook account I would not have bought it in the first place.  Buyer beware, the thing collects video feeds of your surroundings and your audio and stores them at facebook (meta). interestingly, they say they have one that doesne't need the account if you pay them an extra $500!!! suspicious.....
review_title: You need a Facebook account to use this device

one_reviews_text: I got the Quest 2 on the 13th of January, and just after midnight, the headset shut off and no longer powered on or took a charge. I shipped it back to Facebook in order to get a repair or replacement and I got crickets. No emails about them receiving it or what options they can give me. I had to use their support chat to get any updates. The RMA email I received initially said it would take 5-7 business days to get my headset back when they got it. Then I started a support chat on the 2nd of February and they then said it would be 5 more business days before I got it back. I contacted them again after another two weeks to only find out it could be a month from them receiving the headset for me to get it back. It has been just over a month from them getting my RMA and I still haven't gotten any proper updates. I have just contacted them about a replacement or refund. I'm tired of waiting for a product I paid over 500 dollars for, only for it to stop working almost immediately.
review_title: Less than 12 hours of use before it broke. Still waiting on a repair, replacement, or refund.

one_reviews_text: This is the funniest game platform I've ever played. The unit is built very well and I have spent hours injoyin it already. BUT you have to have a face book account, it track everything you do on it and if you ever have issues with your face book account because of expressing your political or personal opinion you will lose all access to your game library. Welcome to the beginnings of the social credit score in the US...

The Oculus Quest, it's not bad at all it just isn't what i expected. I could care less about the facebook mandatory connection at all. What I do care about is it's quality. I think the resolution of the product is below average. It is just blurry and I did try the 75 hertz setting but it still sucks. I get way to dizzy after each use and I would feel like puking after even just watching one YouTube video. It also hurts around my head and gives me a headache after I use it. Some games look nice. But some games also lag really badly which I resent. I feel like the games are choppy and get really boring really quickly. I returned it but I haven't got my money back so let's see where that gets me. I'd give the product a 4/10. It just isn't what I hoped for.
review_title: If you want to try a step into the future get it

one_reviews_text: My son got one and I fell in love and had to order one myself. I get extremely motion sick and there is many things I can do on it that does not make me nauseous. You have to adjust the eyes perfect or it is blurry. It is very easy to use and fun. The face cover that does come on it though sucks and hurts my face. When you order your headset I would separately order a different face covering. Definitely worth the money!

So I purchased this for my boyfriend‘s 40th birthday and he absolutely loves it now I’m annoyed because he’s constantly using it.But he’s definitely obsessed with it, The games to buy are expensive, Plus you have to have a Facebook account to purchase this. it’s a pretty quick easy set up as far as your email and making up the password and putting your card down to purchase games.

I bout this for my son and he loves it. I’ve tried it out a couple of times and it’s pretty fun. If you’re looking to try VR for the first time, this is a fairly inexpensive introduction that is versatile and actually pretty powerful. You can use it with or without a PC. I do wish the wireless PC link was better, but the pc cord is long enough that you can use it wired when on pc.

I bought this for Christmas for my husband and all I hear him saying when he’s playing it “WOW” “this is crazy” oh my gosh this is awesome it feels so real :) He enjoys it. He knows more about technology and games and he gave a thumbs up and 10 starts out of 10. He said the pictures and video is spectacular . He recommended this product . The only complaint will be around having to set up Facebook account to make it work .

This is a great introduction to virtual reality.  Honestly considering convenience and ease of set up, i think this is all you’d need.Great visual fidelity, comfortable to wear, easy to use and game with!Best saber is incredibly fun, Vader Immortal is trippy as hell!!I’ve played No Man’s Sky (only way to play that game imo).  I’ve also played Skyrim and both gave immersive and fun experiences!

Works well fun. You will want to buy the upgraded strap for the head. Strap that comes is hard to adjust between people. Bought a case the came with upgraded head strap that uses a knob on the back to tighten and loosen the oculus to your head. Also going to want to get a external battery takes it from 2 hours to 6. Used my cell external in my pocket and a long c cord. But they sell ones that just plug in that are small if you don’t like cords

My son has all kinds of games systems, but this is his favorite.  It holds up well too. I can't tell you how many times he has hit his controllers on the counters and everything else and it is still working fine. It is an awesome game system.

Anything you want out of this device, you can get. You can play games, swim with sharks, sit in a race car, hang glide and the list goes on. You can get fit or play games. Play solo, with friends or random people. It’s amazing.  You would think the screen is in your face, but it appears to be about ten feet away and about 90” big. There is No weird feeling when you’re done unless your go on something like a roller coaster simulator or something like that which your would experience in real life. This is an awesome product and i will mostly use mine to get fit, games and education. AWESOME!!!

My kids love this. They are having so much fun playing different games. I like that there are few game options, and we are still exploring other things the VR can do, I'm excited to see some of the "travel" type experiences. I got motion sick from some games, but my kids are so far ok. The only drawback is the battery drains rather quickly, so the wait to charge has been challenging for my kids. We are trying a battery "brick" that they can wear in a backpack, that is helping.

If you were thinking about buying this I highly recommend you buy it. It has a lot of storage easy to setup up and is a real great experience I haven’t had any problems with it so far and I just all out love it. Also if you don’t want to pay for the whole thing right then and there you can make 60$ payment for 5 months till it’s payed off.

If you’re on the fence about getting it and not sure what you’re going to do with it like I was, I suggest you save your money. It’s just an expensive niche toy tbh. Once the hype of having an oculus passed I stopped paying any attention to it. Now it just sits in the box beside my chair. A $350 cup holder. BUT if you have a purpose in mind for using it or think you’d enjoy the limited amount of games currently available then go for it. You won’t be disappointed. Whether you use it or not, it’s definitely cool as sh!t , especially the first time lol
review_title: Decent if you’re buying. It for a specific reason.

one_reviews_text: Nows the time to get one before they go out of stock and you’ll have to buy one double the price from scalpers.I bought this for steam games and it works perfectly fine with all of them, half life alyx looks amazing in it, no issues at all, arrived the next day too so that’s a plus.

The Headset is a great package for a wonderful VR experience, but a few minor issues put it off a bit for me. Personally, The head strap is a bit odd and doesn't provide a very comfortable experience when playing for long, but some cheap aftermarket accessories can fix that. Additionally, the store is a bit overpriced with some very lenient sales so I personally stuck with steam and the use of air link. Now, Airlink is a great software functionality, it just has many issues such as a weird wide FOV when looking through passthrough as well as plenty of visual glitches and some settings options that are impossible to change. But besides all of my messy criticism, it is a great head seat that will please most and is definitely a great VR experience.
review_title: Awesome Headset, just some minor issues

one_reviews_text: So I bought this for my wife for Christmas, she loves it, it's great for VR Chat and other games.My main complaint, and if you are considering this for PC, definitely check to see if your GPU is supported by oculus. I wish I would have known that it wasn't compatible with the 1650 GPUs, which is weird considering they support the 1060 gou and I believe a few 900 series GPUs.But any way, she really wanted to play her steam games in VR on her computer, but sadly she can not do that.But it runs great as a stand alone unit, and for what apps you can get in the Oculus store, and she still enjoys it.
review_title: Great VR headset for the money

one_reviews_text: Winter is coming and I'm old (let's just say I was alive for the Moon landing). So no snow skiing for me. This has games that are very easily paced (putt putt, rollercoaster, fishing etc) that boomers like me can appreciate. But don't get me wrong. It is TOTALLY immersive! If I only spend a couple of hours a week on it they are an amazing experience. Solo or with others from around the world. Get hip with this thing, grey hairs. It's fun!

The Oculus Quest 2 is a revolutionary device that brings VR to the mass market. The competitive pricing plus a wide variety of apps on the oculus store makes Quest2 an all-in-one entertainment powerhouse. However, the device is not well designed for spectacle wearers. Even with the eyeglass spacer provided, it is a pain to fit the eyeglasses into the small headset, not to mention that my eyeglasses keep nudging my nose, making the VR experience very uncomfortable. Fortunately, I bought from VR WAVE a pair of Quest 2 prescription lenses insert which completely solves the problem. I ordered them on the VR WAVE website and the lenses are delivered in a week. VR WAVE tailor made prescription lenses inserts according to my eyes, and the lenses inserts can be attached easily onto the headset with the magnetic design. I no longer have to wear eyeglasses into VR and being “perfect vision” in VR brings the whole experience to another level. I think that Oculus can do better on the headset design as VR is still far from comfortable without the help of these accessories.
review_title: Next gen console but with a catch

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Oculus for my 10 year old daughter for Christmas. It's now February 28th and she's lost 14 pounds. She plays it constantly as it is too nasty outside to stay out too long. She breaks a sweat about 5 min into play time.

Didn't realize I could watch movies on it and YouTube. Just wish there were better settings available for setting where the picture actually is. You can set your eye/view point all you want, but it's still vertical compared to the ground, so no putting the Movie Screen to the ceiling to binge watch shows while lying down in comfort 😒 But, other than that, it's fun, some games are real cheap, decent free content, and only seems to be growing.
review_title: Really cool, too bad you gotta have a FB account

one_reviews_text: I bought it mostly to see places I'll never be able to go; I went (virtually) to the Grand Canyon, and it was better than when I went 4 years ago. No crowds, No heat wave, and No one yelling that I was too close to the edge.
review_title: 60 years old, and I love it.

one_reviews_text: I had a VR headset that I used with my phone.  This is lightyears above that.  The controllers are amazing and the headset feels very comfortable to wear.Mostly I have been playing Skyrim using the connection to my laptop but I have a list of other games I have my eyes on next.

Well didn’t work out for me. Went with the Cosmos where I don’t have to keep going on a social app in fear of getting locked out. Facebook is and always will be a boomer app. Spend the extra money and buy something else.

Is this the greatest VR headset money can buy? Absolutely not, not even close. Is it an awesome user friendly and seamless introduction to the world of VR at a reasonable price? Absolutely Yes! The integrated os and store and games are great fun. I do wish the store had more full length games for hardcore gamers but if you have a gaming pc it can be paired for some really awesome content. If not there is still plenty in the built in catalog. Definitely a worthwhile little gadget.

Bought the Product in late December 2021.  Was traveling quite a bit and only got to use the unit a dozen times before it broke.  I contacted Oculus, and they sent me a packing slip to Fedex it over night.  That was about the only good thing that has happened. That was 22 days ago and the won't give me a strait answer.  They can't seem to tell me what the delay was where my system is and why they will not send out my replacement system.  Upon research I am far from being the only one this has happened to.  I can't find anyone that has had there unit returned to them in a timely manner and it appears that several months seems to be normal.  No wonder that they do not have phone number you can call.Buyer beware!!!!

I was excited to try this so I bought one. Delivered quickly so great as always. When I opened it up it had a scratch on it (as shown in picture). The battery life of this VR headset is absolutely terrible. It needs to be able to last WAY longer. This headset is also bad for people with glasses. I have to take mine off just to use this even with the glasses insert attached. The last issue I have is being able to fit it on me perfectly to be able to see the screen and not have any blur; the part that hangs on my nose is never centered and always manages to close off my nostril so I’m always having to adjust it.
review_title: Good but needs to be better

one_reviews_text: We've only had it for around a month and half. It's cool but one of the controllers broke and now we can't use it anymore. We can't find a replacement controller anywhere. Not on Amazon and not on the Occulus store. The only place I've seen is on Ebay for almost $200 which is almost the price of a brand new system. I don't recommend buying this until replacement parts are more available to customers.
review_title: Cool but no use when replacement products aren't available.

one_reviews_text: The Oculus headset offers something for everyone - games, workouts, puzzles, travel, events, social - and this market is just getting started.  Games are affordable (many amazing games are free!) and take up far less memory space than PC/console games.  I have 15 games/apps on a 128GB and have barely dented the capacity, although future games could get more memory intensive in the future...  highly recommend.

First time using a VR. My biggest issue is that even though I adjust the straps I get a headache. I have to balance my head back to keep goggles in a place where I can see and not have such a bad headache. I usually use one hand to press up on the nose area of the goggles to have a clear view- and can only do that if it’s a app that doesn’t require both hands. Positives is the experience of VR.

Didn't even get to open the box and check it out got it from a boyfriend as a gift then he looked online about it and said Facebook washers everything you do and you can't hook it up without it and you know so I bet it is awesome I wanted one for so long I wanted one so bad I bought one for him just to get to try it and let him have it I was excited but maybe the other one that doesn't go through Facebook with work you know it's cheaper to I bet it's not much much different as far as graphics go I think that they just stopped in some of the programs not going to get all those options unless you download it permanently or something for goes away but you know failing people who live their whole lives used to hey brother I guess it could be great but I'm 40 so I mean I actually didn't care but he did so spoiled my fun 2
review_title: Ou can do so many fun awesome things... For fb to keep track of. Boo!.

one_reviews_text: I like many people have been struggling to find a ps5. So I decided to just try the quest 2 instead while I waited. At this point I have to say forget sony, I found my new system. Many people complain about there not being enough game titles, but give some of the ones you've never heard of a try. The emmersion is so complete with this system. It takes gaming to a whole new level.
review_title: This made me change my tune about a ps5.

one_reviews_text: Ps5 vr is awesome but Quest 2 is ready to go and is portable and playable anywhere! Santa brought for 10 year old son and my son went missing for a week! He has made all kind of friends online his age and play games all the time. The first few days he would take a break often as he was exhausted from games and would sit in VR room and hang. He still uses almost daily. I watch the 100 at Netflix theater and have a movie screen to watch. Biggest tv in USA!

Tons of fun and the apps are great for casual gaming! When you first purchase it be sure to know that when you are first using it you’ll possibly feel a little nauseous when there’s prolonged use. So you have to ease your self into the VR. The games are a ton of fun and there’s so many different options and Oculus constantly sends discounts on your next purchase. Great for all ages and all levels of gamers, from new to dedicated.
review_title: Tons of fun and great for casual gamers!

one_reviews_text: The Guardian keeps crashing and will not allow you to do anything. Several people are having this same problem. The only fix is to factory reset and I am not going to do that and lose all of my game progress and have to reinstall everything. Will update my review when they come out with a firmware fix.
review_title: Latest firmware update has made it unusable

one_reviews_text: I just received and opened my Oculus to find 2 smudged lenses. Tried wiping off with a micro fibre cloth specifically for lenses and the smudges cannot be removed. Both lenses, however, the left is worse than the right. It’s extremely annoying and absolutely impossible to get a good clear optical experience with this. I will be requesting a replacement headset. What an utter waste of my time and money.

Bought it for my son as a birthday present. I had a god a couple of times. It is incredibly good. The tracking is excellent; set up is easy enough, including the PC connection (though the virtual desktop ap is not free anymore); the airlink works great so playing steam games is effortless and you do not need the expensive cable. The graphics are excellent. I play 4k 38 inch on my desktop. There is no way anyone would notice any difference on the resolution. Pains me to give 5 stars because i dislike Facebook company but... a great products deserves it

So far, it’s just okay. 1) I had to get a replacement because the black plastic contact strip broke off in one of the handsets so the headset couldn’t find it. 2) The upgraded headset strap is still designed so that I have a hard time keeping the mask on straight. I wouldn’t buy the extra headset strap again. The standard one is as good or better. 3) Why can’t we adjust each eye focus like binoculars?

Likes: Very easy setup as long as you have a decent wifi signal. All but the most popular games are relatively inexpensive. VR takes some getting-used-to, especially if you are past 70 but very rewarding with respect to emersion in the game.Cons: Requires a fair amount of empty space in your home if you want to play safely. Battery life, particularly for high-rez, fast action games is rather short.

Los juegos virtuales, los programas de realidad virtual, mas las aplicaciones como Netflix, Amazon prime video vr, national geográfic,se mira brutal,en realidad es otra cosa,lo recomiendo al 100%la experiencia esta a otro nivel👍👍

Honestly, this Headset is pretty nice when you don't have a PC that would be able to run these games. The games arnt huge (with some only being a few gigs) and just are fun to play for hours.The only thing I have to say is if you get this might as well get a better headstrap because that one is just ok for the time being but can really hurt after a while. The battery life is ok aswell depends on what game you chose to play but really you should not play for more then 1-2 hours.When I first started to get into this, I will say after waking up the next day my brain couldn't figure out what was real or not so just keep that in mind. It goes away after a week of use just wish I was warned first.You will love it, your kids will love it, your grandma will love it, I'm 25 years old and thinks this kicks a**. Just look into it and see for yourself it's worth the buy and you will get lost in it.

Works great for what it is used for Portable wirelessy  playing my steam  Library not use to low 75 hz rate even at  Experimental 120 HZ doest feel like it. i still will use my every day gogeter valve index but for portible useage its no boubt the best battry not the longest lasting but gets the job done :) still recomend this product for intro users who getting started in vr Easy to set up too very user frindly.

My son and I both got one if these. After not much time, a month or 2 - the Operating System freezes, crashes, network won’t start, games won’t load, and then randomly it works again for maybe one or two sessions. We have factory reset our headsets twice and that did nothing but lose progress in my games. He can’t even play now because he is locked out his Facebook account (hacked)that he created for the Occulus and Occulus support won’t help him and there is no Facebook support. We are having to go to the Better Business Bureau to get refunds for his purchases or get a Facebook to verify his identity.  But it is fun when it works but lately, everytime I try to play I spend 20 minutes just powering down and restarting the headset until it works or I get frustrated.  I only have 3 games installed instead of all the games I had bough but that too doesn’t help.  Buyer beware, great technology but extremely buggy and if something happens to your Facebook account you will lose ALL of the games you have purchased.

The oculus is great and lots of fun, but why did you have to require a Facebook account. I have managed to stay clear of Facebook until now. A standalone system would be better and Mark needs to know your entire life would be out of the picture.

This was a birthday present for our grandson. A friend of his came over and brought his set, watching these boys have so much fun made my heart happy. So when our grandson said this was what he wanted for his birthday, I could not resist and ordered them. It was his 18th so it was worth the big surprise! He loves playing games and enjoys this virtual reality game. I tried it and it’s like stepping into another world.

I bought this mainly for PCVR and it performs really well for that even compared to stand alone headsets like the Vive and Index. What really impressed me is the library and performance with native quest titles. The work in progress features with refresh rate and side loading apps gives it even more versatility for app development and testing as well. No one can really compete with the quality and versatility that oculus/meta provides right out of the box with the quest 2. Hate Facebook or love them, they are investing heavily into VR and hopefully that will lead to only positive things.

I have the original Quest and it fits fine, but the Quest 2 headset is a little narrow and tight.  I have to wear an old set of glasses that aren't as wide to play on it, even with the glasses spacer inserted.  Once I get it on and adjusted it plays pretty well, but the right trigger finger button doesn't seem to work as well as the original Quest's.  I may have to contact Oculus.
review_title: Not for people with big heads

one_reviews_text: Only 3 preset eye settings. Glasses with the spacer didn't help. Gave me a little headache from using it for about 30 minutes. The sound system is cool cause it's right at the ears. Bought a new unit, but it looks like it was used already. Unless that's the quality. Had aome minor scratches eight out of the box. And the charging port had shown signs of being plugged in.
review_title: Not suited if your vision isn't good.

one_reviews_text: Absolutely worth buying and testing but they have a massive issue with the motion sickness. I don’t get sea sick and I’m fine on roller coasters but after a couple of minutes with this thing we all had horrible headaches the next morning. That was the case for me each time, I was hoping I could get used to it like my friend that recommended it, but each time it got worse and worse
review_title: So cool! But gave everyone horrible motion sickness next day

one_reviews_text: I bought this and returned it didn't use it because I don't have Facebook and refuse to get an account with all my info just to play in VR... Hello ever happened to privacy? The other versions didn't require Facebook umm annoyed

I'm now a month into my Quest 2 headset, and I really love it.  Clear bright picture and not too heavy on the head. I especially like the Olympic reviews and "in-place-of" views of the athletes!  My primary use is exercise.Cons:  Sound could be louder and where is all the software?  If Meta is going to be a metaverse, its needs worlds, things to do, more VR software.

For me, the Oculus was everything I wanted for a long time. I ended up buying one for Christmas and I love it so much. It had such a good value price that I couldn’t turn it down. It met every expectation that I wanted and I really enjoy using it! Something to keep in mind is that once you buy the headset, it still costs more money to buy games actually inside the headset. Sort of like an Xbox or PlayStation. You pay to get the actual thing, then whatever games you want. I hope this helped, but I definitely recommend.

 My son is in love with the occlus quest 2. It was given to him for his 13th birthday.  I love the fact that it is a fun way for him becoming active. He doesn't allow no one to have access. Had to order two more.
review_title: My son loves the occlus quest 2

one_reviews_text: The first time I started with q2, this is the real VR glasses, all-in-one. The one that I bought for dozens of dollars in the past is a box, which is completely different from an all-in-one machine. It is incomparable at all. So if you want to play vr, I recommend q2. The price/performance ratio is really high. I played lightsaber for a while, it was so interesting, and finally hugged q2 in my arms very happily~

This is an awesome system. I had experience with it before I bought my own. I bought the "meta" quest as it is now called however I played my previous roommates "Oculus" quest all the time. Near as I can tell, they're exactly the same. Only thing is, I literally spent all day playing his on my day off. Where as with the Meta quest, I feel like I only get maybe 2 hours out of it. Give or take. Maybe I've gone mad but I'm pretty sure the battery life in the Meta quest 2 is way worse than the original oculus quest 2. Why? I have no idea. That being said, it is still an incredible device. And besides the battery life, the only thing I would change right now is steam compatibility. There are many VR games in steam and if you could have the whole steam library on the Quest, it would bring in a lot of users
review_title: Really awesome system and a right step in the direction with a few flaws

one_reviews_text: I set up my Oculus during Christmas and with kids and family members around and everything being non-stop I couldn't remember my password and pin number.  I have requested over 20 times to have an email sent to me via forgot password and not one time have I gotten the email.  Also Oculus told me they don't even see an account for me, yet when I am on the app, which logs me in automatically I can see my username, credit card info, etc.  Customer service is the same ol people who don't know anything and constantly repeat themselves or make 0 sense.  Wish I didn't buy this!

LOVE the occulus.  Both of my teenagers and my husband have one and they all love it.  My 10 year old plays all the time and has a blast.  Definitely an amazing gift for gamers in your house.  My teenagers and their friends are all able to play virtual games together.  It’s also fun for those not playing the games to watch how ridiculous the gamer looks.

I put a lot of weight on during this pandemic so I bought the game Beat Saber and I've been playing it every night for about 45 minutes and all I can say what a workout! I just started to explore what's possible with this quest 2 and I'm certainly impressed with the technology. If you got a little extra money to throw around I would certainly recommend buying this. Loads of fun.

And at first I absolutely love the oculus immersive environments and gameplay among friends until The oculus decided to no longer be able to track the controllers or my hands for that matter and then got stuck in a boot loop. After spending several hours with tech-support for meta-they were unable to resolve my issue so now I have a $300 piece of crap that I can’t even watch YouTube on because it is constantly turning off turning back on and when it does stay on it is in a loop for tracking loss I have done everything from clean the cameras to replace batteries factory resetting I even use my cell phone to look through the camera at the oculus controllers to make sure the IR lights are still working. I am also passed the day that I can return the Amazon so I guess I’m just screwed very disappointed.

The Metaverse will have to wait. I bought a brand new Oculus Quest 2 and have never been able to use it. Once I did the setup and hooked it to WiFi, it stated "Apply update 1 of 2, rebooting in 10 seconds". Then it proceeds to count down and reboot, then it just keeps rebooting every 10 seconds until the battery dies which takes days. Did the factory reset, connected directly PC and same issue. Oculus support says I have to send it back and they may give me a refurbished one. I didn't pay for a brand new one for it be a PoS and then give me a used one. Facebook making anything seems to suck and this Oculus Quest 2 is no different. Extremely disappointed and do not recommend!

I love this thing. It's so surreal. You feel like you're actually there. For example, on roller coaster rides, you actually feel your stomach drop, it it really feels like you're there. So amazing. The only reason I gave it four stars it's because I wish it had more variety of things to do, and the white bands get dirty fast. It should've been black lol. Definitely a must have!!!

Showed up on time with no damage but during setup it requires you to have access to a phone that can run their mobile app. You cant use a pc and ive tried emulating android and running android x86 on my pc with no luck and no friends or family are close enough to help me out with this. The setup looks great and the music is nice too but i cant give this more than 2 stars. EDIT: I got it setup with a friends phone and it wont let me buy any games or apps. I enter my card details and it gives a vague error message i made sure i typed it right and tried on multiple games yet nothing went through not on the website, app, pc app, or in headset store. I looked online and on the forums and Oculus Support was unresponsive. This headset is over rated and a mess I wish I went with valve on this one.
WHY?? is this not disclosed in the product info? I have one son that does not have FB. Unboxed the box and clearly printed on the box it says. Must have Facebook account!

I got this for the Supernatural workout program because I absolutely hate all other traditional exercise. This has been a complete game changer! I am consistently working out and seeing the physical changes and feeling better. Beat Saber is another game I am really enjoying. It’s good to note this isn’t recommended for kids under 13, so this didn’t become a family device like I intended. All in all, I love my headset and hope I get a lot of use out of it!

This is the perfect headset to use to get into VR. Easy to set up and use. Fun games and stunning visuals.My only complaint is the price of games. Some of these games are completed in 30 minutes and have zero replay ability but still cost upwards of $20. It’s hard to justify a $40 purchase when I’ll only play the game for 30-45 minutes.I would be glad to see demos, free games, more affordable games. This comes down to a problem of Facebook being what they are(greedy) and developers underestimating costs of development.If I start to see more affordable games. I may come back and change my review.

I freaking love this device. VR has come SO far since it was first launched. This is realistic and the headset is comfortable (fairly) and intuitive to use. I can't get enough. My only complaint is that I use it so much that the battery dies, but that's only because I use it a TON. Can't wait for facebook to make working in this space and using any computer type writer fully functional. Really, really love this device.
review_title: If I could give 100 stars I would

one_reviews_text: Received, brought games that focus on exercise (just moving!!) and I have turned it on most days.  It's kinda like reading a book to get away.  It takes you to another place and I enjoy that.  I feel like it was money well spent.
review_title: I Might Like to Exercise Now

one_reviews_text: An experience you need to try to really understand.  Revolutionary game mechanics and outstanding graphics, with the ability to connect games from Steam, help this product truly shine!My only complaint is that when gaming the battery only lasts 2 hours and the battery takes 2 1/2 hours to fully charge.(side note too, not a fan of the Facebook requirement.  I almost didn't purchase because of this, however my brother showed off his on Thanksgiving and I was super impressed.)I do not regret my purchase.
review_title: Awesome experience but the battery stinks.

one_reviews_text: The Meta Quest is exactly what my title implies. It's exciting when you first get set up and go into your first VR experience. In my case, "First Steps". And after playing different genres from Population 1, Cards&Tankards, and Trover Saves the Universe..VR and specifically The Quest 2 is primed to blow up in popularity very soon. The "Future" of gaming does comes with some con's though...battery life out of the box leaves a lot to be desired (2 hours of play time), do not expect graphics to blow you away, VR gaming is still relatively new. But seamlessly being able to party up and play video games in this VR viewpoint with friends is where this really shines. If you're a gamer, and haven't bought one yet, you are sorely missing out on a corner of gaming that is slowly becoming a must-have for gamers and casuals alike. Buy one now!

So I'm a little freaked out about Meta (Facebook) owning the entire world and all my private data, which now includes health data... but I'm obsessed with my Oculus. I primarily play Supernatural and it's beautiful, fun and an amazing workout. I feel like I am in another world. It's very realistic and dissociative from reality.If you're not concerned with Facebook being the man and our future overlords, then I highly recommend!

Countless hours of fun. It’s a cool experience and VR is only getting better. I really like the workout aspect of this and this is what kicked off my weigh loss journey for me. With Beat Saber making me more and more active I finally got a gym membership and lost 8 pounds…I truly credit this VR headset because it started me down a healthier path.

This thing is a good buy for the price, just make sure you have the space for it too.Battery life is always going to be a concern with every mobile platform, but the battery will need to be charged up first time as recommended just like anything else. Afterward sould last a good 8 or more hours.After it will connect to your desktop via cable or air link and works without issue for me.Steam VR is pretty good with it, break in your Quest 2 so you and it can sync.Use the hand control instead of the controller but only if the game supports hand gesture control.Would buy again.

I enjoyed the device while it worked but after 5 days of use the right controller had internal issues where it would spin me in circles without me touching the controller. As a result I decided to send in the controller for repairs. That was on the 12th of January and it is now February 5th. The most I’ve gotten was an email saying sorry. I’ve sent around 10 emails and the response I get is that the specialist team is working on it. I don’t understand the difficulty replacing a controller but I’ve been unable to use my headset for close to a month now. I’m very disappointed with the support on this device.
review_title: BEWARE OF FAULTY CONTROLLERS! (Only worked for 5 days)

one_reviews_text: It is an amazing piece of technology and works great.  If you think of what it takes to simulate a 3d 3nvironment as you move around it blows you mind.  Also, the constant updates show glimpses of where the tec is going.  Said all that, resolution is still poor and it is hard to keep it centered so that it doesn't goes out of focus.If you have the time and funds you HAVE to buy it just so that you start familiarizing yourself with the tec as this IS the future.Lots of sports games (mostly variations on aerobic exercise) and other creative games.  It is starting to focus a lot on social as well.
review_title: Amazing - But we will laugh at it in a few years

one_reviews_text: This was our first foray into VR. It was everything it was advertised to be.  It was easily set up once the app was downloaded. The colors and details are amazing. The only major issue is that the oculus doesn't have motorcycle racing or riding that we have found, there are some by others if connected to a computer. The motorcycle experiences are what I was hopeful for, for my husband.

This was my first VR headset. I don’t think I fit into the 3 pupil distance settings because it would be a little blurry on each setting. I don’t think I had any issues with battery or slow WiFi. Setting the boundaries was easy and the sound was nice, but people around will be able to hear it. It’s a nice headset, just didn’t fit me. Will definitely try another VR headset in the future though

You cannot use this product without a fb account. If you're considering this to augment your IRL flight training, you're probably cerebral enough to understand thought commerce and the role that company and others have played in it.There are better headsets for flight simming that don't demand you support thought commerce.
review_title: Don't Buy unless you're already a subject

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. Between him and my wife using it I hardly get a chance to use it. My wife is not a gamer at all. She'll play little time waster games on her phone, but that's about it. Now that we have the Quest she's fully into it. In the time we've had the Quest she's probably bought 4 or 5 games for it. My son really enjoys Job Simulator and Vacation Simulator game. All in all it's totally been a great purchase. I enjoy laughing at them both as they flail away in the middle of the living room.
review_title: I wish I could use it

one_reviews_text: I think it's a great concept but no matter what I tried, I could never get a clear picture.  It wasn't horrible but it was fuzzy and not worth $400.It's going back.

Absolutely love this gaming system. It's been a hit with the whole family and even allows us to play with family and friends that don't live with us. My only complaint would be the battery doesn't last as long as I'd expect. It lasts about 2- 2 1/2 hours which if only one person is playing that's probably more then enough time. But if you're taking turns with the whole family it's not really long enough. That being said it was still worth the money and we love it.
This has been a great purchase, I love it for the workouts available.  Pair it with supernatural and you will not be disappointed.  It makes a workout actually enjoyable

无法加载媒体。
                



 Great console with endless possibilities for Virtual interactions, games and other business opportunities. All on a standalone system.PS. If your going to used this for more than just gaming. I recommend getting the one with more memory.
review_title: Great Console with endless possibilities for the future of VR Gaming

one_reviews_text: I'm a 60 yo Grandmother who has never owned or operated a video gaming system yet here I am writing a review for a VR system. Seriously, I am really enjoying this one. You can set the games to play easy levels or advance yourself to more of a challenge. If the gym isn't your thing but you want some exercise with your arms/legs, this is the system for you!
review_title: most fun Ive had for a long time

one_reviews_text: Can't even begin to tell you how much these are so much enjoyable by my son as opposed to the $500 rift I thought for him last Christmas which now is completely discontinued and totally garbage and can't even sell for pennies it's such a rip off but Oculus this one is awesome except the headgear makes you sweat like crazy and the cushioning for your head is terrible
review_title: Great.. don't waste money in rift oculous

one_reviews_text: While I'm not always the biggest Facebook fan this headset is very impressive for the price. Prior to this I had the PSVR but had a hard time getting into it. The tracking on the Quest 2 is vastly superior and the ability to play with out wires is a huge game changer. Definitely recommend the Quest 2 for those looking to dip their toes into VR at an affordable price.

The overall experience of the headset is great. Hate having to use Facebook to use the headset but there are ways around using your main account if you don’t want to. 2 days after owning the oculus my left controller started drifting which was really annoying, some electrical contact cleaner in the joystick fixed that though. Still enjoy my purchase, it’s fun, visual quality is good and price point is good compared to some other units.

Who wants this level of intrusion into one’s life????  This VR headset offers great tech being sold at MUCH less than it costs to make.  Why???  Privacy and your personal data.  Despite carefully setting everything to not share my data I was constantly given reminders of friends VR units and what they were playing.  Basically if you use it, they will take ur data and sell it to you, ur friends on Facebook and advertisers. I felt violated.

I am shocked at how blurry the images are. Halos of light, text that can't be read, always moving my head around trying to find a remedy. Tried all the different eye spacings, multiple positions on my head, and different band tightness. I even went out and researched, finding that there are A LOT of complaints about these very issues, many of the reviewers stating that they didn't have these problems with the predecessor model. Fortunately, I can still return this.

The package was ok and I didn’t think anything off it untill I powered it up and noticed that they gave me a headset with all of someone else’s data ( the previous user before they returned it) it was pretty much useless I had to watch a video on how to factory reset the device. It’s fine now, but for 300$ you would think they would reset it before re selling it
I like the product but I only play with demo games. All the other apps are really expensive, so I decided to return it.
review_title: product and its idea are great, but the apps are expensive

one_reviews_text: I tried a friend's pair before buying these, and they work just like I had hoped. All of the Oculus apps and games run smoothly over wifi even in an apartment. However, make sure you buy the cord to connect to your pc for if you plan on playing SteamVR games. My experience is because I live around others (i.e., I live in an apartment) and I am running my pc on wifi with the Oculus on wifi at the same time; running both on wifi is unmanagable due to sever lag and locking up completely. However, pc on wifi with oculus on cable works just fine with moments of barely noticeable delay. Also, consider getting a more comfortable head strap with an extra battery pack if you plan on playing longer than 2 hours per session.
review_title: Perfect for Steam VR, but wifi can be laggy.

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my 12 year old daughter for Christmas.  It was supposed to be new.  When she first turned it on it went straight to a porn sight.  And then we found out that it had previously been linked to another guys Facebook account and had several porn accounts on it.  My 12 year old daughter saw a lot of things that should she should have never been exposed to.
