 Great experience, Beat Saber and Supernatural will close your circles fast. I just wish the headset had a longer battery life. I purchased the extended battery headstrap so that I can play longer. The other issue is I have 3 kids and you can only have 3 profiles on the headset so a second headset is needed for me and the wife. If you’re thinking about buy the Metaquest, think no further and just buy it. You won’t regret it!

I purchased the Oculus Quest 2, tried it once, got very sick and never put it on again. There should be a warning to people prone to motion sickness. I returned the item in pristine condition with all components and original packaging. I am shocked that even after their product made me physically ill, I have not received a full refund. I paid $488.62 and they are only refunding $434.91. As a Prime member, I am very disappointed.

This was such a cool experience trying the oculus quest 2 for the first time!  Was very easy to set up as long as your Facebook acct is up to date since it uses that to sign in! No regrets here! Worth every bit of money! Highly recommend!

…to enjoy this!  I was a little skeptical at first, but saw a few reviews of games. I love to dance.  Dance Central looked cool.  I love boxing.  There were a few games that looked cool.  I also thought Beat Sabre looked like fun.So. I took the plunge.  My first time trying it out was such a cool experience!  It was fun!  A good workout.  Well worth it!
review_title: You Don’t Have To Be A Kid…

one_reviews_text: The headset itself is great. I have had no issues with anything except for the comfort. I immediately ordered a replacement strap for the headset as i cannot wear it for more than 20 minutes without getting a headache. The head strap is thin and has big hard pieces jabbing into your head. Oculus offers a replacement strap, but it is $50 MSRP and from what I have heard it isn’t even good quality, with multiple people reporting it breaking after little use. Overall, I recommend the headset, but it is (to me at least) necessary to have a head strap replacement ASAP.

We love the oculus itself- it works very well! I wish the store had more games to try before buying, but what is offered is nice. The only issue with this purchase is that the charger completely doesn’t work.  I plugged the cord into my computer and it charges very slowly (at least 8 hours for a full charge) but if the charger issue I would have given this 5 stars
review_title: Oculus is great, charger doesn’t work

one_reviews_text: I like it, yknow, it kinda sucks Facebook has a wall on it. But I rarely used my Facebook so It doesn't bother me that much. Keep in mind if you are going to use a link cable and you have a nice pc. Make sure you turn it up to 90hz on the oculus desktop app, it fixed ghosting for me and made it really smooth. Also I recommend buying a new headstrap, I didn't use the oculus one I got a KIWI brand head strap. I highly advise newcomers to the vr space to do research on this thing, it definitely  helps you understand it more. So a 4 just because the setup itself was annoying and the headstrap it comes with is pretty bad, and facebook. But a good value overall.

The Oculus Quest 2 is fun to use. This is our first VR system and found it easy to use and setup. The games we have tried are entertaining and fun. We have tried Bait, Medal of Honor and others. While playing have fallen down trying to lean on things in the game, have to remember its VR. Scared of heights, watch out then, this game will test that. Overall great fun and easy to get addicted to it.

The experience is amazing and the hand tracking and controller tracking is on point. The game library is lacking tho, and I regret my purchase because since the game library is lacking I don’t even play it. I picked it up and played it for the first week and it just stays in its case now. It’s not worth buying unless the library grows.
review_title: It’s great for what it does

one_reviews_text: So i have had the Quest 2 now for almost a month....*1st- off i would like to say the visuals are beyond great..*2nd- id have to say it does come with some limitations on some vr games...*3rd- I would highly recommend not getting the official link cable with it from my experience there is way better 3rd party link cables you can buy for a lot cheaper that work way better...*4th- if you intend to play Steam Vr Games you will need a link cable for best connection...All in all in my opinion its a good VR headset to start off with but would definately recommend getting a better VR headset down the road!!!
review_title: Not the greatest Vr Headset But is amazing for the price!

one_reviews_text: The only choice if you want to try out VR for the first time. The resolution is great, super easy to use, Air Link works fine, so you can play AAA titles like Half-Life Alyx, WIRELESSLY. The original strap is not that good though, I'd say it's pretty uncomfortable. People say playing with glasses is impossible, but in my case I didn't have any issues, the glass spacer does its job well (I'm still going to buy contact lenses, and highly recommend you doing the same, if you have really bad vision like I do). If you hate Facebook, there is Oculess, but I'm ok with it and don't care that much.For Russians and other europeans, buying an adapter from American type plug is VITAL, because you just wouldn't able to charge the headset.In conclusion, I think it's the best headset on the market so far, consider buying it, if you want to get into the VR world as a newcomer.
review_title: The best one to dive into VR for the first time

one_reviews_text: This is what I have been waiting for a long time. I have tried all kinds of VR headsets. This by far is the best one so far. It's portable, no wires graphics and everything built in. Hand tracking, sharp display wireless Airlink with PC software 128gb adequate storage compared with 64gb of the previous version. 3D sound is amazing as well. Hours of fun. Plug n play!

This is simply the best, Don’t worry about Facebook watching you play. Because they don’t! The VR experience is amazingly good. Just as good as the Vive 1.  At this time nothing is beating quest two portability. And I mean nothing! You have to remember that the makers of quest two before Facebook bought the company was excellent designer

If you're shopping for a grandchild/niece/nephew who asked for a "VR Headset," buy this one.Functionally, this headset is nearly perfect, especially for the price. The only problem with this headset is that it is owned by Facebook (now Meta), a company with some questionable ethics to say the least. As a VR enthusiast, I am not at all a fan of the walled garden Facebook is trying to build with their "Quest ecosystem," especially since I mainly use this headset with a link cable and SteamVR.
review_title: Simply the best option out there right now

one_reviews_text: For me I didn’t like the movement inside most games. It would become easily nauseating. I have the PSVR and have only had that issue with one of the games so far, other than that, the PSVR is superior to the Oculus 2 as far as smoothness being in the game. For a beginner headset you would be happy with the oculus for the money but if you’re looking for better immersive play with more game options, you’re looking at spending around a grand.
review_title: Beginner VR. Not Quite There Yet.

one_reviews_text: I got this specifically to play Supernatural to exercise after a friend let me try hers.  Now my husband and I (both in our 40s) use it daily.  Mostly for exercise but my husband also loves the golf game and I have a dance one I like.  Neither of us have ever been gamers, but even just for the exercise it’s worth every Penny!

Finally arrived late this am, I did two sessions after setup and spent what little was charged on the battery when it came. It’s charging now…one session was target practice w “bats” and the other intro to boxing which was very challenging for me and I petered out halfway through. As far as I can see it’s worth every penny I spent on it!

I recieved the first device and noticed several pinpoints of light when on a dark screen. Compared to a friend's and thiers did not do this. Returned and received another. This one had the same issue, not as bad just one spot. Returning and buying from a brick and mortar store, these may be remanufactured......
review_title: It's great, but I would not buy from Amazon

one_reviews_text: I've been playing video games since Intellivision had the console with paddles ( a very long time) and this is so realistic I literally had to turn it off for fear I'd fall!  Never been anything like this before, if you want an experience , this is it! Well worth the price! And games are not very expensive. $40 buck max!!!

I have been trying for years to find something that my husband wants and will actually use.  He hounded me for a drone and got it for Christmas 2020.  He never used it and gave it to our son.  So when I saw this and the reviews were so good I decided to try again.  He absolutely loves it and now I get 1 hour of quiet time every evening.  Thank you Oculus.

Not developped enough apps to support the device. Pairing with FB (through mobiles or desktop) doesn't work, it ends up in an endless cycle. Therefore the device can't be used. Returning it 10.000 km away unfortunately.
review_title: Pairing with FB doesn't work, both on Mobile & PC

one_reviews_text: i had been looking into VR, but buying an entire game system and then a VR separate was a bit much...this is all I need...super easy setup, super cool and super fun...lots of different games and stuff to try out...i love this
review_title: most important? Is Super Cool important :)

one_reviews_text: I bought the oculus for best saber and other cool games. I spent $200 on new games and the glitch in the system deleted my profule and games. Tried talking to customer service they said wait for an email. Been almost 2 weeks, no emails, no fixed oculus account. They won't give me a refund for the games I bought. I would not recommend this gaming system, until all the bugs are worked out. Otherwose you could end up like me or some of my other family that have experienced this. Yes they do know about the deleting of profiles and apps. So all they will tell you to do is wait.
I waited a while to post a review. The initial VR experience is incredible. The games suck. The setup is painful. Skyrim is broken. It's like if Star Wars in black and white.

After 3 months I do not like this thing. Oculus 2 is a cool idea and it's a good start on the VR experience.  The interface needs help, the hardware is very early stage, and the overall experience is cute.  I think I spend more time futzing with the fit of my headset or trying to get the focus right or moving around to adjust the perspective.

This product plagued with issues pairing with a phone or a computer making the product unusable.  Issues also occur in the headset software itself.  I can't reset anything on the headset and the oculus app on a phone and the computer has problems linking with accounts.  Very disappointed at this point.  If they fix their systems I will revisit this review.

At first it seems really cool, but after awhile the bad outweighs the good.  Constantly crashes, disconnects and image shakes.  Requires fb account to use, goodbye privacy.  App communicates with fb in background even when headset not in use and even if not signed into fb, cannot turn this off.  Hard to setup so that focus is consistent.  Frequently loses tracking and requires constant resetting of guardian.  Cannot transfer stored files to PC or other storage media, even when connected to PC.

We were skeptical about this since it doesn’t hook to a computer like the one my oldest so has, but we didn’t want to sink the money into a computer powerful enough to run that Oculus  for my 14 year old. This was the perfect compromise! It’s great for kids and even has enough games available for purchase to keep adults happy!!
What do I hate? Facebook REQUIRES you to sign-in to your Facebook account so they can track everything you do in the virtual world.  I have never opened a Facebook account and I never will.

无法加载媒体。
                



 Enjoying with the family, good VR headsets, good for all ages.You really feel like you are in the game.

Ive had this system for a week and everyday I tell my husband how wonderful it is. I dont have to set up,  just put on my head and go! I love robo recall and beat saber and the dance one. I get exercise and def some cardio.  I do before work,  during lunch and after work. I cant wait for sat so i can do all day long! 😍
review_title: Dont kbow how I lived without it for so long!

one_reviews_text: It speaks for itself. Very good game module. It’s like a walking PS4 or XBox or Wii. Only beef is it is Facebook and well that’s all. But if you don’t mind that then log in and use what ever extended features that offers. You can’t (I haven’t seen yet) just create an Occulus account.But it is fun and the experience is pleasurable.

Been playing VR for the first time the past few days, very fun and immersive. I haven't really experienced much motion sickness other than climbing in certain games. The videos made for VR are pretty awesome and a new experience. I have yet to link it to my gaming PC to experience that aspect of it.

Pros:- Incredibly immersive experiences- Make work out fun by slashing cubes to the rhythm of music- So many fun games- Comfortable weightCons:- Limited eye spacing options- Facebook account is required to useThe Occulus Quest 2 is by the best VR headset available at the moment. It requires no advanced setup and the interface is extremely intuitive. I am so content with my purchase.

This headset seems like nice hardware but requires a facebook account to use.  I never made one before, so I did from the oculus app today only to immediately have it locked (before entering any profile information!)Currently this headset is $300 of useless plastic garbage, and unless facebook gets this sorted out in the next few days I will be returning this.

This product said that it would be shipped in a new condition but I can say with 100% confidence that it was not new. The box it came it said "Oculus Quest 2" which wasn't too surprising at first but then I realized that at the time of me buying the product that it should've said "Meta Quest 2" instead. Also when I opened the box one of the controllers had a smudge on the top of it. And after less than a month of me buying the product it just breaks, every time I turn it one the entire screen turns into whatever color the majority of the screen is making it almost impossible to play anything. I did not drop it or hit it on anything and made sure to take extra good care of it since this was one of my most expensive purchases.

I've had the GO, the Quest 1 and now this. This is pretty amazing. The resolution looks great. As everyone else has said the stock headstrap is pretty cheap so I got the Elite headstrap. Ping Pong is amazing in VR.

I bought the Oculus Quest 2 a while back. I sold it, regretted selling it, and bought it again. This thing is just too much fun. It's like having a portable arcade. The graphics are great when you consider it's a portable VR system, the sound is great and they continuously update the software for the device to include new features.PROS- Great graphics- Fun games- Fully wireless- Great for fun workoutsCONS- May cause motion sickness (as with any VR headset)
review_title: Bought it, sold it, and re-bought it!

one_reviews_text: Definitely not for people who are prone to headaches or migraines. My son loves it although it has a very poor selection of games. If you are thinking about getting one hopefully you own a pc or android so you can download sidequest or applab and get more games. Highly suggest looking into games and apps outside of oculus store.
The Oculus is amazing! If you get it, you have to do Richies plank AND find a hidden surprise in the elevator! We have had so much fun with this!
review_title: If you don't have one, you need one!

one_reviews_text: I am completely in love with this thing. I use it only for workouts, really, and I'm addicted. I can't wait to work out every day. I fell in love with the Quest when I used a friend's for a minute and bought one immediately. You will want accessories and games, of course, so plan for that. But this thing is amazing!
review_title: This is the best thing ever

one_reviews_text: We have stupid and strange rules in Ukraine about packages. I don't know how it works but I had to pay 25% more for the Quest 2 for getting it (around $75). I was shocked because I have never paid that 25% before when I order import goods. I wanted to request a refund but Amazon decided to help me and they paid that 25% instead of me. I appreciate it. The Headset is awesome. Anyway you have to buy a good wifi 6 router for around $100 and some accessories like swords for Beat Saber, another strap, etc. So get ready to pay more than $300. Btw at first I wanted to play using Oculus Link but my AsRock z370 Extreme 4 motherboard doesn't have any type-c drivers lol. After that I decided to buy a wifi 6 router and I wasn't disappointed. Air Link has an awesome quality and low latency. Thank you Amazon for the Headset and help.
review_title: My first order and VR experience

one_reviews_text: This is second breath after my PSVR. Very useful that it can be standalone and great to play with no wires. Will work something around two hours with no charge, which is pretty solid (considering my avg session time 1:30-2:00).Very recommended to buy a halo strap as helmet does not distribute weight on your head in the best way.The only thing I didn't like is that silicon mask cover is a bit bigger that it should be and there is folds  because of it. Anyway it doesn't bother me physically. Just need to place it correctly sometimes before wearing.
review_title: Top VR set for it's price

one_reviews_text: Although I did not open the one I purchased cause someone else beat me to the punch and gave my grandson one before I could give him the one I purchased we all played with the one that was given to him. The graphics are very good the game kept everyone there busy laughing I am not a gamer but a grandma and this machine is amazing

I'm a VR user since 2014 with the Oculus DK2, then I had an Oculus CV1, then an Oculus Rift S, and now a Quest 2. I tried the Quest 2 as standalone, then using AirLink, and lastly using a Cable.I think the Rift S is a better product, just works. If you are going to use the Quest 2 as a standalone is a great great product, but if you want to replace your PC VR, is not.For me, it's a 6.5/10 but if you are new, this could be a 9/10
review_title: If this is your first VR HMD...

one_reviews_text: Frustrating out of the box experience. It would try to boot up but crash and read No command with a little green man on his back with his chest open.  Software glitch on start up had me spending an hour online looking how to get this thing into a set up mode so I could factory rest it. I was 2 seconds away from returning it when it rebooted and actually powered on. I’ll update this if the user experience is extra special but so far I’m just frustrated with a mild headache. Now I wait for it to update..Following day, apart from the set up frustration and very slow updating the headset is something special.  Can’t wait to actually try out the apps and stuff but for now it’s working and kinda cool.

I bought this for my boys. I haven't personally use it, but they can't say enough good things about it! They said that it is more fun than they anticipated, so I take that as a win! As a bonus--it is hilarious to watch them while they have it on! Make sure you have plenty of room, though. One son ran into a wall and the other punched the bricks. haha

Games are reasonably priced and the VR world is set up very organized. Pay the extra money and get more memory. There are a lot of games you can download and play. I had to buy a case after the fact. The eyes adjust in spacing and there is volume on the headset itself. I wish the battery lasted longer but it’s pretty amazing.

There are so many different things you can do on an Oculus. I love all the worlds you can explore and become fully submerged in. It’s even fun to use to browse apps like Instagram and YouTube. I gave it four stars because when I wear it for more than about five minutes, I start to get a headache, but I’m sure they’re working on making the next gen of Oculus lighter and more user-friendly. Otherwise, this device is so fun and totally worth the price!
review_title: Such a fun gadget to have!

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 is absolutely amazing! At $300, the 128gb version is a steal for the quality hardware, huge App Store & excellent performance. There’s really no need to buy the 256gb version or any of the accessories. Sure, the games cost extra but there are tons of free games available if you dig!Get off the couch & move around while you game! Several games easily trick you into working out without you even being aware of it… until you’re sweating & winded!No, it’s not the best but the current king of vr, the Valve Index, requires an extremely powerful gaming pc to plug into and is over $1200 just for the hardware. Quest 2 is nearly as good, has an App Store & is standalone (wireless.) Easy choice!
review_title: The best vr option for the price. No question!

one_reviews_text:
Video Player is loading.Play VideoPlayMuteCurrent Time 0:00/Duration 0:01Loaded: 100.00%0:00Stream Type LIVESeek to live, currently behind liveLIVERemaining Time -0:01 1xPlayback RateChaptersChaptersDescriptionsdescriptions off, selectedSubtitles字幕关闭, selectedAudio Trackdefault, selectedFullscreenThis is a modal window.


 Estar inmerso con estas gafas VR son una experiencia única.  La versatilidad, aplicaciones de todo tipo y si sumamos la conectividad con la PC por Oculus Airlink, cable Link, Virtual Desktop, etc., hacen de este dispositivo una joya en el mundo de realidad  virtual.

Purchased this for my boy for his 14th birthday. He was super excited and downloaded a bunch of games. It was easy for him to set up and he has even connected it to his pc to play more games. I love that he plays job simulation games as well as others for fun. I found the best price here.

Got it for my husband for Christmas, bought myself one three days later. I can’t remember the last time I habitually worked out. I’m a mom of four with NO time. Now my husband and I rage it till 2-3AM every night when the kids go to bed, sweating profusely and competing against each other.Now we’re considering getting the kids sets for birthdays.. so worth the money. Get one now.
review_title: Best decision I’ve made all year

one_reviews_text: Upon unboxing this item, the screen didn’t work. You could only see about an inch of the display and the rest was complete static. Trying to troubleshoot, we finally were able to get to a screen where we could look around and found that it was logged in to another user’s Facebook account! I’m guessing this user returned the item because of the static issue, and Amazon turned around and resold it to me. I’m shipping this back but it will take close to 2 weeks to receive a replacement. Completely ridiculous!

I would have rated this product a 5 star if it came with those head adjuster you can purchase separate. The elastic band that it comes with is super uncomfortable and whenever I’m playing a high intensity game like boxing, I get a blur vision as the headset eventually moves. I also wish it came some cool games for free and that it came with its case by default as it is quite an expensive product. Other than that really awesome experience. Love that it sets room boundary so that I don’t run into furnitures while playing

Extremely hard on your eyes.  The games are 2000 era graphics.  You can’t play other vr games off your PC with it.  You must buy games from their “play” store.  Some of the games are half a game.  The vr movies aren’t HD.

Can play vr steam games comfortably such as phamophobia and vr chat on my laptop (has a 1660ti graphics card with a ryzen 7 3750h processor). Although I had problems linking it to my computer at first (was just stuck on a dark screen with 3 dots), I was able to fix it by just updating some drivers (oh and make sure you have a high speed usbc cable). Overall, an extremely fun and budget friendly experience 👍
review_title: Works pretty well with PC and is fun on its own

one_reviews_text: Have only purchased World 1 War game. It is great! As i mentioned one go to you tube for  info, flying is very sensitive. .am a licensed pilot, enjoying some old time experiences. Buy it , you will love it!
Don't like it

Don't get me wrong this gadget is really cool because you get to interact with artificial objects as if it was reality. There are many flaws with this however. For instance, graphics are terrible in pretty much every game. The worst part about the whole system is that it has given me so much motion sickness to the point that I start getting migraines and the sensation of throwing up.

The device was so simple to set up. I have asked myself several times already that  I should have bought one of these sooner.I bought the 256Gb Oculus. Granted I don't believe I have a need for all that space. The games and such are small. I downloaded one that I thought would be massive.  Game was only 1.08 Gbs.

Got this for exercise and not disappointed. Makes exercise feel like fun when using Supernatural and Beat Sabers....it is a lot of fun and relaxing watching some of the VR videos 360 underwater and nature travel like you are physically there and relaxing. Bought one as well for my sister, husband and both my kids after trying it.

Honestly my husband, kids and I have seen so many people playing this Virtual game for about a year now. I can defiantly say to you or anyone that this is by far the best game system ever. It feels so real at times I get a little scared myself. My kids are the ages 5 and 7 and they absolutely love this game. I hate that they are in the buy every game stage lol. But if you're asking for my opinion, I would definitely say it's a great buy.
review_title: Not Speaking for Everyone else But........

one_reviews_text: Our oculus quit working and after trouble shooting with Amazon they said we had a one year manufacture warranty and to contact oculus. We did and they said to send in the headset and within 2-3 days they would send a replacement, THAT WAS 45 DAYS AGO!!! They just keep saying they have a back up in the warehouse and blowing me off when I ask!! So disappointed in customer service!
review_title: Broke in one month - Warranty Fail

one_reviews_text: If you are not aware, Facebook requires age verification of 13 years or older. You MUST have a Facebook account to use this device. If you lie and are caught, you lose all of your apps and permissions.
review_title: Not for anyone under 13 Years of age

one_reviews_text: So I caved and got the quest 2 I was so excited to get it trying it previously cause a family member had it. But.... When I received mine it arrived bricked stuck at the usb menu and boot looping I then spenr 2 hours trying to fix it and contacting support just to be told this issue has been around since it came out and is "unfixable" im sure there's a way to fix it but they told me to return it and get a replacement I will update my review when I receive my replacment oculus

I'm so disappointed. I've waited so long to get my hands on one of these things but they've been sold out everywhere. Now I realize I have 300$ paper weight due to the companion app to log into Facebook with refuses to work. Witch to me is just redundant being that the quest is a device witch uses the internet and has a web browser built in but you need a separate app and device to get it setup? Why. Just why. TLDR: It's useless without this stupid app make sure it works before wasting your money.
review_title: Before buying this make sure the app will work

one_reviews_text: It was fairly easy to setup. Only minor issue was how to install the glasses spacer and  rubber piece. I do wear glasses and Im able to view it with them on and its comfortable. I also used their refund policy for a bought app that I didnt like. Very happy with it and we bought a 2nd one and added it to our existing account.

Bought the Quest 2 for use in the cockpit of MS FlightSim 2020.  It works well for that for sure.  Lots of help on-line to get it setup to work well with the flight simulator.  I also tried several other apps in the Oculus Store and the SideQuest site.  I ultimately found the SuperNatural App to be a great motivator for me to exercise more.  The app promotes full body movement for great workouts  to a great collections of music.  SuperNatural  does require a monthly subscription, but it is much less than a monthly fitness club payment that I probably would only use a couple times a week.
review_title: Bought for Flight Sim but Fitness Apps Turned Out a Hit

one_reviews_text: With all this crazy in the world, it feels good to have a fun and safe escape...Oculus Quest 2 gives me just that. I absolutely love this thing! It is so much better than the VR headsets where you need your smartphone in my opinion...the sound quality is nice, the resolution is very sharp. It is pricey but so worth it.

With apps like Virtual Desktop and a good router and connecting to your PC, this easily becomes one of the best PC VR headsets, and the fact it also works stand alone is great. Due to this as well, it can be used wirelessly. Only down side is the not-so-great head strap. You can easily get yourself a 3rd party one that is way better (and cheaper) than the official pro head strap, but that quickly raises the price into the realm of other headsets that come with better head straps out of the box.Just make sure you have plenty of play space and be careful not to hit walls, or low ceilings! Your hands and controllers will thank you.
review_title: AMAZING headset, don't let the price fool you.

one_reviews_text: Ok not sh!+ this is so much fun I'm 40 and this thing has my old a$$ moving around like I'm 20 I'm sore from blade and sorcery that game is awesome and dont play it til you can get a cable or do it via airplay and get it on steam next game is boneworks get that game 1st unlock the sandbox mode so you have something to do to recover if your old like me then get beat saber and get all the jams from the 80s and 90s outside of that dont get scary stuff for 1st time users people tend to toss stuff
review_title: Dont get the cheapest  usb c cable go up to 30 or 40 bucks

one_reviews_text: Been using it at least 4-5 days a week for the last two months. We got it to play game but I've been using it to workout. Really enjoying the Supernatural app

Shipped very quickly & easy to set up. Many apps are available & you can spend a fortune if you’re not careful. Parents shoul be very careful in using shared rooms. Lots of shady characters out there. My wife & I use the golf and fitness app. Great entertainment & exercise. Limit your time on VR. It’s bad on your eyes & neck.

This is my first VR headset, one of my brothers allowed me to try his Oculus headset in a family reunion, and I was blown away. Since that experience, I was sold, and I decided to get one of my own. I have to say, this Oculus quest is way better than TV. I use it whenever I get the chance.  The reason for the 4 stars is due to the battery life; it would be nice if the headset would have a longer battery life, I can roughly get around 2 and 3 hours of play. Other than that, I like it, and I am looking forward to play the games and eventually, use them with Second Life and Sansar VR.
review_title: Great VR headset, would recommend for those starting in VR experiences.

one_reviews_text: I went and purchased an 8k 180° 3D VR camera to start  shooting weddings and events because of this thing. I wish every picture and video I have ever taken was in this format. This Oculus VR system is so much more than gaming!! Love it. Wish Messenger would integrate better to play games and open pictures. Also wish it didn't step back from where ti was when you pull it off your head to share with someone else. Other than that... incredible.

It's fantastic as a device. I had an htc vive which cost a thousand and this is better. The screendoor effect is almost gone. Easy to get immersed. The obvious huge flaw is that it needs Facebook... if you can get past that then it's the best. Also get a battery pack for extended life.
review_title: Incredible value. Good introduction into vr

one_reviews_text: I purchased one, received a defective one with a permanent glare on the screen, exchanged it, then received a dirty one with a scratched lens.They're just swapping broken headsets over there.The headset is fun, but this products are upsetting and take away from the experience.

I got this because of being stuck indoors during the pandemic.It’s got good exercise games on it and I actually sweat playing games too!Very fun and very physical. People actually lose weight doing the exercise games too.Virtual reality is the future and this is great way to start! Very worth it!

I purchased a second Oculus 2 in hopes that I could join my family and play side by side with them, but none of my games allow us to do this without purchasing the game again.  Rediculous!! I'm be retuning it!!
Had to send in my first one due to cooling issue Amazon made it difficult at first cause some site error but finally replaced  hope the media syncing will be better as well

I bought this for my wife and she loves it. Actually the view is comparable to my Valve index. Crisp, light but like any VR, can make you motion sick depending on the game etc. you use it for. The not included pc cord is over priced and should be included for this price point.

The quest 2 is an amazing deal. Where most vr journeys begin with buying a beefy PC then getting a headset this allows you to begin and even end with a standalone headset that gets the job done just fine. If you’re even remotely interested in vr just buy it. Fair warning it’s not perfect, the graphics are great considering it’s running on essentially a suped up smart phone chip, but they’re still a bit limited. If you’re wanting insane graphics then I guess wait till you get a PC, but even then you can buy this now, enjoy it until you can get a decent PC and then just get a link cable. I have no regrets purchasing this

Yet another product invading data privacy.  This product REQUIRES you to link your Oculus and Facebook accounts. There is no option for setting up a stand alone account and not interacting with others.  I will be returning my unit.Further, Although it is a "Prime" product, it took almost 2 weeks to reach me.  Amazon Prime used to get the products to you more quickly (Which is why I pay for it), but Amazon just puts this tag on everything now regardless of when they can get it to you.
review_title: WARNING: Must link to Facebook account.  No other option

one_reviews_text: This device does it all, it provides  entertainment and much needed cardio. The clarity is unbelievable,  you will actually think you are in the environment. Since the pandemic this device provides what I need to still enjoy each day without outside contact while still being able to enjoy the company of my friends.
You have to have Facebook account, not willing to do that
review_title: You have to be on Facebook, not willing to do that

one_reviews_text: I had some account issues due to a system error on Meta's side. It has also frozen a few times after leaving it idle for a while after using Air Link.But when it works (which is most of the time), it's so easy to set up a boundary and start playing. The pass-through features also work really well to make sure you don't accidentally bump into a pet or toddler.
review_title: Great user experience when it works

one_reviews_text: I own five gaming consoles so I'm pretty into gaming but after playing this I cant go back to consoles it has no cords getting in your way everything is 3d the graphics aren't the best but I don't even need a pc to run anything thats insane! dont get me wrong I was skeptical at first but watch YouTube videos study up this is honestly an amazing console and pretty damn cheap at 300 dollars lol if your skeptical look into it this is worth the money

I've been a pc gamer for many years, and now just got into VR gaming. The Quest 2 is a perfect choice for those who are new to VR gaming.In my opinion, the whole Facebook account thing isn't a big deal. It's just people adding more drama towards this product. You do not have to use your actual FB account. Just make another account for your VR.All in all, this is a great VR period.
review_title: Great choice for new VR gamers

one_reviews_text: This thing really blew my mind.  I cant believe how immersive it is.  And the more I learn to use it the better it gets.  I'm older (60) so dont think this is just for kids  but they will love it too.  Take the leap and get one, it  is a whole lot of fun for not a whole lot of money (relative to what it does).

Loved the experience of playing with the Oculus. Getting to jump around and play with the different apps will have on for quite some time. The battery life is excellent and it's cool to break out when friends come over. The only con is after extended use of the Oculus you might experience dizziness /headache.
This product is very disappointing, not at all what I had expected, everything is now controlled by Facebook which I will never use. The oculus Go was my last VR system which was a better concept.
review_title: Not a giant leap for VR

one_reviews_text: I purchased beatsaber and within seconds of loading any song it freezes and is unplayable. I have requested a refund but am told it may take days. Funny how that works, they take my money with no delay, but if I want that same money back 20 minutes later, they need all this time to process it. Considering returning the headset before the amazon return window is up as this is not promising.Another thing to note: If you have glasses, the experience can be rather uncomfortable and negatively affects picture quality.
review_title: Lacks processing power to keep up with apps it is marketed with

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my 12 year old grandson for his 2021 Christmas present from me, and he seems to really enjoy using it. I'm 66 years old, and I haven't really been a gamer since I played Pong in the early 1970's. But after reading so much about the Oculus Quest 2 online, I wanted my grandson to have one.

This is great and has a realistic feeling. Awesome purchase to break up the monotony of working from home. It allows you to watch movies on Netflix and Amazon, browse the Internet, ride roller coasters, run with dinosaurs, and much more. I enjoy it as an adult and the kids and friends will get a kick out of it too. Controls were fairly easy to learn...I would say overall it takes about 2-3 hours of use to get used to the controls. There are a lot of free games and excercise apps to download and you can cast what your viewing or playing to your cell phone via WiFi!

The device was received in operable but when I contacted Amazon before they even received the one that I returned I had a new one at my front door the best customer service and response I’ve ever received in my entire life gives me great comfort in knowing that if I have issues in the future with an item returning or exchanging would be lightning fast

Don't think about buying this headset. Just do it, like literally. Yeah it's a little expensive but it's well worth it. My children and I tried out a VR headset for the first time at my brother's house and we were in love. When my son asked for this for Christmas, I didn't think twice. It's easy to travel with and share the fun. From my youngest child of 7 all the way to my 60 year old step father, everyone has had an amazing time with this VR headset. Beatsaber is a must buy. The only complaint I've heard so far is that minecraft isn't VR yet. 😂

As far as the device itself, I give 5 stars it is great. But I purchased this because it advertised that it came with a $50 electronic credit versus one that came with a case. This was a gift for a teenager so I thought better to have a credit for games than the case.....after opening it, when I called to ask how to apply the credit, I was told that I was supposed to add some promo code at check out. That is not what was advertised.  There was no promo code to type in! I was asked if I took a screen shot of the offer. Didn't know I should have but do now! I was told there was absolutely nothing they could do. So for the experience,  I rate it 3 stars.

This was purchased as a Christmas gift for my son and it was the perfect gift. Actually I gave it to him about 2 weeks early. He has said that it's really fun and loves it. I thought it was expensive but then again what do I know about virtual headset's and as long as it makes him happy then it's all worth it.

If you're going for a VR headset for pc play, get the HTC Vive; it's more expensive, but it is worth every penny compared to the Quest 2.Facebook(Meta) had the big brained idea of making the link cable port the same as the charging port. Normally this wouldn't be too bad, but the cable that is used is a usb c, a connector that can barely grab into the headset while in use.Functionality, it is far worse than previous oculus headsets (poor controller tracking, front sensors, ect) The only upside to the Quest 2 over say the Rift S, is it's weight; it is far lighter than other headsets. But that is a foot note compared to my problems with the Quest 2
review_title: Not worth the plastic it was made with

one_reviews_text: I’m a grown and sexy woman who never thought that I would be excited to be playing games and working out at the same time let alone with something on my face lol. This is so much fun and I have actually lost weight and it was effortless because it was so much fun doing it. Buy it and have yourself some fun……
review_title: Hurry up and get yourself one

one_reviews_text: Why oh why are there so many graphics cards this unit is incompatible with? My daughter has an MSI GAMING laptop, and the 1650 gsx card is, apparently, incompatible with the Oc2.Why oh why do you have to have a Facebook account to use this? My daughter is too young to have a facebook account, yet it is required to use the Oc2.Why oh why does Amazon promote this as having a $50 gift card, then ONLY honors that if you click a tiny box when you add the unit to your cart. This is deceptive advertising.

Well thought out and designed great.  Works with PC VR Oculus and Steam titles over AirLink via 5 GHz Wifi 6 great.  Many "experimental" features are a must have.  Perfect price point for my VR needs.  Have ended up purchasing allot of third party accessories to make it even better for me.
review_title: 256GB was a must.  Great piece of kit for the price

one_reviews_text: Realize that your favorite old software may not take advantage of the sharper viewing. Newer programs do and wow it's great to see things in more detail. What really makes this unit better is the additional battery in back of your head which balances the load. Then it's perfect!

CONS: It doesn't seem to take that long before needing to charge. Really wish there was a "MY GAMES" section that you can find your own uploaded games faster.PROS: Super easy to set up,.... If I can do it myself..... ANYONE can do it!!! Once I get the external battery addition, I am going to have HOURS of entertainment!!!! LET THE FUN BEGIN!!!!

The product itself is awesome, no complaints. It's insanely fun and you will love it. The problem was that I purchased it under the pretense that I would get a $50 Amazon credit upon purchase which has not been the case.  Upon research, it appears that many of us are having this problem and right now especially $50 is a huge deal and could benefit a lot of people to have that at their disposal.  Very disappointed in this aspect of my purchase and had I known I wouldn't have gotten the credit, I might have opted on a different purchase or looked to buy from a different retailer.  C'mon man that's just not right to do to people.

Second one I have purchased for my grandson. He loves it. Interacts with other players on diff levels. For a yr of the pandemic this helped my 11 yr old from going stir crazy. Things started going wrong with the first one, prob due to everyday use. So, I got him a new one for Christmas.
review_title: Makes for a quick thinking brain

one_reviews_text: So I’ve bought the headset, played maybe 40-60 hours tops than suddenly it didn’t turn on again, tried everything that I could to get it to work but it didn’t.I’ve sent the headset as per the support told me - they said I should get a replacement in case it’s malfunctioned within 2-3 days to be shipped to me. HAHAHA it’s been another 16 DAYS since they’ve told me they will send a new headset and I should get the shipping tracking number “shortly” what a scam. Feels like they “stole” my headset. Not sure why it supposed to be so bad sending a new headset as replacement after confirming it was bad.Worst experience I’ve ever had.
review_title: Worst customer service ever! Died in under a month!

one_reviews_text: Great quality, I love these things! I am a true lover of aviation, the WW1 and Wings over the Pacific upgrade for WW2 is alot of fun... I used to have the Samsung VR2 glasses, but I had to insert my phone, these are soooooo much better working off my Wi-Fi...

My 47 year old wife was never a gamer but she is now!!! The house is a wreck and supper is always late!!! We got one for her and one for me so now we can meet up in virtual world with our grown son and daughter-in-law who live miles away..its so impressive. Definitely worth the money!!

por lo general es un buen dispositivo , tiene buena calidad de imagen, es cómodo de usar,  el air link es genial ya que no hay necesidad de conectar el dispositivo al pc para poder jugar los juegos de steam , como contras los juegos que tiene la tienda interna son muy limitados siendo los mejores juegos beatsaber y superhot y lo unico malo que encuentro como diseño es la correa que no es muy segura y en cualquier momento se romperá por desgaste ( pero se puede mejorar comprando una de mejor calidad aca en amazon) , puntos a mejorar creo que los mandos se puedan recargar mediante usb, ya que no es muy ecológico usar pilas ya en estos tiempos.

Great for wireless PCVR as well as the standalone games from oculus. 2 weeks later the right controller started to drift, have to use contact cleaner to fix it. Air link works great, though i had to get a new wifi router (MUST be wifi 6, with high bandwidth). Link cable does look sharper though but the cable is annoying and for most games the wireless is better. It has decent resolution that is very clear (no grid/screen effect). Battery lasts for about 2 hours, with a powerbank attached It goes for way more, ~ 6 hours.Been playing both native and PCVR games and loving it, just the controller drift was annoying

Me and my husband have been wanting this product for a while and finally decided to purchase it and WE COULDN'T BE HAPPIER!! It has so many different games and apps and virtual worlds . It’s super amazing and a GREAT GIFT BUY

First off I love the oculus. It's awesome except....The first one I got had a dead pixel. I got a new one quick as hell. The problem was amazon. They were supposed to pick up the defective one. I stayed home all day but all they did was leave a shipping label and didn't take the old one. Customer service was terrible and blew me off. So now I have to take more time off and drop it off myself. Should have just bought it in store.
review_title: watch out for dead pixels and amazon support is garbage

one_reviews_text: I love how you can use all the current streaming apps on it to watch movies and tv shows. I love watching Laser shows in 4K 3D and starscapes on YouTube V.R. I love the yoga stuff you can do with it as well.  Wish battery lasted as long as my phone battery. i can stream in the V.R. all day. Very happy with the product over all.

I can’t really review this. I bought this set up for my wife she told me she had been a good girl and that she wanted Santa to bring her this for Christmas so I did. About a month later she left me and took it with her so I don’t have any idea how it works.

Get a PC based system if you want to play immersive realistic games.Quest2 does not deliver what VR should; the graphics of the games,( I played Resident Evil, Sniper Elite and medal of honor)  remind me of the computer games of 20 years ago. PC games are much much better than this.There is not much choice for quest2 and all games are too cartoonish;Characters in quest2 games don't look like people, but look like mummies with fluorescent teeth.

I love the oculus, me and my brother play on it a lot. The first week of so was super fun, but it’s gets boring after a while. Also, the games are pretty expensive, so be prepared for that. Also, I wear glasses and they fit fine inside of it! Didn’t even need the extension! But, you definitely need to take breaks because it can make your head hurt when first playing!

This product works fine, but it made me sick with vertigo. I did not use it for more than twenty minutes when I started feeling very dizzy and nauseous. I am 60+ and have a cochlear transplant. It should be fine for someone younger with a good equilibrium.
review_title: It works okay, but it made me sick

one_reviews_text: This was purchased as a gift but I had an opportunity to give it a try. I have been playing video games since Pong and am totally amazed at the responsiveness of this machine. The graphics are not as good as Xbox or PlayStation but that was of little consequence because of the level of immersion.

I love the Quest 2 and the very simple pack it comes with. Easy to set up, sign in amd just play, almost right out the game. The only down side I can really give is on Facebook's end, making the really fun games $40.I mean, Beatsaber has been out for a hot minute and it's still 40 bucks, amd the games that are free, they leave you wanting more.But of course there's always Sidequest and all that, but as someone who isn't that tech savvy, I can't say anymore then this.If you wanna get one, go right ahead, but don't let your expectations get too high like I did.
review_title: System works great, but we need to have a word with Facebook...

one_reviews_text: Not very intuitive. Took 3 hours to get into 1 game that downloaded. Star Wars.  Keeps locking up, using the iPhone to view the player activity, locks up both devices and the network WiFi. Rebooting, updates, setting up the boundary, figuring out how to reset for other players. Need a Facebook account. I’ve been using VR for years, and not impressed with the Facebook version of VR. Hopefully it gets better.
review_title: VR has a Long way to go!

one_reviews_text: Amazing virtual reality device! Bought it on impulse after trying a friends. Love the options and how you feel immersed in the games. Joysticks / hand remotes remind me of Wii games. Hate that you have to continue to buy new games and music packs and that the battery life is poor.

The experience was more extraordinary than I first held an iPhone 4, especially for this price. Do not wait to try it if you are interested. The downside is that the band is a bit tight and some games give me motion sickness so I cannot use it for too long at one time.
review_title: What an experience. Definitely worth the price!

one_reviews_text: I gave heavily on a xbox series x with a msi gaming monitor so I thought this would lack in alot of different spots compared to my xbox. Once getting the headset adjusted it looked great and felt awesome playing. I played a 1500 pcvr setup maybe 4 years ago and this blows it out of the water. Vr has come a long way! Would have gotten 5 stars if i didn't have to link Facebook. Also I'm aware that if my Facebook gets banned I can't play the game I purchased with my money!!

Really love the apps, especially the nature inspired ones and YouTube VR.  My main gripe is a common one, I hate Facebook or Meta, whatever.  Creating an account was a pain, but I don’t ever post or do anything with it, so it’s not much of an issue rather than an annoyance.

1. I had to make a Facebook account to use - big problem for me.2. I became so dizzy I nearly fainted and I vomited twice.3. I’ve used it once and it went right back in the box4. For sure not for me.I wish I had sent this thing back.
review_title: Super dizzy after use- old people beware!

one_reviews_text: The headset works well and the resolution is an improvement over the previous model. I wasn't completly satisfy with the investment though. The strap feels uncomfortable. I find it anoying to have to calibrate my spatial area everytime i put on the headset for when i just want to watch a video in VR. The headset kind of looses the imersiveness because thr field of view isnt very wide, so i frel like im looking through a bilocular
review_title: Good quality inexpensive standalone VR headset

one_reviews_text: Still requires you to login to Facebook. Even if you login to Oculus they require you to link your fkn Facebook account!Very limited games selection.Not much in terms of compatability in modern AAA games currently without significant modding which is imperfect

I loved this product and love playing on it. I definitely recommend buying it. The one small problem I have is more with the company not the headset. If you had the quest 1 when it came out, like me, you would know it came with a long charger and a nice case that could fit the headset with a external back strap. This one comes with a short charger that you can’t play with and a not high quality case. The new headset also comes with a Velcro’s strap fully unlike the plastic quest 1 strap. This forces you to buy the pro head strap. A case that can fit everything, and a longer connect charger. They are doing this just trying to get more money I feel

Pros: hours of fun, fun for kids & adults, simple to set up, tons to games & entertainment options, charges quicklyCons: kids battle back because they dont want to turn it off ever! Not very many free options, so expect some initial extra expenses to download apps & games.

This is a great way to enter the world of VR and it’s no more expensive than a Nintendo switch and it’s cheaper than Xbox or play station. Look at the games available or exercise applications (which are really cool by the way) and see if it’s what you’re interested in. If so this product is perfect to let you explore that interest.
review_title: It’s great if you’re interested in the games!

one_reviews_text: We bought this for our 11 year old daughter. Trying to keep her off the phone and other devices. It worked, she loves it! It’s also great for the family. We play games together! And great to keep the family from the devices, tv and off the couch! Great games for cardio!

Very interesting product to experiment with.Not for everyone, but if you want to ride on a virtual roller coaster it's pretty spectacular.Watching Netflix in virtual reality big-screen when you don't have a big screen TV.Nice toy to experiment with.

It works great and graphics are amazing it comes with charger protective rubber sides. Also an attachment for those like myself who have glasses. The setup is easy (just sign up with your Facebook account) and then start enjoying it. The battery life is decent  I got up to 3hr and 30min of playtime they sell adapters to increase the battery life so its not a big deal. Plus I wouldn't recommend being on it too long, you start getting a little dizzy lol. But other than that, the shipping was fast and packaged well.
review_title: Great product. Love the hell out of it.

one_reviews_text: I bought this with the expectation of getting some apps to workout with from recommendation of a few tik tok people I follow.First, this things SUCKS if you have glasses. Their spacer that comes with it is pointLess. Secondly, NOTHING is free. There are “free apps” with a 14 day trial that then cost almost $200 a year. If I had known the cost of the games and apps, I wouldn’t have purchased this useless item. Now I can just pretend to ride a roller coaster or bobsled over and over while my glasses dig into my face and break in twoSave your money. This thing is worthless
El producto esta muy bueno. La calidad de la imagemes. La esperiencia del juego virtual esta brutal. Lo que no me gusto es que la bateria no dura mucho. Nose si sea asi o si fue el mio que salio asi.

I have the PS4 VR and the Oculus is 10 times better with exception to the fact that it doesn’t have Iron Man VR game on the Oculus beside that it’s definitely the one to own unless you need all the systems and what comes with them like me. If not just get the Oculus Quest 2

Say what you want about FB but when it comes to good VR, it's hard to beat at this price point. I love how it's all in one so no need to set up sensors or cables and rope off a designated area. You can just power it on and go like a virtual boy, or you can connect it to a PC using any USB C cable or Airlink so long as that PC meets minimum specs for VR.

Llegó sin ningún problema, temía un poco por el envio al ser un producto "frágil", pero venía bien protegido y llegó impecable.Vale cada peso, sus aplicaciones son tan variadas que sirve desde para jugar hasta trabajar, incluso para hacer ejercicio, así que lo recomiendo totalmente. La única recomendación, es que compres una correa de esas plásticas para reemplazar la correa de elásticos que trae, aunque no sea de la misma marca, mejora muchísimo, pero muchísimo la comodidad.El precio está súper igual, es más conveniente comprarlo por acá que en alguna tienda de Chile, incluyendo impuestos y aduana, aún así queda mucho más barato.
review_title: Si estás dudando en comprarlo, compralo! No te arrepentirás.

one_reviews_text: Very nice VR headset can’t believe the price for what you get you know. Just wish the Head-strap and the face piece where a little bit more comfortable and let’s not forget the battery but hey, the pros outweigh the cons I feel like. Very good VR experience especially for new beginners.
Only dislike is the battery life 2 hours is just not long enough especially if you really imursed in a game or a movie.
review_title: VR has come a long way!!!

one_reviews_text: Delivery in Russia was for 8 days and it was faster, than we thought.Don't forget buy adapter for plug, if you haven't american socket and wire for connet with computer for best expirience and for work with another shops (like steam).Oculus have good picture and high quality of sound for it price.Included all, what you need and have good and comfortable box for storage.You can start play in game on computer with GTX1050ti 4GB (ONLY WITH ti!).
review_title: It's a best thing for it price

one_reviews_text: I was hesitant to purchase an oculus wondering if it would get used enough. Games like Beat Saber provide a better cardio workout than walking, and I enjoy the competitiveness of ping-pong. The only downside is that it should come with a better head strap, but they are not too expensive to replace.
The Oculus Quest 2 is the best.  The workout programs are so good, that I actually want to workout.  The table tennis games are so real and really give me a workout.  I love this VR!!!
Easy to set up and use, our 4 year olds love the roller coaster and our 8+9 year olds love everything.  So much fun

The headset is very well done. The hardware is very well done, the item is well priced. I have not tried the headset without the Oculus Link cable yet, most of my hours are with a PC. I am giving it a 4 star though because it does require a Facebook account link, otherwise the headset is completely useless.
review_title: Good quality headset, downside of requiring facebook login tho

one_reviews_text: I wasn’t truly aware of how cool of a device I was purchasing. Trying to find a cool gift for my Grandsons birthday. Saw this a purchased & a carrying case. The only reason I couldn’t give it a five star, it would fall off durning use. It was a little heavy and uncomfortable. Once I purchased a better head attachment new foam for the face the extra devices added comfort and stability. With oculus quest 2, protection plan and all devices total price coming to $500. My grandson is now happy he can actually play with his birthdays gift.I recommend the Oculus Quest 2 just purchase all devices at time of purchase.
review_title: Had to purchase extra devices for conference instability

one_reviews_text: My 16-yr-old son purchased this with his summer job income and was not disappointed.  Not only has he thoroughly enjoyed the headset, but he has provided family entertainment at gatherings as well.  This is definitely a hit.  Great ease of use and graphics.  Would purchase again =)

This was a gift for my 13-year-old grandson and he was beyond overjoyed. As we all know as kids get older it’s harder to buy stuff for them. Granted he picked this out why not let him pick it out and buy something he won’t use? Yes it is a little bit pricey but well worth the money.

I am not a gamer but I LOVE this device! It does everything! You can play games, "ride rides", watch movies. I really want one for each family member including my Grandfather who is in his 90's. This thing is epic! Well worth the money. Treat your kid and treat yourself!

Wow, a fun world but it’s very heavy and caused me a headache. A migraine in fact.  It’s cheapAnd cheaply made. The lenses were off by several millimeters and with the billions of dollars Zuckerberg has, you’d think he’d release a better product. Nope.  I got a refund

Headset is lightweight, easy to use and has a great cordless feature. However you can only purchase games through the oculus store. I dont know if anyone else is having this issue but the Oculus store is broken! It will not allow you to add any form of payment so you can have games to use. Also it still requires you to add a Facebook account to use it! In essence it’s a very nice paperweight and there is NO tech support!
review_title: Love the headset itself, however it’s mostly useless.

one_reviews_text:
