 Definitely the best VR for the money you get soo much. And the VR experience is out of this world. Its soo emersive

i did not know what to expect from this device, but i did not expect the first text i read on it to be telling my device has a fan error that should be reported to oculus. I have a replacement being shipped. hopefully things will go better with that one.
review_title: fan error immediately after turning on for the first time and every time since then.

one_reviews_text: I love mine so much I got my friend one.
Love the oculus 2. It is smaller than the oculus 1, which allows better movement of your head. My child plays it the most, I bought it for her, and it is perfect for her head size.

Got everything figured out and started it up and everything was working flawlessly until day 2 when it refuses to stay connected, guardian constantly needing to be set over and over. maybe its just me and i'm missing something but setting it up is a nightmare and rather just sit at a computer and play my games instead of playing with it for 10mins and spending 50mins in menus trying to solve a problem. i will live with this mistake as it is my fault. Will still give decent review for being a very nice experience when it works.

Bought this thinking it would be just okay. My wife is really the one who wanted it and I just figured I would mess around with it a little. I'm now ready to buy a second one so we don't have to share and can play games with each other. The online videos do not do it justice.
review_title: More fun than I could have imagined.

one_reviews_text: I bought one because everyone seems to have one so I thought it would be decent. I don't know if I just got a bad one but I spent an entire week trying to get the environment to just load properly. The part I wasn't looking at would be black until I look at it and it would just load wierd and always be out of focus. The whole experience was horrible so I'll just stick with my regular PC.

If you are looking for a cheaper jump into VR the quest is a perfect option. Especially if you use a pc link. But even without that the headset works wonderfully. But be warned, the strap is uncomfortable and the face cushion isn’t the most pleasant. I highly recommend upgrading both just to make wearability better. Also be aware with how the controllers are shaped, you will bonk yourself or other things sometimes. The rings placement just makes that happen.
I'm loving my oculus and so is my family. Only wish there were more games, exercises, meditation, e.t.c that you Don't have to purchase. Where are the free ones?
review_title: Most adult fun in a long time

one_reviews_text: I couldn't use it for more than half hour due to motion sickness. Also it was very blurry to see and very uncomfortable. Would I recommend? Not really.
review_title: Very uncomfortable and had motion sickness

one_reviews_text: So glad I purchase this!!! My boys and I have been enjoying it. Very easy to use and put together. You can use it even with someone watching tv next to you plying a game. Great
Kids love this!!! I was worried about how expensive it is, but it’s been worth it. The whole family has been able to use it, all ages and sizes, nice for everyone to enjoy.

Esperaba un poco más, son entretenidas y definitivamente recomiendo conseguir algún accesorio que cambien las correas que traen ya que cansan mucho y es incómodo. No es como se ve en video donde se ve todo bien definido y pantalla completa. Realmente ves a través de un círculo prácticamente porque se alcanza a ver las partes negras alrededor. No la compren sin el accesorio para cambiar la correa, cansan bastante. Pero si son entretenidas aún con sus falencias
Was wanting something to get a bit more activity in my day. At 50+ years old it is the jetsons entertainment and helps add a bit of exercise and entertainment to long days at home.
Note that the headset puts a lot of pressure on your face with the head strap. It should be more comfortable and the weight should be distributed evenly.

Great product for the price compared to other options.Strap is very basic - consider upgrading to another strap, i.e. HTC Vive is very comfortable in comparison.Headset is fast and controllers very responsive.All software seem to work well.I use the headset to play HalfLife Alyx and amazing experience.Air link is great as it enables full wireless VR capability.Do note a Facebook account is required.

It's great, I wish I could've given it 4 1/2 stars. It responds excellently, the resolution is spectacular and the games are fun. My only complaint is the controllers are kinda cheap, after about a month the right joystick keeps sticking and the tracking is laggy. I can excuse that though considering it was made cheap so most people could afford it.
It does not have focus for people who ware glasses, original mask to face was itchy and uncomfortable when waring for more then half an hour. The joysticks really can take awhile to get used to.
My husband and son love it.  I'm always on edge hoping nobody runs into a wall, hots a tv, face plants somewhere 😂.  Boxing is good for working out for them.  Definitely a big hit.

Man I was a Little nervous too purchase this because I just was not sure. Well needless to say this product met all my expectations and The picture quality is amazing. Such a great investment so worth it.
My grandson was in Heaven with his Christmas present!  He was able to get help from other players and away he went!  He can only play 1 hour on school nights and a couple of hours on weekends
I ordered what the Daughter said for grandson. But did some research and found that the one with bigger memory was what my GS actually wanted. So retuned.Fast shipping
review_title: Got the wrong one, sent back.

one_reviews_text: I love this, it's really cool how it all works. The only things not great, is the price of the games after you've bought the device but that's expected. And then it is just a lil buggy too but still pretty sick. Definitely worth it

It has very limited content,  specially for girls.  Plus, there is nothing good to try for free, you most pay for EVERY single thing you want to play. There is some free content, but it is boring or way too basic. I think this technology is not yet where we expect it to be.

This VR is worth the money. It's solidly constructed. There is a wide range of games to choose from. A lot of them are free and they go on sale frequently.  Plus, a new game is incentive for the kids to get some chores done. Everyone in our home loves it from the adults to the kids. I'm glad I didn't go with any other vr.

For VR headset to be this good and only $400 (256gb version) is fantastic. It is a stand alone VR solution that can also be used plugged into the computer for steam vr games. that makes it simple to take wherever you want without having to take a pc with you. the free vr experiences are awesome as well. youtube vr is a good one. the games are super fun. battery life is pretty decent. I can play continuous for almost 2 hours on a single charge.
review_title: Great option for an entry line VR headset.

one_reviews_text: Fantastic VR headset.  Moving from an Oculus Rift, this headset is lighter and much better res without the tracking sensors all over the room.

Got this for my daughter for Christmas. She absolutely loves it. The only thing she has complained about is the head strap hurts her forhead if she uses it for too long. She is 11 years old and she needs it tight to fit well but then it causes headaches. Other than that, she likes it a lot.

I was skeptical at first, but I'm pretty impressed.  There is a blurry spot at first, but in the thick of whatever I'm doing I don't notice it. The pick up of what I do to the game is perfect.  Just wow.

This is a great product but their is some things to know 1. The battery is under moast stress below 20% and at 100% letting the battery go their messes with the battery life 2. The oculus headstrap is bad so I'd suggest getting a add of to it and it doesn't have to be sold from oculus 3. Make sure to put your real name and age because if you like on that theirs a chance that you can get locked out of it

This is absolutely amazing, so fun and easy to use, got this for my 10 year old but I keep asking to use it.  ok gotta get one for myself.

It’s cool for sure! But not really comfortable and if I spend $300 on something it should be comfortable! I’m sending bk probably. Can’t use long as it causes headaches and too heavy. Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son. He loves it! Games are reasonably priced as well. However, I give it 4 🌟 because the battery life is very minimal and the head piece wrapped in fabric gets filthy.

Product is wonderful, just need to deliver it to the RIGHT ADDRESS. Thank goodness for good, honest neighbors. (it's $300 for crying out loud) We were home the whole time. Don't know why they did what they did. *smh
I would totally buy ot agin if it got broke or had to do over.  A chromecast is awesome to allow others to see what is going on.  Youtube had some excellent tutorials.

one_reviews_text: The only bad thing is my first Oculus had issues with recognizing my right controller. I had to request a replacement. The new one works fine!

Great product, works. Setting up sucks especially with wifi you have to login with. And sideloading updates isn't working like all the videos tell you to. So I can't update it either way. So if you live in barracks and have limited wifi, then this isn't for you. It'll just give you a headache and a reason to drink that night.

It came in great condition it is a really fun kinda trippy but that's not a bad thing I have a had it for a month and have been playing about once a week the condition hasn't changed at least what I can tell I never really liked video games but it is like 100000 times more fun on the Oculus and even if you still don't like video games you can watch TV on the Oculus and it is supper cool I really recommend the Oculus Question 2 to any one looking in to VR
review_title: I have never really liked video games but video games on the Oculus 2 is different

one_reviews_text: It is a fun VR experience that you can share with friends or take with you when You travel.I’ve found great games and it is a great value!

I bought this ovules quest 2 and I am just loving it there is so many games to play and you don’t even need a PC. I am addicted to it I really recommend you getting this for your Birthday/Christmas. Plus other VR headsets are like $1,000 but it’s only for the price of $400. This is probably the best Christmas gift I’ve gotten.
Very good VR device. Comfortable and not too expensive. Good variety of applications.  You need to make sure you've got enough room, don't forget arm length.

Este producto es lejos la mejor compra que he realizado, soñaba solo con tenerlo como amante de la tecnología pero nunca pensé que seria una experiencia única, la caja llego realmente bien con todos sus implementos en perfecto estado, me pareció un precio hasta barato para el producto ya que en retail del país donde resido (chile) el producto esta literal al doble de precio aun sumando el costo de aduanas. Si tienen la oportunidad de adquirir este producto lo recomiendo enormemente.

Great product - but delivery was a nightmare.  I ordered from Bulgaria and prepaid the import charge- However, I was then charged another 12 Euros import costs to release it from the Bulgarian import dept. It took 3 days to arrive from America, then took another 2 weeks to arrive at my house.  Granted the customer service was excellent - I even felt sorry for them.  The Bulgarian DHL service is inept.  However, the Oculus is AMAZING and I love it
review_title: Great product - but delivery was a nightmare.

one_reviews_text: Love it! I am not a gamer and did not know what to expect. It is so easy and fun to use. I use it mostly for exercise. LOTS of free games and a lot more game to purchase. The head strap that comes with it is not very comfortable at all. There are a bunch of different ones available to purchase separate. However, I have not found one to my liking yet. Buy it you will love it :)
Yes it's a Facebook / Meta device in you face sucking up your data with said. It does OK however there are better VR solutions but I like it so far
Tried out product at relative's home and knew I had to own my own Oculus. Easy set up, ease of use. Love Beat Saber; great daily workout for this old lady. 🤓
I like the product as a whole, it is really well done but I don't like that it arrived with a nick in the controller. It is a minor issue but still disappointed nonetheless.
Bought for my son in law for his birthday. He was over the top excited. He had used a friends device so we decided to purchase for him. It is do much fun and challenging. Great item

Not ready for commercial virtual escape room prime time.  Locked up several times on time had to constantly formatted and get support on the line.  Finally decide to return and now its been 20 days and no refund.
I don't want an account on your website.
review_title: Requires a Facebook account. No thanks.. instant return.

one_reviews_text: Was told by recipient this was the best gift he's ever gotten. Easy to use. If you're a gamer get the larger memory version. I do get motion sickness so take breaks as needed cause it'll sneak up on you

My son was undecided if he wanted to spend his own money on this, but he’s glad he did. He has so much fun playing with it and barley plays his Xbox anymore. It’s portable and he can take it to a friend’s house to play with. He can also play with all his other friends that have an Oculus.
This is insane fun. Love it. Best gift ever

I think the experience is better than I would have expected. I wish the battery life was longer though. Also, it feels ahead of it’s time because there’s just not that much to do yet. A lot of pricey apps when you consider what they are actually doing too. Still very cool if you have the money to burn.
I had no clue till I put this on, it's amazing virtual reality experience, who wants to got imax anymore , it's amazing experience

It very much reminds me of the Nintendo Wii in regards to the controls with the added feature of the vr headset making it even more fun to play. I would probably recommend going for the version with more memory but otherwise my son and I are very much enjoying the Oculus.
Bought this for Resident Evil 4 and walking dead, I can see it helping some to have actual instructions with them but it’s easy enough. It’s game changing epic.  Love it.

The product we received had obviously been returned and they just sent it back out to us. It was pretty mind blowing that they would do that. It just shows how little respect they have for their customers. Yuck.

My first venture into VR! It is amazing!! Great graphics and best gaming controllers I have ever used! I can’t wait for more VR experiences to become available! It arrived as specified in a prompt manner!
Got this for my grandson for xmas he plays it most every day he said he gets a little motion sickness from it but he gets sick in the car too so
It started good then hour or so later go massive head ache and felt like throwing up And Felt dizzy so sent it back everything about this product was a lie would not recommend using period
Easy to use, set up and enjoy. It is a fantasy world and it keeps you moving so this is better than a regular gaming unit. So many more calories are burned.

Soy de Chile, funciona perfecto, no hay problema con la corriente, económico en comparación al precio que lo venden acá. La batería dura poco rato recomiendo comprar una adicional, la correa molesta un poco sobretodo si se va a hacer ejercicio o juegos que requieran movimientos. Compré juegos también, hay unos muy buenos y se ven muy reales como el eleven ping pong, bowling, moss.
Head strap is a nightmare, and it really doesn't like working while sitting in bed to watch netflix, but otherwise you can't beat this thing at the price. Great introduction to VR.
Fun and Versatile VR. Got it to also play Steam VR games which is a big plus. Replacing the head strap makes it more enjoyable to use.
Great VR headset. Lightweight, comfortable, and easy to use. I cast it to the tv when using it, so everyone can see what you see. Great feature
My teenagers loved their Christmas gift, even my husband and myself enjoy the Oculus. It’s really awesome and easy to take wherever you want.
I purchased this for my teenage son. It was a great gift. He loves it and plays with his friends often. Such a neat concept. Definitely worth the price
We had to go buy a chromecast to play this after several hours of trying to get it to broadcast to the t.v. So far, the whole family has been enjoying it.

Really enjoy this game console. Pretty user friendly, of course my kids are naturals. Worth every penny. I wish the games would have demos or not be so much. Shelling out $15-20 too "see if they like it" is just too much. Otherwise, very cool.
Arrived perfectly.  Everything was in the box like it should have been.  My son loves it and has had a blast with it.  Im not a paid review writer or work for Amazon and I'm def not a robot writer.
Fantastic seller. Received the very next day. Product is updating.  But i love it. Its my birthday to me and what a device it is. Finally get to smash some zombies 🥰
This was the best gift for the family. Everyone loves it. Easy to set up too. There are games for the whole family and it is hilarious watching others play.
Really great purchase. Use it for my mobile VR home design.As for additional features, just do a little research and this thing is just as capable as anything. Your pc or laptop is the limit.
really cool item its amazing how you feel transported to another reality by just hitting the power button speaker well place to bring you right into the action
Requires Facebook account.
Won’t work. Stuck in remove battery pull tab screen from set up.  Support stinks. Will be sending this back to Amazon for a full refund. Thanks for nothing Meta.
review_title: Broken. Won’t pair/connect. Ruined Xmas Eve. Thanks, Meta.

one_reviews_text: My husband is on this thing more than he’s not! He loves it so much and my toddler even likes using it with the roller coaster game!
This is the best VR headset you can buy for this price that is a standalone product. the graphics are stunning, and the experience is incredible. Definitely recommend.
The graphics are pretty good. Sometimes the games freak me out because you kinda forget your playing a game! You won’t be disappointed with this system.

This vr is awesome! The graphics on it is incredible! I feel like I’m in the game, they have a wide range of games and apps, for $300 this Vr is a total steal! I would recommend this to everyone above the age of 13 of course. Charges within a hour and leaves you with 4 hours of game time. It doesn’t take strong Wi-Fi to be able to play it either! The controllers are very comfortable in hand and the Vr is even better!

So I got this for my son. He was absolutely thrilled. I bought some visa  gift card for him to order some games, but you can't use them. I'm not one with put my card into different financial apps. I used the pay pal to purchase games that way if there is an issue I have some coverage and security.
everyone i know has a quest 2 and none of them have ever gotten this message.. i got it the first time i turned it on and it showes up no matter what i do.
This device really worth every cent! 128gb model is optimal for anything. It is light and image is super clear. Also very realistic.
review_title: Now that is next level of technology!

one_reviews_text: I wish I could enjoy this but because if motion sickness I got very sick.  This can cause nausea if your sensitive to motion.

I’ve had this for about a week now and I am just amazed. I played first person shooter games, poker games, and even visited Ann Frank’s house. This is my first experience with VR and so far I am just amazed

Es muy buen producto especialmente si tienen un pc bueno, ya que, los juegos son muy costos directamente desde las Oculus, y la mitad o incluso 3 veces mas barato exactamente el mismo juego pero en steam, cabe aclar que lo mejor para jugar en las Oculus juegos del pc es un router con 2 bandas (2,4 y 5 g) por último decir que es obligatorio comprar un strap, no importa si es el oculus o el de bobovr o el chino.
review_title: De las mejores consolas que he probado

one_reviews_text: Great piece of tech.It is really fun and highly entertaining. Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to take gaming and entertainment to next level. You feel fully immersed and disconnected from reality.

The headset is great and really fun but the product seems to have come used and damaged. I brought a new headset and expected something that is not damaged and used. The controller had a black scratch and headset looked used with fingerprints.

I was hesitating on buying a VR, its more of a want than need, but decided to give it a try, the free apps are fun but get boring over time, i would recommend buying a full gane and take it from there, your also going to get a few headaches at first,  but stop over time
This is a lot of fun for both kids and adults. The video quality could be better, but it doesn’t really take away from the experience. There are plenty of options available.

I cannot get an Oculus account and the password reset won't work. It will not send the reset email. Dead in the water. Apparently hundreds of people are having the problem. Meta is clearly not ready to be a product company.
review_title: Can't use this due to Facebook and Oculus accounts

one_reviews_text: As someone who has never tried virtual reality, the quest has opened my eyes to some really fun times. I recommend getting a link cable if you plan on doing PCVR, you’ll need some extremely low latency if you don’t have one. One issue I have is the pressure the standard strap puts on my head. I have to adjust the strap periodically when I play on it because it hurts after a good bit. Otherwise, amazing device!
My husband loves to visit the different countries on our oculus. I love playing the games. Everything is like you are right there.

Genial, los juegos, la inmersión, muy chevere las gafas, cómo punto negativo es que el accesorio que trae para alejar los lentes del visor con las gafas poco o nada sirve, aún así genera un poco de fricción y rayones leves en el lente y también que oculus se olvida un poco de LATAM, en Colombia no se puede usar el sistema de referidos, sería muy bueno que puedan implementar el cambio de moneda en la tienda de oculus, aún así le pongo 5 estrellas
Its fun but dont like that I have to have a Facebook account linked. It was for my kids.... I don't want them to have a Facebook account.
review_title: Don't like that you MUST have a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: I'm Like Super Happy and Joyed that I decided to get this Oculus Quest 2 (256gb) and Love the Harley Quinn Skin/Wrap I got to Put On It,  Definitely Worth It and I Recommend other people to get it as well.
This system was perfect for my family. We now have quality family gaming time as there is something for everyone of all ages up to 71 years.
Great VR headset, but short battery but you'll probably be tired by then. Runs well but gets sweaty. There's multiple bands for around the lens area for it to sit on your face comfortably.

Product performed as advertised.Unfortunately even with glasses extender, the product didn’t fit my larger head that great.You will need to buy more accessories to actually make it fit right.I wear glasses. I would have to buy a lens accessory with my prescription to use properly.I have long hair and felt like this product would just slide of my head. Imagine breaking a $300 item because it just slips off
review_title: Interesting technology, not a one size fits all

one_reviews_text: This is the most amazing VR yet! Games for everyone. Supernatural is my favorite. Some of the games are rather expensive but worth every penny
No way I could ever guess I’d be having so much fun with my family and friends in V.R world…you must..you have to try this two hand vr..
review_title: The best gift you can give

one_reviews_text: I'm seriously going to have to find a bigger location to play because I'm smashing my room to pieces on accident! It gets so intense at times. Try the game Contractors! 5 stars!
I bought this for my son.  He loves it.  The display is very clear and the reality is amazing.  He loves playing beat saber.
So fun.
Like: fun, several different gamesDislike: need a FB account, hard to position correctly for nearsighted wearers to see clearly

To be honest, I was hyped all year about the Quest 2 and all the promises and features of the Metaverse, it seems something up my alley.When I got it, something felt really off. The Quest 2 squeezed my glasses, but the old ones fit? It was odd, and I hope the Metaverse team addresses this in future installments, this was a let down. This small issue is for spec wearing people like me isn't spoken much around the VR community, and getting into VR is super expensive.
this is the vr experience like no other, i did not want to give up my turn, the images are so real and the best sensory perception to movement ever
My kids absolutly love it. I tried it and the graphics are fantastic. The only thing I think should change is they don't supply the cord to attach it to a PC
I purchased this for my daughter, but I am loving it just as much as she does. I suspect that the extra amount that I paid for storage will come in handy.
Great product, it is very entertaining. so far it's everything it says it is. It was hard to buy a game because of not having there own prepaid card. It still is amazing experience.
Didn't expect it to be so fun! The clarity is beyond imagination, it's worth buying this! People who like to study will love it. It is really rare to get the approval of the family.
review_title: Didn't expect it to be so fun!

one_reviews_text: Worked for a month no problems besides the painful set up and link to PC. For a basic model VR set I was happy considering the price, the performance wasn't the best but hey I was happy with it. Now however a audio bug that has plagued the oculus series for 5 years has prevented me from playing at all. After many hours searching online and applying "solutions" still nothing. Save the money I wish I did

The inside of the be lens was torn. It looked burnt and scratched. Clearly used, no plastic wrap or anything to show it's new. There was literally pubes coming out the foam part of the headphones. Damn right shameful. Just go to GameStop and get it.
review_title: BROKEN AND USED, PAID FOR BRAND NEW.

one_reviews_text: Got this for my boyfriend for Valentine’s Day and he loved it! Honestly good for exercise & fun games on there. Does get tiring & eyes hurt after a few hours, but honestly super worth cuz VR is cool
I had a quest 2 that i got as a gift and took apart and accedently broke than i got this one and it isnt as fast
review_title: Mine is new but isnt as fast as the last one i had and im not sure why

one_reviews_text: After about a month it started getting in a boot loop were it just turns on, the screen stays black and then it turns off. I've factory reset it, turned it off for hours, let it battery die and it still has this problem. Tech support isn't helpful. Will be sending back for a refund or will probably just get rid of it. Should have just saved up for a real VR headset

Bought 2 of these for Christmas one for me and one for my son.so far loving it..Always wanted to play drums when I was a kid.bought Drum Smash and awesome.like playing the real thing...The only thing I dont like is most of the games u pay for which is fine but as hate the fact u have to subscribe to some of them....make it like the rest and pay to keep.plus I wish u didn't have to buy the same game twice if u want to play co-op...other that that highly recommend
this is an enjoyable product, however it was not easy to learn how to use.it does have a cool safety feature. but it takes time to get used to using.
I purchased this for my 23 year old son for Christmas. He has friends over to his apartment all the time and they LOVE it!! Great product!!
it is over two weeks now to get my money back from amazon, I do not recommend this is on amazon, could not use it the space is too short for people with glass.
very good for the first ever virtual reality experience.of the minuses in virtual table tennis, controllers disappear from tracking during complex side impacts
I play beat Saber everyday for my exercise and it was really fun and helpful at the same time, the vr games are the future. The Facebook ouclus is the best choice for virtual reality experiences

one_reviews_text: this is something my 50 year old self wasn't sure would like, but I love it! The games are so imersive and fun.
My husband bought this for Christmas. I would have never thought I’d enjoy VR so much. It’s a ton of fun and if you’re looking to break up the winter doldrums with some activity, this is great!
Can't say enough about it this thing is addictive. Game price points are awesome too easy to sit and buy a bunch at once. Each game is better than the last. I literally  have to cut my self off.

El producto llegó unos días antes de lo anunciado en perfecto estado, es bastante cómodo y fácil de usar. En un principio costo saber como configurarlo pero por surte hay varios tutoriales, guías y videos sobre esto. El único defecto fue que el cargador no se usa demasiado aquí en Chile, por lo que tuve que comprar un adaptador al otro día. También esta el problema de Facebook, el cual debes tener obligatoriamente una cuenta para poder usarlo.

Maybe it's just mine but battery life is horrible. After full charge it lasts about 30 minutes. I would hate to purchase a game to play with friends and the battery die in middle of it. Battery wouldn't even be able to last thru a whole movie.

Pros: decent optics, ability to play standalone, wired to PC, or connected to PC over wi-fi. Lots of cool exclusives in store.Cons: crappy default strap - you should really get Bobovr. Not OLED, so bad black levels. Guardian sometimes glitches out. Tech support is nightmare - you can read horror stories about it in Reddit. Facebook account required along with all its spyware and telemetry collection.All in all best headset right now for the price, but not without its flaws.

Having to connect to facebook & facebook possibly having access to my credit card information. Not signing my life away to facebook. Lol Plus I wear glasses & have bad astigmatism, I couldn’t adjust it properly to see everything clearly & made it impossible for me to enjoy it.
review_title: Be mindful if you have astigmatism

one_reviews_text: Great product and I’ve enjoyed it this far, but I would wait until the next model comes out.The VR technology and games available to date don’t really justify having this unless you have friends to play with.  The best game available (without owning a Gaming PC) I’ve played so far has been Beat Saber.
Fun batteries last a little longer than expected and the expensive side for what you get because you still have to buy all the games
the system is great but since i am 76 years old and not a gamer, i need better tutorials. it can get frustrating not knowing how to navigate in the program.

The Oculus Quest 2 is worth investing in. There are so many different games and apps to choose from, and as an adult I love the Supernatural app! It’s one of the best work outs I’ve had in a long time! Soo worth it!
Very good, I use a software that activates itself, although a little trouble, but after getting it really fun. You can stream and play steam vr games on your computer.
Love my Quest 2. Waited to purchase and got twice the memory for the same price. Combined with a link cable and my gaming PC, I can enjoy many VR games at a lower price.

This has been one of my best purchases of the year. All the games I could get on it are amazing it's a whole new experience it even renewed a love for some old games I played with a new way to play it, I even bought new and extra accessories to improve on it and personalize it this was worth my money

A very quality headset :) though there are a few complaint. General play is very good. :) haha, but if your hand is big like mine then controler feels teeny weeny. AND THE FACE GASKET THING TURNS INTO RAW TARMAC AFTER A WHILE, so like buy a vr cover vr face gasket cover for quest 2 or something idk lol :)

one_reviews_text: Was exactly as described. Been playing all day every day since we got it and no issues yet! Love it more than psvr
It's a great VR headset, Easy to use, and a lot of fun kids love it I will be buying two more so all 3 Grandkids will have one of their own.
Got this for my son since he is a gamer he usually sits playing on Xbox one this he will get up and move around and has already lost weight.
This is awesome I have not been to sleep since I got this
I am blown away at the experience of VR. Can’t believe I waited this long to try it. It’s definitely the future of gaming.
Bought for my son.  He loves it, so many games and friends to play with, great visual effects.  Had this since December, 2 months no issues. Great purchase!
A better head strap should be included with this. Also interchangeable sweat bands were also improve this product

one_reviews_text: I’m really bummed me and my son both pitched in to get this because of price . Only one of us can use it on computer. Other users can’t neither can you set it up to work on two computers. We bought it to use steam games on computer now one of us is out of luck or we buy anither

one_reviews_text: I’ve been sitting on getting one of this for a few years and I’m glad I made the decision to get one. Super easy to use and a lot of fun solo or with friends. Only complaint would be pricing for content on the device but the device itself seems priced well.

Si quieres entrar en el mundo de la realidad virtual, y quieres empezar con algo bueno bonito y barato, las Oculus quest 2 son la mejor compra que puedes hacer, es algo realmente único y que si no has probado deberías probarlo al menos una vez.
review_title: Lo lentes de realidad más baratos y buenos que hay

one_reviews_text: I use this daily to workout….fantastic. Works my abs as well as legs. Often follow up with some time on treadmill. Supernatural is a great app!

You will love this!! Bought my wife one for Christmas. Come to find out our brother-in-law also got one for us. So we have two. It is great. We use wander and travel from different places together. The bowling game app love it! It’s a good work out. Go for it you will not be disappointed.
Got this for my husband who is techy and needs to have all the newest gadgets . He loves it . He’s not a gamer so he has used it more for the movies and virtual desktop .Perfect gift !

one_reviews_text: Gear for the price when compared to other vr sets. The only downside is that Facebook account is required and there is a lack of parental controls so if a kid is using it you have to go into the apps to turn off voice chat or violence settings or whatever else.
got this as a christmas gift for my son...which i was allowed to try...and it is sooo much fun....as he would say you really get into it

Let me start off by saying I started my first gaming experience with the Nintendo..and never in all the years I thought I would feel like a kid again This VR takes me above and beyond what I could ever imagine..Not only that I let my husband try it out and let's just say I'm ordering another one..Get this you want regret. Just make sure you have plenty of space!!!
Feels comfortable and no hard setups. Everything runs nice too

one_reviews_text: Tutorial great. You can hear well and fun to do. Fun to watch on phone while someone plays. Need a little room to play. Awesome system!
review_title: Oh please! Crazy fun and awesome!

one_reviews_text: I have so far loved my VR headset. I like how you do not need to have a computer or have it hooked up to anything. It is super easy to cast it to a TV for friends or family to watch.
It was brand new, easy to set up! I tried it for the 1st time ever and it is so so so cool! my kids are very very happy and I cant complain. I think I want one for me. I bought 2 of them.

This is my first vr headset, and it’s beautiful, the strap is a little weird, but other than that the headset is great, the one thing I really don’t like about oculus is that games cost  💲  30.00, I kid you not, so expensive, other than that problem of get three games and paying 100 dollars. Everything else I love, you should today get this.

This thing is pretty great for being a stand alone device (as much as I dislike Facebook or meta whatever its called) its really fun to play I did need to get a new headstrap almost immediately only because swapping it from an adult to a child was kindof a pain but otherwise it's a great product and lots of fun
NO SPEED BUMPS. Finally, I can leave this insane real world, and enter an insane virtual world. Lots to learn but will be worth it. DEAL with this seller.

one_reviews_text: This headset is worth the money. Awesome to be able to have the 3D experience & play with others on theirs as well!

It is great emerging technology. but Hard put that around your head and watch - though I liked the tech - it can improve a lot in terms usability. May be one day Simple eye glass kind of device will do the same !

one_reviews_text: Bought this a few month ago, it’s really fun at first. But after a while I started having crashes while playing games on/offline, my controllers had issues being tracked, the headset now loses track of where I am sometimes and I’ll punch a wall or something. The oculus quest 2 is the most expensive and annoying brick I own. There’ll be another used one up for sale here soon.

The facebook account/state id requirement makes this device useless, its currently still in its unopened box where it will stay until i don't have to give up my anonymity or until someone jailbreaks it.
review_title: Can't  use it due to the facebook intrusion account/state id requirement.

one_reviews_text: WE love it, got for my husband for Christmas. I would recommend getting the extra battery. The built in one last bout hour then 2 to 3 hours charging time. we bought the extra battery lasts 8 hours we have not run out of battery life playing now. it is easy to use and lots of fun .

The Oculus 2 is phenomenal - so much fun, very engrossing. However, the left speaker/headphone on my headset has been crackling since the 2nd week of owning it. I have submitted help tickets and reports of issues, and have not yet gotten a response (issues started 4 weeks ago).
review_title: Lots of fun, customer service is lacking

one_reviews_text: Our new Oculus Meta Quest 2 is amazing! It shipped fast and works perfectly. It's hard to put down! I did a lot of research on the best and most affordable VR and am not disappointed at all.
Un VR es de esas cosas que tienes que probar por lo menos una vez en la vida ... Mealegro de haberlo comprado ya que es una experiencia diferente ... Me encantó este VR hasta ahora funciona muy bien

As expected for a VR headset.  Lots of fun. Games can be costly - at least those worth playing. Was surprised to learn, after purchase, that the headset is only recommended for those age 13 and up - due to neurological development. You may want to research if purchasing for a child.
It's a decent headset. A little too front heavy so you might want to consider getting a better headstrap. At the time of this purchase it still requires a Facebook account, which sucks.

one_reviews_text: I love this VR Headset. I wish the games were not so expensive, but they are worth the money. I am hooked!

one_reviews_text: I knew it would be interesting, but little did I know how it takes you away to another world I can meditate travel and exercise. It is so much fun.

Loved my oculus. Loved playing with friends and family.  Have a bit of money in it. After purchasing the headset and all the games.  Now. After a little over a month all my game have disappeared. Trying to get this problem fixed has been a nightmare.

one_reviews_text: Like the device,  don't like grabbing a Hot device especially of my face. Battery life sucks and needs to be recharge after 1/2 hour

Set up easy.  Finding some content is takes some knowledge.  Haven't started any games yet,  but it's alot of fun.
review_title: Most fun in a long time.

one_reviews_text: I enjoy the table tennis, Saber, and bowling programs. I've watched a few movies and the quality is very good. I wish I could figure out a way to upload my iTunes music to use with some of the games, like bowling, I'll keep trying. I think it's well worth the cost even with having to pay high shipping costs to Thailand, but I wanted to make sure I wasn't getting a counterfeit unit so I was willing to pay the extra cost. I just wish I wouldn't have waited so long to buy.

Wireless. Inside out tracking. Great clarity. Tons of third party accessories to augment your playing experience. Lots of great games and library is steadily climbing. Great purchase for those who want a different experience in gaming.

Óculos y el metaverso aún están en desarrollo y tener la oportunidad de comenzar a usarlo es excelente. Las aplicaciones y los lentes siguen avanzando y estoy seguro que pronto llegarán a ser fantásticos.La batería interna tiende a durar poco tiempo y esto limita las opciones para jugar por largos periodos.
Bought this for Christmas 2021 and my grands love it. I'm only sad they can't play all together.

Bought for my kids so they like it. Graphics suck, it's like the Nintendo wii but the VR experience is cool.  They seem to enjoy it but already can tell the "new" effect is wearing off and they play with their switch more. It's about what I expected but for the price maybe wait if this isn't a must have.

Yeah I have to admit this is the best investment of gaming technology I have ever tried, my first time trying a Meta Quest 2 VR headset, it's got quite the features and I haven't tried them all yet considering they are still releasing new updates that adds to the fun and experience.Totally worth it.
Bought as a Christmas gift for my son. The whole family loves it. Only downside is it's Facebook family. Other than that cool gift.
The only bad part is the battery dies a little fast for me also the head strap is a little irritating sometimes

I love the price, controller tracking, and features. The games are good and the screens are great and as someone once put it, “The Quest 2 is the Nintendo switch of VR” it can do about anything, just don’t expect photorealistic graphics. My only dislike is that it is made by Facebook, but at least since it is so you can buy it for less than the hardware is worth! For my first VR headset, I’d say it’s a great introduction.
The games I had to buy to play were overly expensiveThe ones that were free were demos or social games
review_title: I spent a lot of money on the oculus and still had to buy the games

one_reviews_text: Perfect entry into VR. Affordable and tons of fun. I ordered to play in my freetime in the barracks, no set up or tear down required since it's stand alone. So I can whip it out and play even if I only have 10 minutes and then lock it up without any hastle. Should have gotten inti VR sooner

SO, the 1st clue was the instruction book inside...for a flood light from Home Depot... The once I powered it up, it was already signed into a Facebook account. I just googled how to do a manual factory reset, so I'll update this review if the Quest 2 is defective... Batteries were in the controllers already, and all the actual Oculus paperwork was just tossed in the box. FFS.

I love the product. Very controlling of a company to force you to have Facebook in order to use.  I do not like that at all and think it is a joke.  Make it where you don’t need Facebook to play and this will be the best around.

Fairly nice headset. This is my 6th VR headset I have owned, and it's nice to be powerful and wireless. The included strap is low end, and I would suggest buying a better one. The built in down firing speakers are ok, but for a true vr experience I would suggest headphones. Out of all the headsets I've owned, this one checks a lot of the boxes for VR.
Best gift for two boys, have to schedule of playing. otherwise will damage their eyes. I like to use it to watch movies.
There is absolutely no parental controls on this device. As soon as you sign in to play kids are cussing and adults are speaking inappropriately to children.
I bought this for my son for Christmas and he loves it.  It works well and the battery has kept up well.

The whole family has been wanting a VR set for years. Finally got a good enough job, and was able to buy one for Christmas. Of course it was a hit, but then we put it on and we’re truly amazed at just how immersive and functional it really is. Amazing buy, already looking to buy another after 2 weeks.

My 9 year old son has every single game console you can think of, PlayStation 5, xbox, phone, computer, laptops, etc. yet, he still manages to be on this oculus 24/7x definitely his favorite. He plays his games and basically excercises at the same time since he is always moving.
My son is happy with this VR set. He likes the games that are included. Great birthday present

Well for 1 it’s very expensive, but overall this item is extravagant in many ways. You have so many options to do with it, you can play games chat with others and relax watching Netflix/YouTube. You can scroll through Facebook or instagram aswell. It fits all personality’s in my opinion and would be a great gift for kids or for the whole family.
This is the best tech I have bought in ages. Life-changing. I love the games, but the physical activity it has added to my day is priceless.

The Oculus has so much to do and going through all this social Distancing You can actually go to clubs, go to the movies with friends or Netflix and chill with people that also have the device it’s so dope! And endless fun! My sons 8 he loves it my a** is 48 and I love it 😂😂🤣🤣🤣

Shooters or any games where you're constantly moving your head around cause this headset to misalign or even fall off your head if trying to crouch down to pick something up.The Headstrap is far more comfortable than the standard strap and the battery is great for the price, but the amount of times I need to adjust the headstrap in a single session grows very tiresome.
review_title: Very Loose - Not recommended for rapid movement games.

one_reviews_text: Unfortunately while setting up my Quest 2 I got the “fan not working” error message which seems to be a fairly common problem with these.  I turned it off and restarted it and kept getting the same message every time, so back to Amazon it goes.  I’ll try another one and hope for the best, but I’m definitely concerned now.  My previous Rift and Rift S never had a single issue.
review_title: Fan didn’t work right out of the box

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my son and have been playing it more than him. Beat saber is the best. Good way to get you moving.

I am a VR content developer. During the work I tried a dozen models of VR headsets. At the beginning of 2022, this is the best VR headset in terms of quality and price. The only drawback of Oculus Quest 2 is the inconvenient fastening and adjustment of the straps. I recommend additionally buying the Elite Strap for Quest 2 or an analog.Delivery to Russia is a little more than 2 weeks (December-January). Thanks to Amazon.

one_reviews_text: This was a great gift to and the whole family can enjoy coming in good condition on time easy to setup best thing ever

Like it so much love you sweetheart thank you for your time sweetheart sweetheart love you love love you daddy

* Oculus had stopped selling the Quest 2 temporarily, because of an issue with the foam piece that touches your face, which had caused skin irritation for some users.  That part now has a silicon cover, which should prevent the facial irritation issues, and now the new Quest 2 has 128GB (or 256GB) storage, up from 64GB in the original Quest 2. *The Quest 2 seems to be the best deal in VR headsets at the moment.  The previous release of Quest 2 was $399 and only had 64GB, and even then it was probably the best deal at the time.Keep in mind, you still need a Facebook account to use this VR headset; but at this price, it is worth it to just make a Facebook account.  This VR headset can be used connected to your gaming PC, or just used stand alone.We now have a 64GB version and a 128GB version, and we never actually ran out of space on the 64GB.  The kids mostly play BeatSaber and Vader Immortal, while the adults favorite game so far is probably Trover Saves the Universe (not for younger kids) .If you are thinking about getting into VR, try the Quest2 out.  It is easy enough to learn, you don't need that much space, and you can be up and running right away.  Our kids like it much more than regular consoles, and at least you get a small amount of physical activity!
review_title: Best VR headset for the price right now

Oculus, a.k.a. Facebook, lies and manipulates consumers. Tons of the features they advertise will not be available to you if you buy one of their devices. Think you’re getting a 120 Hz display? You’re not, and if you think you should be based on their advertising and patch notes, they will hide behind their labeling of such important features as merely “experimental.”On top of that, they’ve demonstrated their intent to put ads in *paid* games. There was a backlash against the first attempt, so the developer of the game backed down. But, it’s just a matter of time - they’re simply waiting for peoples’ attentions to wane and tolerance to set in. It’s Facebook, so you know games are going to be absolutely clogged with ads as soon as they feel they can get away with it.Oh, also, the face covering could mess up your face. Mine caused me to break out in a rash. When I contacted them about this, they just said “nope, sorry, it’s not a problem,” only to be forced to admit that it *had been* a problem a few months later when they issued a recall. Shady.In short, save your money and buy from an honest, reputable company before buying into Facebook’s predatory ecosystem
Quest 1 decent this one better tho

The oculus quest 2 is easily the best VR system for the money due to its ease of use and wireless play abilities. It can also be used as a PC VR if one has a high end gaming PC. If this is the case storage also doesn’t matter due to the fact that the games are stored on the PC. It has a large variety of games that are playable without a PC. I highly recommend it.
review_title: A great VR for the cost

one_reviews_text: I purchased an Oculus and used it for 1 day before the controller broke.  Unable to get any replacement parts for 2 months now so I cannot use it any longer, they are not in stock and the support team is supposed to send one but has not.  The unit was fun while it lasted, but I am unhappy that it is no longer working after 1 day, if it was made a little better it would not have broke.  It did give me extreme motion sickness when playing games that allow you to move without actually walking.
review_title: No Replacement Parts for My Broken Oculus

one_reviews_text: This is a review of the Oculus Quest 2 — Advanced All-In-One Virtual Reality Headset — 128 GB.I have never used a virtual reality device before and was super eager to try it out. I have heard good things about the Oculus Quest 2 so I was really happy to get one. Happy to say it’s pretty amazing.First of all about me, I am older and although I’m fairly techie, I have never tried VR before. So as soon as I opened the box I was a little intimidated because frankly the instruction pamphlet is not all that great for a novice and the start-up foldout only gets you connected. Following the foldout was easy - now to go on and see what this puppy can do.I immediately went to the Internet and looked up various videos because at least for me, it wasn’t all that intuitive and I was having some trouble figuring out how to use the controls and access the apps and programs I wanted. Once I saw the videos, it was easy.So how do I like it? I have to say it’s pretty amazing. The headset feels okay/comfortable and you can adjust the  lens for clarity - not perfect but fine and doable. It’s easy to set up with one problem I had at the start - the tab to pull out of one of the hand controls ripped which was an issue and we had to struggle to get it out.  Without removing those tabs you cannot operate or connect the Oculus Quest 2. Again, be sure to check out settings and the various options and  check out some of the available fan videos.The only concern I have - and no stars off for this because it’s not the fault of the Oculus Quest 2 - is that it really gave me motion sickness after just 10 minutes and I felt dizzy. I have tried it out several times to no avail - I am prone to migraines and sadly, I won’t be able to use this. I have some issues even watching movies in 3D so this did not come as a great surprise to me. My husband had the same problems I did while using it, although he too was amazed by the graphics and clarity. I did give it to my son who is in 7th heaven so it all worked out great.Lastly - you have to have a Facebook account to use this which was an issue for me because I had closed out my FB account because I didn’t want it. So to use this, I opened another one under my husband’s name with full privacy mode and no other information than his name. That’s one way to get around this I guess but do know you need that FB account.
review_title: Incredible clarity; fun and also great for gamers. Just one concern about this for me.

one_reviews_text: I like the VR headset. It’s very fun. The problem is that you can only play for a short period of time. I charged it for about 2 hours and 50 minutes then it was on full charge. I played on it for about 1 hour, then it died. Otherwise the oculus is very fun to play with. I really like watching television and playing “VRChat” and “Blade & Sorcery” with my friends.

I purchased my oculus 2 from amazon in January 2021, ever since I got it I've had problems with the headset requiring multiple (10-15) hard resets to get it to work. When I turn it on, I get the oculus symbol and a buzz on the controllers but then just complete blackness. Oculus support has told me to restart the headset but this never prevents or solves the issue. Recently my Elite strap just cracked on its own. I've never dropped it and I always keep it in my hard case when not in use. Apparently, this was/is a known major problem but it is not being addressed on their website... but the headset that causes rashes is being recalled... Don't buy one of these until Oculus/Facebook figures out these issues. Also, this should be a verified purchase, but for some reason when I click to leave a review from my order page, I get a "This page is missing" message. Some shady shade going on here.
review_title: Headset needs multiple hard restarts, Elite strap cracked

one_reviews_text: I think that most everyone reading the reviews will already be aware that (for some ABSURD reason) a facebook account is now REQUIRED in order to use hardware. Although this is very unfortunate, especially considering that the founder of Oculus promised that we would never need a Facebook account in order to use the product, it is forgivable I guess.What is not forgivable is that if you have lost access to your old Facebook account (that you never use anymore) then this might brick your Oculus. Not having access to my old Facebook account, I thought, "Oh well, I'll just create a new Facebook account so that I can use my new Oculus." NOPE! Facebook instantly locked the new account I created and gave no options to fix the problem. I contacted Oculus customer service and they claimed that I had to contact Facebook directly and that the Oculus team could not help. (They said that Facebook will probably get back to me in 5-7 business days.)After trying to 4 different ways to contact Facebook to get my account unlocked, I was unable to contact anyone. When your account is locked, you simply see a screen that says "Help us confirm your identity" with a "continue" button that is grayed out so you cannot continue. I tried logging out of Facebook to contact them about this issue, but when you try to submit a support ticket, guess what, you need to log in in order to do so! Great! Facebook sticks you in an infinite loop of not being able to solve your problem. I tried submitting a general ticket two weeks ago, but never received a response or any indication that they even received my support request. Now I have a $300 paperweight sitting on my desk that I cannot use. I tried contacting Oculus support once again and their best suggestion was for me to return the Oculus back to the retailer at which I bought it. Great customer service! I think I will take their advice.I remember when Oculus was so cool and inspiring. I really, REALLY tried to give the new version a chance (despite hating Facebook and wanting to avoid it at all costs). But when you brick the $300 hardware I just bought and make ZERO attempts to remedy the issue through two different customer service brand teams, I am officially done. I will never spend another penny on a Facebook/Meta/Zuckerberg Meat Smokers product ever again. I can't wait for Apple to release their VR and put Oculus out of business.Beware friends!
review_title: BUYER BEWARE - FACEBOOK WILL BRICK YOUR HARDWARE

one_reviews_text: This is my very first virtual reality (vr) headset or even trying vr. I am blown away at how far we have come in technology. I must say that this device is bringing out the geek in me. However, there are a few things that needs to be addressed. First, as everyone has mentioned that if you want to use this with comfort at all you must buy a new strap immediately. The strap that comes with the headset is useless, it's uncomfortable, leaves you with impressions on the forehead, pressure on forehead, hard to adjust, snags your hair, and constantly slips down. I have no understanding as to why they decided to put such a disastrous strap on this device. It's like let's buy a Tesla without the ability for the car to drive itself.. that's one of the main reasons people buy a Tesla!! I had to go and buy a elite strap but no I did not buy the occulus elite strap because it also seems to have its shortcomings based on other reviews. Come on FB get with the program and stop trying to undercut quality. The other thing is the battery life of the headset.. 2 hours is just not enough. Sure I could use a power bank which I have the ability to do but again the point of the matter is you shouldn't have to. Back when I played regular gaming consoles I could play for a good 6 hours depending on the game...(this is just to prove a point) Increase the battery life on the device to at least 5 hours and then we're talking. I was in the middle of a game and it was just getting good and bam shut down, battery died. Who really wants to have a vr headset on their head, earplugs, and a power bank all attached to play a decent game time. Also the lighting in your room plays a factor in your ability to use the headset.. What!! I don't always like to keep my lights on during gaming and even moreover if I'm looking in the headset it shouldn't matter. So here is my opinion on that.. put a light on the headset so it will see in the dark for your barrier or provide some type of neon glow in the dark strips that you can place around your barrier and the headset will be able to pick up the uv without extra lighting because again it's wasteful to just have a light on so your device can see if you personally don't need the light. Also, add a game to download for free since we are given such a crap poor headstrap to begin with. Buy a 300 dollar headset just to have to buy 6+other accessories to make it comfortable and usable is not a good deal. I personally bought several additional items such as the elite headstrap (not from occulus), a link cable, a storage case, controller grips, rechargeable batteries, ear bud holders, noise canceling ear buds, anti-glare lenses, and a power bank strap. Honestly, the only thing I appreciated was the included glasses spacer insert. Therefore, I spent upwards of $600 to make your headset worth it to play including 2 cheap game downloads. This headset needs to be cheaper or add some higher quality accessories to it to even out the cost of what you will need to buy to make this worthwhile, comfortable, and enjoyable. For all this, I could have just bought another console and it wouldn't have been so cumbersome because really all I would have needed is the console and a game or 2...done no other accessories required.

I have tried various VR headsets, from those you have a mobile phone attached to a headset, another is the Oculus Go, which I have had the opportunity to do research for the mental health industry and also train those in the industry on the use and potential of the technology.But today I am testing the recently released 128GB version of the Oculus Quest 2, which was released by Oculus, a brand owned by Facebook.The virtual reality headset was released on October 13, 2020 as a 64GB model priced at $299 and a 128GB model for $399. On August 2021, the 128GB model dropped to $299 and the 256GB model was released for $399.The latest version featured a similar design to the original Quest while lighter in weight, updated specifications, a higher refresh rate and resolution and updated Oculus Touch controllers.So, I wanted to see for myself of how I felt about the technology and its improvements since 2019.The headset comes with a head strap, the two Oculus touch controllers each with a AA battery and a USB-C power adapter.After charging the unit, I went ahead and set my headset to my wireless connection and connected it to my Facebook account.It's important for everyone to know that it is mandatory that you MUST have a Facebook account for this device. The account is profile-based, and you can not set multiple profiles. So, those used to a console such as a PlayStation, XBOX or Nintendo Switch who are used to having multiple profiles, this is not possible. If you have several children, they can either play under your account profile or you will need to purchase each person their own headset.And then can setup your virtual environment from the currently eight offered and then get acquainted with software like First Step (which is an entertaining introduction to the how VR is with the unit and will impress those who never used VR before).You can setup your "Guardian" which you can see your space and making a ring around you, to let the unit know how much space you have for gaming, so you don't hit the wall or any thing that you have in your room.But then it's time to check out the apps available.  Most will want to try the free apps offered.  But then I was ready to purchase and test out games from numerous genres.The first game I decided to test out was one game that many people have put high in their "must-buys".So, after doing research, I wanted to test out the system completely in the following genres.   For rhythm and dance games: "Beat Saber", "Audio Trip" and "Synth Riders".  And two games from Japan, such as "Kizuna Ai - Touch the Beat!" and "Beat Arena".For shooter, I decided to try "Population One", "Pistol Whip", "Blaston" and "Larcenauts".  For sports, "Golf 5 eClub", "Top Golf with Pro Putt" and "ForeVR Bowling".  For fighting, "Thrill of the Fight!", "Ironlights: Ultimate Update" and "Holopoint".  For adventure, the three episodes of "Star Wars: Vader Immortal". For social, I tried VRchat, vTime and AltspaceVR.With the rhythm games, each of the three games provided an entertaining and fun workout.  Featuring cool music and most importantly, companies releasing inexpensive DLC music packs is a plus.    Each have a similarity in choosing skill factor and ability to select different music and go at your own pace.  Have only ten minutes to work out, then dance to three songs.But what I like is the workout aspect.  You are going to dance as you crouch or move to the left and right to avoid barriers.  And the better you get, you can set your skill higher for an even more intense workout.For the two Japanese games, "Kizuna Ai - Touch the Beat" is no doubt for the anime fans who want an easier pace and the fact that the makers put on live events (announced on Twitter on FB) to coincide with their device is a plus.  While "Beat Saber" allows you to play drums, guitar and bass and strumming or hitting the drum to the beat/symbol.  But I see the potential, for the Japanese market to really capitalize on the growth of VR as many established, may it be anime,RPG or sports games from Japan can be suitable for VR.The golfing on the Oculus Quest 2 is absolutely awesome.  I was surprised of how my swing was actually emulated quite well on the Oculus Quest 2, from driving to putting.  And the fact that you have golf enthusiasts playing and competing is a plus.  While I tested "Thrill of the Fight!" and the boxing mechanics were quite awesome.  Again, the workout involved in quick punches, jabs, etc. and the training in the gym, makes for another wonderful reason to get a VR headset.But games such as "Holopoint" is one of those games where you will need adequate space.  When purchasing a game on Oculus, you will receive a warning that the game is meant to be played in a larger setting.  Of course, a few people may guesstimate that they have adequate room and may have 5.5 feet when they game asks for 6.5 feet from all sides.  So, please do your due diligence in researching the game and how much space you need.For shooting, this is where I could only do ten minute sessions.  You have to shoot, move, crouch and prepare for intense combat that you are often in motion. If first-person shooters on a console doesn't give you motion sickness (as I play a lot), a shooter on VR is a different story.  You have to think quick, move quick and while "Pistol Whip" and "Blaston" was easier, I realized that shooting games that require a lot of movement will take awhile for me to get used to.  I tried to do an hour of "Population One" and I was nauseous right after and even the morning after.But the first game that made me love gaming on the Oculus Quest 2 was "Star Wars: Vader Immortal".  I love how the game was immersive and the first moment when you come into contact with the Empire, what a memorable VR experience.And last but not least, the chats available.  I think that as I partake in the various VR chats, many have adopted life for a few hours in the VR world to be exciting, especially during these times.  The people you meet all around the world and conversations are quite enjoyable most of the time (and yes, like real life, you can see drama especially during the discussion of politics and religion).  But for the most part, the VR social community opens up a new way of communicating much different from ZOOM and for people who have anxiety or feel awkward about their personal appearance, many have said they took up VR for that purpose.So, for the most part, the Oculus Quest 2 has managed to change the lives of many people.It's important to note that I also tested out the Oculus Air Link which allows you to hook up to the your laptop wirelessly, so you can play VR games that are installed on your PC/laptop.  And you'll need to purchase a USB-C link cable for the Oculus Quest 2 separately, if you want to transfer files and also for those who want to run code on their device.  One of the things I do is I record my gameplay and I transfer the video to my computer.And for me, it has changed my life because the inability for me to feel safe working out during this time, I like the fact that I can work out but be entertained.  For nearly two years, I have been working out indoors and to be frank, while things worked out fine for the first few months, I grew tired to the point I stopped working out because it became more routine.  But on VR, you can workout because its more immersive, you can compete solo or with others and be immersed.Unlike a console game, you are working out your muscles through full body movement.But VR also opens the possibilities for many, especially for those who may have a disability, there are games that you can partake in, as long as you can use the controllers or even hand movements and of course, see the visuals.  I also have read about athletes who have been injured and can no longer compete professionally, who have found a second life through VR, they can train and partake in competitions through games.But also for one's mental health for those who want to be more social but are not yet ready to be with a group of people, but are able to do it in the virtual world.  And I like that many mental health clinics have services to provide special programs for those that need help.Now, you probably can tell what I've wrote so far, that I'm quite positive about the headset.  But is it perfect?Now as for the hardware itself, if there is one thing I do miss, while you can add spacers to wear glasses, the Oculus Quest 2 has three settings by moving the Oculus lenses to obtain the narrowest at 58mm, the middle setting at 63mm and the widest at 68mm.  In the past, you can easily choose and  manually set a variety of ranges to suit one's vision, so if you wanted 60mm, you can't do that.I did replace the headset, you can purchase the Oculus Elite headstrap or other similar headstraps that are more padded and a better fit and are easy to adjust.I also replaced the facial interface, because I sweat a lot and so I wanted something that handles sweat much better, but if you have friends over, I can easily switch out foam with replacements, so multiple people can play and I can introduce more people to VR.  I also purchased universal disposable hygiene covers as well.I also added a skin for the headset and the Oculus Touch controllers, more for protection and I don't want staining or my device to get dirty.But I also purchase a special mat for VR gaming, so I know when I'm moving too much and I can tell when I feel the ridge of the mat that I'm moving to far that I may hit the wall, the couch or getting too close to my aquarium. Because while the Guardian on the headset will show you that you are leaving the safe zone, because you are immersed in the game, sometimes you just fail to pay attention and thus, the mat really helped out with gameplay.Overall, I feel that now is the time to get into VR.  The number of people who are becoming VR gamers and also taking part in the VR community, may it be through a social platform, competitive gaming, etc. has grown.It's changed my life to the point that I look forward to donning the headset at the end of a workday and I have to work out and visit the social community later in the evening and communicate with others.  For adults, this is a wonderful, innovative hardware to own that can be a life changer for many.But like any technology, many adults use it for competitive gaming, casual gaming and social chatting.  And as I know many parents will purchase children headsets, thinking it's another pass-the-time gaming, the problem right now is that certain VR social platforms and even certain games will have children who will talk, cuss and there are few who try to ruin one's experience or those who try to be involved in adult conversations where it's not appropriate for them to be part of.But for the most part, owning the Oculus Quest 2 has more positives than negatives.The Oculus Quest 2 is fantastic, and while not perfect, the improvement in VR technology these last few years and the growing number of things one can do in VR makes the Oculus Quest 2 one of the best investments one can make for 2021.Highly recommended!
review_title: Fantastic!  With the holiday season around the corner - A must buy!

one_reviews_text: My wife purchased the Quest 2 for my birthday not realizing it was a Facebook/Meta product. A Facebook account is REQUIRED to use the Quest 2, which is an absolute dealbreaker, so we are returning it.I work in data science and know exactly how FB can abuse even just the metadata from this device. I will never, ever, EVER allow a Facebook device with black-box software, cameras, and sensors into my home—and neither should you.Update: Returned. Good riddance.
review_title: A Facebook data-harvesting tool disguised as a VR headset

one_reviews_text: Oculus, a.k.a. Facebook, lies and manipulates consumers. Tons of the features they advertise will not be available to you if you buy one of their devices. Think you’re getting a 120 Hz display? You’re not, and if you think you should be based on their advertising and patch notes, they will hide behind their labeling of such important features as merely “experimental.”On top of that, they’ve demonstrated their intent to put ads in *paid* games. There was a backlash against the first attempt, so the developer of the game backed down. But, it’s just a matter of time - they’re simply waiting for peoples’ attentions to wane and tolerance to set in. It’s Facebook, so you know games are going to be absolutely clogged with ads as soon as they feel they can get away with it.Oh, also, the face covering could mess up your face. Mine caused me to break out in a rash. When I contacted them about this, they just said “nope, sorry, it’s not a problem,” only to be forced to admit that it *had been* a problem a few months later when they issued a recall. Shady.In short, save your money and buy from an honest, reputable company before buying into Facebook’s predatory ecosystem

I now own 2 Quest 2's, though one I immediately gifted. I got my first in November of 2020, and ever since have enjoyed it immensely. It's not just a gaming headset, it's a media device, it's a relaxation tool, a workout device, and of course a solid gaming headset. There's more to it than just playing games, which is why I can recommend it to so many kinds of people. Let me explain why that is.The Quest 2 is first off, a lighthouse free device. No set-up of little boxes to see the headset in the corners of the room or on the ceiling. It uses Cameras on the headset, and a virtual boundary that you draw when you start up the headset. You do have to confirm the boundary or re-draw it every time you turn it off and back on all the way, not just let it sleep, but that's a minor issue. Tracking is not as solid as a lighthouse VR like a Steam Index, HTC Vive, Etc. but very usable. There are times where it's a problem, mainly sniping in games like Hotdog's Horseshoe's and Handgrenades, but that's a minor issue. Plus many slight imperfections in tracking are being accounted for by game developers such as Anton of H3VR to make the experience with Camera tracking better for more precision with less precise tracking methods.The media playing of the Quest 2 is very good. You can pull up 3 browser screens at once surrounding you in normal Quest mode with tabs open in each one outside of the active tab. I've had no issues related to compatibility between the Quest 2 Browser and any site, especially when you can request the Mobile or Desktop version of the site if it doesn't work on one. I have not tried putting files directly onto the Quest 2 for playback, so I can't speak on that. The screen on the Quest 2 is very crisp (though not 4K by any means) to where I don't have any issue watching a movie on it with the normal resolution.Comfort wise, I think this is one of the main drawbacks of the Quest 2. The stock strap is good, I used mine for a long period, and still go back to it for certain use scenarios. However, it's not as secure as I want for movement intensive games like Beat saber, even if it won't fall off. Ever since replacing the strap, I've had less headaches with the Quest 2. It also can strain the eyes, but I personally have less issues with that than most. I've played on a Quest 2 for 10 hours straight, and my eyes felt slightly bothered. Not saying everyone can do that. They also recently added a Silicone cover to all Quest 2's or the ability to request one for your Quest 2, which feels much better than the foam alone. The foam to me felt like sandpaper after only a short period, and that cover feels like what it should have been before. Some people will have issues with the Quest 2 using a 3 position IPD, which will change how well you see the lenses. It's a "three sizes fit most" type solution to IPD adjustments. Some people will fall outside of the range of the IPD, or even in the right range won't be perfect, but I've had no issues in the default 2 position it is shipped in. It's also easy to set that position, just slide the lens left or right. Controllers feel good, and should fit most hands, they also only use 1 AA each and last for over 10 hours easily.For gaming, there's 2 different answers to how well it does. I'm breaking it up into two sections as a result. If you're not planning on using your Quest 2 for gaming, please skip this entire section.By itself: The Quest 2 is solid, though it has many limitations. It is not a replacement for a gaming computer, but it can operate many games completely stand alone. SuperHOT VR is one I personally play only on the Quest 2 by itself, and it's been out a moment. You can get many solo VR games on the Quest 2 app store, but some will have graphical downgrades over the PC versions. One example of a game doing this is Onward, a Military Sim shooter, which had to be graphically downgraded on Quest 2's to be compatible to play on the system, but still be capable of playing with true PC players. Many may also look to play VRchat on the system, while I recommend the experience, Quest users on the game are unable to see PC avatars or go to PC worlds, which is a shame. Understand that by itself, the Quest 2 is limited somewhat by it's capabilities, but many developers are designing their games around it, or for compatibility with it. It will be a good amount of time before the Quest 2 becomes an unsupported standalone system.Oculus Link: While the Quest 2 has problems running many games by itself, or have to be downgraded to deal with the processing power, it doesn't have to stay that way. Oculus and aftermarket companies have Oculus Link cables which are USB-C charging cables that are designed for high data transfer rates for a smooth experience. They are also intended to connect your computer to the headset, to use the computer's processing power to play games, rather than the Quest's. As a result, this allows you to play all PC VR games on the Quest 2. However, this hinges on your computer being able to run VR games at all, and at a smooth enough rate to make it a worthwhile experience. VR ready PC's are not cheap, but if you're already trying to play the latest intensive games at high resolution, your hardware already is likely up to the task to play in VR. Even some less powerful PC setups can be fixed to make the experience better, rendering then upscaling to the desired resolution, or other methods. This can make a game much more smooth, less taxing on the hardware running it, and more enjoyable.
