Air Link is still in Early Access, so it doesn't work without issue, but when it works, it's a great way to get the full graphics processing power of a PC without any of the wires, tethers, or tracking system setup that both the Rift and Valve Index require. Of course, there are some trade-offs, but overall, I am very happy with this headset.
review_title: Fun and a good workout. A little disappointed with the store though.

one_reviews_text: Couldn't register the device because of Meta/Facebook's incredibly invasive signup requirements and broken website signup process. Need a fb account, with your real name, with phone number, photo upload verfication to be able to use the oculus 2 at all. Are you f k kidding? Are you the IRS? or a bank? You need all of my personal info so I can use your 200$ plastic device? Nah, I'm good. I'll find my entertainment somewhere else. Be careful who you give your information to. This company only cares about your information, and how to make money off it, you are the product. Not the metaverse I want to be a part of, there are better options out there.

It doesn't need any wires or a computer; you just strap it on and voilà, you are ready to play.Realism:It was realistic lemme tell ya'. Yes, creed does look like a game and not real life, but that is because it's a game and not real life. There was a giant dude with huge muscles on the other side of the arena, and we were playing a real boxing match! (though I didn't feel it). Guess what is there in real life… A wall.Motion sickness:I never experienced motion sickness while playing until I got to the game star wars: tales from the galaxies' edge. I played for about an hour with no breaks and began to feel nauseous… like I was going to throw up. That is my fault though because meta themselves say to take frequent breaks "about every 30 minutes of play" to rest for five minutes. I took a 30-minute walking break outside after that and things seemed to have gotten better.4 stars:Taking into consideration the motions sickness, it goes from 5 to 4 stars. I know for many people, they get motion sick not even trying. For me, it took more, but it still happened.The oculus quest two is overall a great console, it's cool, realistic, and new. I think it's amazing, and will go far in the tech industry.

I'll start by saying that my only negative is the fit. It's really hard to get a decent fit, so the words aren't blurred at all. Could just be my head shape. It does have adjusters for the width and length, as well as the eye glass part can move inward or outward.Super easy to connect and get started. Does NOT have any preloaded games, you have to buy them separately, but there are a few samples on there. We bough beat sabers with an expansion pack and a roller coaster shooting game.Note, if you are prone to motion sickness, certain games you will not be able to play....I can't stomach the rollercoaster one, but beat sabers is fine.Volume is great. Can connect to our computer screen, so others can see what you see.So far, no issues at all.

PROS.I really like the idea of mapping your area. Few years you had to use sensors. With the Oculus Quest 2. You can go to your backyard and use the handset to draw out a area that warns you if you are getting to the edge. Really cool feature.I like the idea I can put them on and have different themes. Like having a bigger office. Or a plush living room. The 3d space coaster was a real blast. And a few other things. The down side of the, like Microsoft, Google and Apple. You have a store to purchase apps. And there not cheap.Cons.IT DOES REQUIRE A FACEBOOK ACCOUNT.For me? That's a Mexican Standoff! I hate social media. Against my belter judgement...I created a Facebook account. Which took a hour to do. Not to mention all the numerous things required for me to , "Acceptance", to go forward.I wanted to use it with my computer. Watch movies. Have a virtual desktop. So I could have 5 or 6 monitors to work with. I was able to see the computer. By just using my phone charger cable. Facebook wants 70.00 dollars for. When I can get the same for 20.00 dollars on Amazon.You can not focus the lenses. I have prescription glasses I wore when I put the headset on. No change or improvement.Some of the graphics are great! But it looks like it's 720p.At 300.00 dollars I was expecting to much. And that's what I got. Anything over 100.00? Is way to much. They are cheaply made
review_title: It was interesting. Before I the heads set was overheating

one_reviews_text: I am using this with Xplane with the intent to help training as a Pilot.  I have spent hours and hours configuring and troubleshooting and it is still not right!  While the 3-D aspect is great I have struggled to get the image sharp enough to read the airplane gauges (which is a requirement to use the Xplane)Forget actually turning the virtual knobs in the plane.After spending lots of time making many adjustments and fixes, I got the resolution just barely useable.  But the Oculus refuses to recognize a USB 3 connection.  The oculus software tells you the connect is USB 2 and too slow, but ultimately the problem is the Oculus.  I have bought new USB card, cables, looked at multiple message boards, try various suggestions nothing works.  To add to the frustration the menus and steps to interface are not intuitive.  I regret buying this.  It might be ready for some techie or someone who just want to play around, but for me it has been a bomb.
review_title: Spend more time troubleshooting than using.

one_reviews_text: I received an Oculus as a Christmas gift. It worked great and then an update came through. After the update there were all of these weird rainbow ghosting lines in the headset. I have been working with Oculus customer support for over a month trying to have them replace it. They are now telling me an additional 12 days and they will send me a replacement that is going to be a refurbished headset. The product was fine when it worked but just hope you never have to contact customer service for anything. The headset is still under warranty and I can't seem to get anywhere with them. Do not purchase this headset, if anything at all happens, you will be out the full cost of the product because no one is going to help you.

I have had the original oculus gearvr with the samsung note 4 and then the last gearvr with the samsung s9 when my note crapped out.  Was about to give the Quest 2 a try and was torn on the required FB login/merge.  Read some of these horror stories with the FB accounts and being banned/disabled, etc.  Created a FB account with all real info and then verified.  Before even getting a chance to order the quest2 (was going to get Amazon 4* store pickup), received FB email that account has been disabled for account/activity not following Community Standards...  I've had no activities and did not use any fake info.  this is beyond ridiculous smh.  oh well.

The Oculus 2 IS fun, however, it will NOT hook up with your Playstation 4 or 5.  It also doesn't hook up to your computer until you have, first, paired it with your smart phone or android phone with an OS of 5 and above.I am returning the one I purchased because I was under the impression that it would be compatible with playstations and it is not.  Which is quite a shame, it IS a lot of fun, I did manage to get it hooked up with my cell phone.  But I want my family to be able to use it, too, not just me.If I did a lot of traveling, I would love to keep this for playing during down time in a hotel, Beat Saber is my jam, but again, everyone wants to be able to use it, so I returned the one I purchased to get a Playstation VR so my whole household could have fun.If it's just for you, it's fantastic!  Or if you don't mind people borrowing your phone, to link to it, great!  :-)  It really IS fun.  But, sadly, if you want it for your playstation, you'll need the playstation VR.  Because it really does work fantastic and is a lot of fun.
review_title: It is NOT compatable with the PS 4 or 5, is not easy to set up.

one_reviews_text: Oculus Quest 2 — Advanced All-In-One Virtual Reality Headset — 128 GBYou are required to have a fb account to useWill stand up to rougher children using and playingIf you do not shut completely off it will be a constant battery hog trying to constantly do updatesHold side power button down until the headset shuts down completelyYou have to manually set to new 90hrtz refresh rateIf planning to be a heavy user it for family gaming I suggest a battery packThe battery life just isn’t that great especially if doing heavy gamingExpect two hours maximum battery life with more like hour and a half typicallyYou can enable shortcut to side tap to look through the cameras to see outside camera viewHand tracking feature now included ( nice feature to use when watching videos)You can now change background and boundary colorYou can no now pair external Bluetooth headphonesExpect this to be the gift that keeps giving your money awayAs in you will be wanting to purchase games frequentlySeriously thought my entire family loves the oculus quest 2 and has created a new favorite past time in my home wether playing it or watching others while playing
Do NOT buy this !!!!!!YOU MUST HAVE A FACEBOOK ACCOUNT FOR THIS.  IF FACEBOOK DOESN'T LIKE WHAT YOU WRITE, YOU'LL HAVE A $300 PAPER WEIGHT.FACEBOOK IS A BULLY.

I've been a VR enthusiast since the first HTC vive and have been watching the technology evolve closely, and I think we're finally at a point where it's worth jumping in for mainstream audiences.I admit that the facebook account requirement is philosophically annoying (I don't understand all the details but I gather that facebook/meta being able to access our use data is part of the reason why this thing is as cheap as it is), but nothing else on the market is this user friendly or powerful. In my best estimation, you'd need to have upward of $2000 into a PC and VR hardware for a setup that meaningfully exceeds with this can do.With all the potential VR has for educational experiences, social interaction, and immersive exercise, there's something to appeal to basically anyone. Some of the games can and do cause nausea and headaches with prolonged use but that's pretty avoidable. The most popular software is designed to avoid the motions that throw most people off, and you can learn pretty quickly how long you can comfortably immerse yourself.
review_title: By far the best entry point for VR right now

one_reviews_text: I used the original oculus prototype maybe 5 or so years ago and it was a very interesting concept.  I got this quest 2 for Christmas 2021 from my wife.  I am just blown away by how amazing, smooth, well thought out this device is.  I am a software developer so I know the tech at a lower level than most and I am extremely amazed at how well it works.  Also the hands controls work flawlessly with the unit.  The hand controls are part of what makes this device a 10/10 in my book.  The special audio is also amazing.  The 1 and only issue I had was the default head strap sucks.  I had to upgrade to the elite strap, which made all the difference in the world.  For $300 this thing is a bargain!

I got the 128gb version of the Quest 2 and I absolutely love it. I used to have the Oculus Rift but ended up selling it because I no longer had a good room to set it up in with all the sensors, cords, and my PC. With the Oculus Quest 2 I no longer have these issues and can use the headset anywhere in my house (that has enough room) without worrying about where to setup the sensors and PC. The picture quality is good and I had no issues setting it up on my first use. It is pretty neat that you can connect it with your phone to show others what you are viewing within the VR headset. Overall the quality of the headset is great and it is so much easier to setup than the Oculus Rift.Pros:Wire FreeGreat trackingGood quality displayBuilt in audio is pretty good (and you have the ability to connect your own headphones)Good amount of games to choose fromAbility to connect to a PC to play more demanding gamesCons:Headset could distribute weight of the headset better (better options can be purchased)Not all previously purchased Oculus Rift games can be played on the Quest (a lot of them transfer over, but not all can be played unless you have the cable to connect it to a PC)Battery life isn't great for longer play sessions
review_title: All in one VR Headset - FUN!

one_reviews_text: Oculus was great while it was working, completely died after 6 months.  Dealing with customer service has been an absolute nightmare.  Our device arrived back to them almost a month ago, there was supposed to be a 3-5 day turnaround for the replacement to be sent.  A month later and they are finally saying they are conducting an investigation into what happened to my device.  I asked if they could just send out a replacement, since the investigation isn’t my problem.  They said no I have to wait for the full investigation to play out.  No end in sight, buyer beware, worst customer service and support I’ve ever dealt with.

If i wrote this review when I first purchased the Quest 2 i would have given it 5 stars.  9 months after owning it, the screen went black and the device was non functional. I contacted customer support on January 2 who escalated my request to the next tier.  After two weeks of incommunicato I emailed again I finally heard back and was given an RMA number and asked to return the device.  It’s been three months with no updates or even confirmation they know where my device is.  My tickets get  posted and the responses are empty platitudes.  The only time i have received support like this was on failed kick starters.  It’s truly shameful.  Don’t waste your money unless you are prepared to purchase a new one. When the old one breaks under warranty.

My son in law brought this be headset over for the holidays. We got it working and it was neat to play with, but still felt like a gimmick than anything by revolutionary or next gen or high quality.The controller is nice and comfortable, and the head tracking is very responsive. But the resolution felt pretty low and the screen was blurry and hard to focus at different angles, even with adjusting the eye hardware. There is also a very limited number of games and apps currently that utilize the potential of the vr technology.I will say that there is a lot of untapped potential in vr technology, and I am excited for the future. But as it sits right now, it’s best to sit back and wait for a couple more generations of technology to really elevate this into a must have product.  If you ever tried the Xbox Kinect back in the day, vr right now feels very similar. More of a neat trick to experience, but nothing mind blowing or awe inspiring. Just kinda neat.

Let’s Go Facebook!Whyyyyy? Do you REQUIRE KIDS TO HAVE A FACEBOOK ACCOUNT?Everyone knows that this is a horrible idea.- Just ask any Mental Health expert.Why would you need to expose your kid to “Social” Media just to use a virtual reality headset????

Remember that line? Well now you pay hundreds of dollars for a VR headset AND Facebook (or Meta or whatever stupid rebrand they go in the future) is still harvesting all your data and selling it to advertisers. You are paying for a product AND STILL Facebook is double dipping and selling your data to advertisers. It will NEVER end if we as consumers don't stand up for our privacy rights and boycott this nonsense.
review_title: If you aren't paying for the product, YOU are the product

one_reviews_text: I won't repeat all the details you can read elsewhere, but I will say as an owner of the Oculus Rift and HTC Vive, this setup is so close for most users and activities with better clarity (as long as the IPD adjustment works for you), that this is a no-brainer for anyone interested in VR.  Yes, evil Facebook account required, but who cares you probably are already leaking privacy with everything else you have these days.The only negative is the failure of tracking behind your head, but so rarely do you do this in 99% of VR it's meaningless as a negative.  I will also say the wireless VR link to a PC to run Oculus games is a snap and works well provided you are within say 15' of of a 5G router for both devices.That being said as of this writing the Oculus Connect 2021 is on October 28th which is highly rumored  to release a new headset so you may want to wait for a price drop on this unit or get the new one which is rumored to have face and/or eye tracking and maybe even a degree of full body tracking.
review_title: The VR mainstream that beats 90% of what's out there for a fraction of the price!

one_reviews_text: Where do I begin? This is FREAKING AWESOME. I’m not a gamer and I’m middle aged and I first became aware of this, this past summer & I KNEW I HAD TO HAVE IT! Finally a few weeks ago I purchased it and it is AMAZING. I DO RECOMMEND buying a case even if you don’t take it no where. The games are so real I still have not walked out in the Plank (richies plank) rollercoasters-transporting myself to CHINA-newYork-random places. And it’s so flipping real. They should donate some of these to old folks homes/nursing homes. I implore you stop procrastinating and discover. I like that you can sit also not just stand. I go fishing and everything. Fun fun fun. You don’t need accessories except I would definitely invest in an adjustable head strap. There have generic brands that are great on this site. And a case They have some good one on this site for 20$ And I would definitely invest in the the headset and hand/wand coverings I’m getting hot pink. 🤪😜😄🥰😍⚽️🏈⚾️🎱🏓🛼🤿🥊⛳️🧘🏽‍♀️🧗🏼‍♀️🏆🎤🎸🚀⛵️🚁
review_title: If I could give more ⭐️’s I would.

one_reviews_text: I was gifted this oculus 2 for Christmas, it's still not hooked up or even used due to the required Facebook account needed. I haven't had a facebook since 2013, it bums me out that in order to enjoy this virtual reality system that Facebook had to just ruin it. Meta is supposedly going to help fix that but I'm sure that will come with the Zuckerberg effect too. I like gaming, not social media. The graphics are amazing from when I used my friends, this overall system is spectacular. Just seems to be one common flaw with reality and virtual: Facebook.

We have an issue with our right controller, which is a known issue that affected many of the systems that were sent out. Essentially the AA battery in the right controller is loose and does not make a solid connection with both terminals. This is not an issue with the left controller, as one of the terminals in the left controller is spring-loaded, keeping presure against the battery to prevent it from moving back and forth. That is not the case with the right controller; both are stationary.I contacted Oculus Support multiple times. The first time they asked me for a picture of the new and old battery in the controller. Done, sent that.Then they asked me to send me a picture of the old and new batteries next to each other. Done, sent that.Then, they asked me to submit a video that shows how I insert the battery and that it is loose. Done, sent that.I'll update this review if they ever send us a new right controller for this known issue (Google it).
review_title: Faulty Right Controller, Helpless Support Desk

one_reviews_text: Avoid this overpriced headset at all costs. Wireless or not it is not worth it. The headstraps are so poor quality, to position into an actual vision that isnt blurry is not possible. The strings for the controllers have to be so lightly on otherwise they are tearing your skin.

I bought an Oculus Quest 2 and 2 days later returned it for one very disturbing reason.  No parental controls to block adult content on the Oculus Browser.  Oculus knows this is an issue and have not fixed it.  Be warned!!!

I'll admit I didn't care one way or the other but just a heads up for those who did, the FB requirement will be going away.For me it doesn't get better for the price, there's absolutely no better introduction to vr. What they've been able to do with the hardware compared to the specs you need in a gaming rig is impressive to say the least, at a fraction of the price. Easy to set up, decent battery life, if you decide you're infatuated with VR after and want to drop thousands of dollars to get there, it's _still_ nice having a quest.2 cons1. not having game licensed transfer between rift and quest is terrible2. The library is and will continue to be the biggest limiter. As far as what this wireless, mobile version of vr needs to be, it's pretty much there already. We just need user/dev adoption, and it's a chicken/egg situation.

I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 (256gb) locally at the advertised price of $399. plus tax, etc. No shipping delay experienced, and I had it in just a few days. Purchased as a gift for my grandson, and determined to ensure it would work, I felt compelled to check it out. Because of my immediate satisfaction needs, I had it up and running in practically no time at all. And although I had needlessly downloaded everything to my gaming laptop, I was surprised to find Quest 2  worked perfectly without a PC. It was simple, even for me, to set it up. And I find the VR to be nothing less than absolutely stunning. Loved it so much I immediately ordered another for my grandson. I’m keeping this one for myself. Haven’t yet determined how to change the touch controller batteries though. Discovered that a nitwit could do that. Glad I'm not one, though.

I purchased the Quest 2 after the Rift S PC connecting port broke after less than 2 months. After merely 3 months and less than 20-30 hours of total use, the display for the headset of the quest 2 has died. I have tried trouble-shooting with the official support site, but the answer I keep coming back to is to return it and request a new one. This is the poorest quality of equipment I have ever paid this kind of price for, ($600, bought the 256 GB).The Oculus truly became the worst VR option after it was acquired by Facebook. Please take your business to a company who actually cares about the product they produce and isn't just using it to gather more user data to sell.

The device itself is great so far, knock on wood, but their Customer Support sucks.  Just Google Oculus Support Reviews and read them for yourself.  You can only chat or email with a rep and there is no escalation point.  They will seem helpful during your first chat and they will open a ticket for you, but good luck after that on getting a status. When you try and reach out via email, no one replies back, and if you reach out again via chat for a status they will give you the run around and tell you to wait for someone to reply back to your email ticket, which no one does.  I still have no update to a ticket I opened over 3 wks ago to fix/add an account id to our expensive Oculus.  Rate the device a 5 and support a 0.

A lot of my friends have been raving about the Oculus and how it's a must have item during quarantine. After having owned one and playing it a couple of times a week, I agree. This is a great product if you’re interested in exploring the VR world.Pros:Set up is super easy and quick, you don’t need to be tech savvyYou can easily connect with other friends that have an OculusThe user interface is easy to navigateThe actual system is very well builtLarge game library and they’re affordableCons:Not the most comfortable thing if you wear glassesInstalling the glasses spacer isn’t really easy. I’d recommend watching a youtube video to make sure you’re not removing a part that shouldn’t be removed.Headstrap isn’t the most comfortable
review_title: VR is going to be the next takeover

one_reviews_text: Oculus requires that you have an active facebook account to use the product. In attempting to activate an old deactivated account of mine, I learned my account had been hacked and taken over. After 4+ weeks of going to Facebook Help Center (which is a strange loop that leads to nowhere) and being turned away from Oculus customer support--I had to return the product without ever having a chance to even play it. I repeatedly requested a phone call to resolve this issue and was only given the same links to the help page and the same copy/pasted responses from Oculus customer support. Hard to want to participate in the "Metaverse" when they only want to collect your data but not protect it...

I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 as a Chirstmas gift for my Grandson. He was excited about it and everything started out great, but around the 4th week it became very glitchy and then ended up over-heating, not connecting, etc., etc. until it finally wouldn't work at all. My Grandson was very disappointed, as he really wanted this for Christmas. Honestly, I would think very long and hard before purchasing this product.  Personally, I won't be purchasing another one.

Bought this and a fb account is required but they deleted my account when I posted spicy memes during 2016 election so I’m SOL. Bought this cause I heard it’s like heroin and gonna ruin society on purpose by the people trying to lock everyone down and so i thought I could hide from the covid trackers w it in my moms basement but no fb account cause they delet me.

Got this for our kids because they kept asking and clearly they are children so they dont know better. This thing is garbage. the oculus available games are something from the 90s arcade. The decent VR games from Steam you have to jump through hoops to get to play. definitely something a child isnt capable of doing. this needs to be plug and play and if you arent going to play well with pc. it shouldnt even be sold. garbage. no wonder its a part of facebook.
review_title: a waste of money and time.

one_reviews_text: This has been excellent to get me moving and in shape. I love  to beat saber and slay me some flicking Zombies!! The us is decent and set even stoned to the bone was easy. At 58 I find it’s been also helpful in regaining some balance too. That said I am Highly prone to motion sickness and certain games are a no. I can handle on rails shooter action but not FPS. Yes the head strap is crap. Spend the $45 and get a kiwi. Totally worth it and haven’t any comfort issues since. Lastly people stop whining about having a FB account to use it. You give your email address out for everything… YOU are the data already. Too late, get over it. Enjoy the Quest 2 it’s awesome
review_title: Old lady gamer says stop Whining

one_reviews_text: Our set lasted approx 2 months at that point we started having issues with many aspects. The left controller would disapear, the right controller wouldnt track, the headseat wouldnt turn on etc.  After 3 months of back and forth cobversations with tech support, and doing the various "fixes" that they suggested, which included a factory reset making the headset less useful than a paperweight, they finally asked for me to ship my items to them so they can " asses what is happening with the unit".I was passed through at least 10 different people.Would NOT buy this again.

Got Quest 2 as a Christmas present, and I am awestruck by the visuals. The device was made better than I expected, but for one thing... the head strap. IF you REALLY want to enjoy this product? BUY the Delux Headset or (better yet) the $100 Elite Strap w Battery.The strap it comes with actually harms your ability to get quality visuals, right out of the box.Next, have a PC that you can connect your O Q 2 TO, and download Steam. Steam VR is all you need to GREATLY increase your library of games, WITHOUT taking up the (linited) space in the headset.I would suggest this for MOST adults, ALL gamers, and mature young people (do NOT get it for your 6-10 year old)..Can't wait for Quest Pro and Quest 3.
review_title: Incredible Experience, Built with Quality, BUT...

one_reviews_text: I bought 2 of these for my kids for Christmas. 10 and 12 year old Girls. First (after 4 hours of play) a controller trigger broke. It sticks in and doesn't pop out. After 1 hour on Occulus Customer service chat (which was a nightmare) I was told to mail it back for a "refurbished" controller (not a new one).  Then 2 days later the other head set had a chip malfunction and got stuck on a load screen. Then it gave a computer chip icon..overheated and died. It died in such a fashion that it wouldn't turn off !!! .. It became so HOT you couldn't touch it. Almost a self destruct mode. So if you want your kids to be sad that their Christmas gifts broke..Get the Occulus. Otherwise, Stay away from Zuckerbergs junk product !!!

Not for kids under 18, can damage them in many ways if they are still growing/developing... Motor skills, eyesight, and many more things can be permanently impaired... Seen a lot of pictures/videos of reviews showing kids wearing these.... I would never buy this for my kid, kids should be outside experiencing the real world... I guess nobody learned the lesson the film Ready Player One taught us lol.... Poor sheeple

It does require Facebook account but I don’t use Facebook much and didn’t need to do more than just login to FB, and don’t see it as a problem.What surprised me the most is that I bought it as a VR headset for my PC and only later realized that Quest 2 is a full gaming console that doesn’t require a PC and can be traveled with or carried anywhere without relying on a PC. All the games are downloaded directly to Quest 2 and played on the device, though some additional games may be available via Steam account installed on a PC. So you can play PC VR games optionally. Other than that, my whole family is having fun playing golf, boxing, angry birds, shooting and action games, etc.

It does come with a cheap thin “glasses spacer” that goes inside the foam, but still fails tremendously as it’s not at all effective. The foam pushes the glasses against the  head and is extremely uncomfortable after just a few minutes or so. It’s a massive design fail on Oculus’s part. It’s as if the designers did absolutely no testing on those that wear glasses.The HoloLens does a much better job as nothing pushes against the wearers face. Oculus needs to copy their headset design as HoloLens allows the wearing of glasses with no issues and no pushing the frames against the users head.Definitely returning. Can’t say much about the experiences and games since I can’t even see anything.
review_title: Warning: Not designed to work for those wearing glasses.

one_reviews_text: The left controller quit after a few months, within warranty. I sent it in. They confirmed it is broken. 2 months later and I still did not receive a replacement. Excuses of lack of inventory. Really? Lack of inventory? Seems to me that we don't want to service the warranty but we want to keep selling more.

This is a great headset with full range of motion.I thought this was going to be like Google Cardboard or the Oculus Go, but it's not. It has full range of motion like the HTC Vive or Valve Index, without the need for those little tracker cubes that you have to place around the room.The headset could wirelessly connect to your PC with a click of a button, and you could play Steam VR games on it, or watch downloaded videos.It has a large library of games in the Oculus Store, and there are also a lot of VR videos to watch in the Oculus Explore page.If you have been wanting a VR headset, then this is the one to get.I use it almost every single day to watch videos, and sometimes I would play Half-Life: Alyx on it.
review_title: Great headset with full range of motion

one_reviews_text: Yeah, VR is incredible and some of the games are pretty epic.  But once something goes wrong with your system, and it will, probably sooner than it should, it's Facebook that you have to rely on for support and customer service.  You know...Facebook.  We haven't been able to access our VR for weeks and I have yet to get a simple response from anyone in support.  Nothing.  Just silence.  Must be too busy fact checking everyone's narrative.

I bought the Quest 2 because I fell in love with games presented on Youtube such as Boneworks, Blood Trail, and Blade and Sorcery. Although, most of those popular games are only available on PCVR and the developers excuse is they couldn't optimize the games on regular VR, which is just a bs excuse imo. And there are no alternatives and/or nothing similar for those games either. That is sad. However, you can still have fun. There are other fun games available on the Oculus Quest 2 and it's an excellent experience for families and fellow gamers. I must admit that I have a lot of fun. I 100% recommend it despite my opinion. But you will never have the same awesome experience as those with a PC. It's unfair in my opinion.
review_title: It's fun but can be a let down

one_reviews_text: Look, you’re going to read a bunch of negative reviews about how heavy and bulky it is and how the battery doesn’t last long enough and those things are totally true.now, for the good news. I don’t play video games. Well, things to this… Maybe a little now! I had gaming systems growing up, from Atari to the original Nintendo to Sega genesis to Sega cd to Nintendo 64 to see your Dreamcast two Xbox 360 and a PS3 in the end. It’s been 10 years since I’ve owned one. When I put this headset on, if I were to have to make a guess as to how much money it cost, The number would definitely not be $299. If somebody told me the number was between $2500 and $3000, I would believe them.

This is a bad idea to buy something for so much money and have it break. I found out the hard way, so one day I put the device on and see that the reflection from the sun, not even directly by it but still enough to have it damage the screen with three annoying dots. so even out of sunlight and well taken care of this can be a big issue.

My brother’s birthday is in November, in 2021 he received his Oculus Quest 2. After trying his new present, I asked for one for my birthday in December of last year, since I have been hooked! I purchased a Nintendo earlier in the year, but I got bored fast, and I wanted something different. The Oculus Quest 2 is a virtual reality headset that is an all-in-one console where you can download a variety of games, talk to people, and play with friends. Everyone who has played on my oculus has loved it and I love sharing it with my friends and family, I play almost every day. The oculus is one headset with two remotes, it comes in a simple box with tabs that direct you on how to set up and open your new Oculus headset. It’s a very simple gaming system with minimal difficulty in setting up, it makes it easy for people of any age to play and it is directed towards a very wide audience. The oculus is very secure on your face and there are almost zero worries about it possibly falling off, it is adjustable to fit almost everyone. One pro to the oculus is online gaming is free unlike competitors like Xbox or PlayStation consoles. You don’t have to worry about subscriptions and accidentally forgetting to renew your subscription. That way you don’t have to worry about spending extra money or missing out on playing with friends. One negative of the oculus is it can get hot in the headset when you are playing and sometimes it can irritate your face or even leave a red ring on your face. When it gets hot in your headset it can make it uncomfortable if you play for long periods of time and in some cases give people rashes. I would recommend the Oculus. It is fun and a new exciting activity for any age group. It is definitely the best gift I ever received.

My teen boys love their oculus. As already stated we bought 2 of them and they will stand together playing the same game together on them. The love them. My 1 son in particular he places this about equal to his xbox and that is saying something for him. My oldest has autism and typically his sensory issues wont allow him to play anything that must be attach to him like the headset requires but he did surprisingly well. I put in in a roller coaster youtube video and he loved in up until he stayed on too long and said mom I'm getting sick. I had to remind him he isnt physically there so just remove the headset 😂
review_title: We bought 2 oculus starter kits for our 3 boys and the husband to share and they all love it

one_reviews_text: UPDATE: Got my refurbished headset after returning my other one. Now Air Link no longer works. I get to deal with tech support again!It worked well for two months or so. Now it is the buggiest piece of electronic equipment that I have ever owned. Constantly the screen goes black without warning. It often happens during boot-up, but can happen at any time. The only way to remedy is to take the headset off and put it back on about 3 to 5 times, or to reset it. Sometimes it goes black, but the guardian outline is still visible. Sometimes it goes black and just shows three loading dots. Multiplayer games are out of the question. Returning this piece of s___.
review_title: Worked well for about two months. Now it is incredibly buggy.

one_reviews_text: Oculus discontinued the Oculus GO headset and then turned off the VR function on the headsets making them useless within a few years of roll out. This was not just my experience, their Support forum is filled with people have the same issue within the last week and I'm sure that thousands more will have the same issue once they realize that there is nothing that the owners can do to resolve it. I submitted a support ticket and was advised that they are "not trained to handle this type of issue" and then "I will be closing this ticket, please do not hesitate to reach back out to us again in the future for any questions or concerns that you may have we are just one chat or email away and we are available 24/7. I wish nothing but great things to happen in your life." If you buy it, expect that you will be throwing it out and be force to buy another. Oculus acts like a drug dealer getting you hooked and forcing you to continually buy more. I'm absolutely disgusted that the tech world finds it acceptable that two years of use is all you can expect.
review_title: Oculus turned off VR in the GO headsets after two years, expect to buy a new one in a few years

one_reviews_text: This must be experienced to fully understand how incredible. You cannot explain the initial shock a first timer feels when literally finding themselves in a virtual world. From literally feeling like you are playing ping pong to miniature golf being at the grand cannon it boggles the mind. Add in there are countless free VR videos such a trips in international space station to experiencing a local jail and you don’t even have to spend anymore than for the headset to have tons of free content.  Also ref room is a free app allowing you to experience games and interactions with others. No Experience needed and technology to get this up and running in minutes
review_title: Needs to be tried to understand how amazing

one_reviews_text: I have owned quest 2 since thanks giving 2021 and workout using supernatural very regularly. While it is a good start, here are few things which I find are functional issues and need to be fixed:1. The lenses fog up soon after wearing it and take long time to clean up. This causes blur vision.2. I normally wear glasses but you cannot use it with glasses nor it has vision correctness feature. It makes it very very difficult for me to play.3. After working out for few minutes the sweat started to drop down And goes straight into my mouth. I wish there was a better way to control out.

This is my second quest 2 headset. I would recommend getting a 3rd party replacement headstrap with a battery pack holder. I think this is the best bang for your buck headset. It can operating independently with phone like graphics, or hook up to a PC. Overall Facebook keeps on adding new features, I like the use without the controllers.I had to go to a few hardware resets setting up different accounts with app sharing, but it was all working in the end. There is a limit of sharing of apps to only 1 headset, and the app owner must have the main account. The owner of the apps must use the other headset.  But playing cook out or mini golf is much more entertaining with a partner!

This is the best value for money device I have ever bought; we currently have 2 Quests 2s and 1 Rift CV1. I use it daily for media consumption as a giant screen (videos, live streams, movies, etc), for PC gaming (wired and wireless) and for stand-alone gaming. Also, having guests at home is never boring; priceless first time reactions from people of every age trying this.While many people have no comfort issues with the stock elastic strap, for me the Elite Strap (with or without battery) or a similar alternative replacement of the stock strap, is a must. I use an alternative strap with a power bank velcroed to the back for additional hours and better weight distribution on the head. Plugging in some over-the-ear headphones, I can lay back on my recliner for hours, not bothering the rest of the family or the other way around :)An important note for the older generation... unlike your phone or your tablet, you don't need reading glasses with the Quest. Also, if the 3 fixed IPD settings give you a blurry image, you can move the slider in between settings for better clarity. I have set mine between 2 and 3.It is definitely worth mentioning that the device capabilities, features and functions are constantly and, would say, pleasantly, being upgraded while bugs are being ironed out. Excellent work, thank you Oculus/Meta!Favorite, mostly played game: Eleven table tennis (the best simulator of any sport on any platform, ever).Unforgettable, must play games: Half Life Alyx, Walking Dead Saints and Sinners, Lone Echo, Vader Immortal and, of course, everyone's favorite: Beat Saber. Google Earth VR has also been a hit with guests.The best 300 dollars (plus taxes and shipping) I have ever spend!

My son received one of these as a holiday gift. After having it for a couple of weeks, I put it on one day to see how it worked and immediately noticed a few dead pixels in the left side of the display.It's definitely not the end of the world, annoying, yes, as my eyes go right to them, but I thought for $300+ this shouldn't be the case after just a couple of weeks.I've contacted customer service and they've passed me off between two different people over the past two days, giving me the run around and asking for the same tedious information (serial numbers, addresses, etc... over and over).They are now insisting that I stick a camera in the display to shoot video or capture a still image of the dead pixel. It sounded absurd to me, but I tried it anyway and found it to be an impossible request. They won't proceed with helping me unless I'm able to do this. I can't believe it. Buyer beware and be prepared to live with a defective display.
review_title: Defective Display After Two Weeks, Company Won't Repair or Replace

one_reviews_text: Turns out you can't use this without a Facebook account. I wouldn't use that commie-wannabe leftist site if they paid me. Pass.
review_title: Facebook account? Not if you paid me.

one_reviews_text: We didn't buy it on Amazon. My mom bought my son one, for Christmas. He hasn't put it down, except for school and bed. So during his downtime, I have some opportunities to swipe it. Sure the standalone games are fun, but what piqued my interest, was hooking it up my computer and playing my racing sims. ....OMG! Took me a an hour of fanagling, but once I get it working...I can't see myself going back to triples. Especially for formula cars. It brings a whole new dimension to sim racing. You, literally, sit down in the formula car, with the cockpit cowling wrapped all around you. It's so amazing the immersion this brings, with a good FFB wheel set.
review_title: Amazing piece of tech for cheap!

one_reviews_text: If you buy this, get the 256gb.  Might be my only regret.Requiring a FB account, I immediately wanted to drop it to 2 stars.  But for the price(+1) and the quality (+1), I don't regret it (yet...)Comfortable enough that I can wear for a couple hours, no issues generally.  The strap could be better, but more comfortable replacements are cheap enough.  So much better than the last time I used VR lol (1st gen HTC Vive and Oculus Rift)

I love the Quest 2 and Quest. My only complaint is that the head strap on the Quest fits better and stays put better than the Quest 2. I was involved in very physical game play when the head set slipped off my face and cost me my progress. If it slips, the images blurs. I wish that the straps were interchangeable.Better still,  it would be nice to have the capacity to upgrade storage for the Quest.
review_title: Great product, except The head set won't stay on my head

one_reviews_text: It’s a whole new world. There are games for everyone, from puzzle, fighting, simulation. Prices are fair for the games when on sale or in a bundle. It does lag a good bit, and can load slowly. The cast feature (to stream the head set to your tv) is very slow, sometimes won’t even come up on my phone, rarely will it connect to my built in chrome cast android tv. Also my 4 year old can’t play some games like job simulator bc he’s too short. You can adjust the floor of the boundary but how to adjust the height? Some presets for young kids would be helpful. Hopefully some updates will help this. Overall great for the money.
review_title: Very cool experience, kind of slow

one_reviews_text: I absolutely love my Oculus Quest 2!This is the best VR headset in the market, hands down. One of the best things about it is that it is tetherless, meaning you do not have to worry about tripping on any cables while you have it on your head. This makes it very mobile and easy to transport. For example, it is a breeze moving between living room to bedroom and vice versa. In addition, it makes it easy to transport to your friends and family's homes.The build quality and screen quality is excellent. I'm surprised by how comfortable it is to wear compared to other VR headset models. It's not heavy at all and there is a soft foam cushion on the front to block out any ambient light into your eyesight as you use it.It is truly a remarkable experience trying out the Oculus Quest 2 for the first time. It is hard to explain. The moment you put the headset on, you'll feel like you are in another world. One of the things that really impressed me was how realistic it feels and how responsive and accurate your head and hand movements are reflected in the 3D environment. If you play long enough, you might even forget about the real world :)The sound quality is also very clear.The headset has a feature called "Passthrough" which allows you to see the real world even while you have the headset on. This is because the headset has cameras on the outside that project pass through video onto the screen on the inside of the headset. This is an amazing feature as it allows you to orient yourself in the real world while you have the headset on. It is also used to configure safety boundaries before you play any video games.There are so many video games on Oculus Quest 2 including Beat Saber, Superhot VR, Ping Pong, Boxing, Population One, Escape Room games, Star Wars, Resident Evil, etc. Horizon Worlds is a free VR online game that allows you to create, explore and play with other people online.I highly recommend going through the the Quest 2 tutorial where you learn how to pick up objects with the hand controllers, throw objects, punch objects, use one or two hands on objects, dodge objects, crouch and slide from objects, push objects, dance with objects --- it is really limitless the amount of things you can do with this VR headset.Additionally aside from games, you can also explore 3D artwork narrated by creative artists and even watch movies in 3D or 2D if you choose. It supports a web browser and even youtube viewing. Overall you can also burn a lot of calories from it. I highly recommend the Quest 2!

I will say that this unit is amazing when it works.  Ours had one of it’s controllers go down within six months and we had to send it back, received a refurbished one back and it also did not work.  After chatting with the company and having to jump through some ridiculous hoops, they decided to have us send back the main unit.  Not a huge fan of having to send a $300 piece of equipment back to the company only to receive a refurbished unit back!  If I wanted a used one, I would have bought one on Ebay and saved money!  At any rate, they’ve had the unit for over two weeks and can’t tell me what’s going on with it, if they’re just sending me a refurb unit, why would it take this long?  Only way you can contact them is by email and chat which is ridiculous.  I will say that they would respond within 24 hours by email which is great but back and forths like that still take days.  Also the last few of my emails have gone unanswered.  Spoke with them tonight via chat and got less info from them then I even did a week ago!  I will say that this process that began back in June or so is partially my fault because it was summer and we weren’t using it as much, so I mistakenly put it off, but the main jist is that it worked for five months, takes days upon days to figure out what the problem may be and a long time to get the issue dealt with.  Having a technical support number would be a must you would think!!!
review_title: Great when it works, good luck when it doesn’t!

one_reviews_text: Sorry I cant do Facebook anymore. It amazes me you are forcing people to get FB to use the VR.

This is my first VR headset and so far I'm really loving it. I've downloaded Beat Saber, Supernatural, Eleven (table tennis), Super Hot, Premium Bowling, Tripp (mediation), Creed (boxing), Racket and Blade & Sorcery. The last one will take me some time to get the hang of, but I love the rest. I've always been very sedentary and have weight to lose, so even low-level activity in these apps cause me to break a sweat and I feel great afterwards. I actually look forward to my Supernatural workouts every day! The best $299 I've spent in a long time. Definitely recommend.

What is this device we have here? It looks like goggles you would need to go through a sandstorm or a snowstorm. “Virtual Reality” I did not know technology could excel this quickly. I am from another world, and it looks like I am from the past from just seeing this stuff, but I came from a year that is higher than your’s? It’s 2022 at your time, but I came later. I am from 3000, it looks like your technology was more high tech then my own universe I came from. Interesting. We are close to something like that. We have the View Makers, but they aren’t like your View Makers. They are used by people to view their surroundings that are invisible to the naked eye. From my universe there are people that hide from us, and we use these to find them, or find where they were.
review_title: What is this? But it looks cool.

one_reviews_text: Definitely DO NOT recommend.Worked great for about 10-15 hours game time then the grip button on the left controller got stuck. Sent my controller back in to support as requested. Once it’s in heir hands they tell me there is “a bit of a backlog” with no estimate on repair time. Now I have a $300 paperweight. Definitely would NOT recommend as it seems to be an ongoing issue.UPDATE: Coming up on a month from sending in the controller for RMA replacement. Facebook has acknowledge receiving the controller but will not give any estimates on the replacement shipping, simply saying they are working on it. The documented email support conversation says 3-5 days for replacements to ship.

I have one that I purchased and my son loved it! I say loved (past tense) since when someone Hacks your account and changes your email address, password and phone number you are done! No support and they run you in circles as the account holder although they recognize you've signed in on TWO different devices so enter your password, "you have entered a wrong password but we will send it to you" (The Hacker because everything has been changed!) I Uploaded my License as asked when I went to their site to prove my identity but still didn't work as it was easier for the Hacker! My young son is upset since all of the games I purchased for him (several hundred dollars) were from his achievements at school. BEWARE! If it happens to you, you're only option is one of their outside firms, the Class Action that is gaining momentum, the flyers that some in-store employees are handing out to parents (at least the non-commission ones) or just protect yourself better than our 14-24 password with upper, lower, characters galore and nothing to due with a name or birthday or pet or anything else. Protect your Teens even better than I thought I did, especially if you have minors. He loves it, but I Love him more and all they care about is your money and Nothing Else!
review_title: Buyer Beware because the Hacker can take over your info via FB or Oculus and ruin your kids fun!

one_reviews_text: The product works great on day one. And that’s about it. The battery life doesn’t even approach 50% of what’s promised. You have to pay premium gaming prices for ridiculous games. The headset burns out within months, and this company will watch you jump through every hoop and never replace their defective product. I was skeptical when I realized Facebook was behind this piece of junk. Now I’m certain it’s worthless. Stay away!
review_title: Grossly overpriced, unreliable gimmick. And good luck with their customer service.

one_reviews_text: buy a game on the Quest you can't play it while connected to a PC. pay for a game in the Oculus store on PC you can't download it for stand alone play on the Quest. that means you would have to pay for every game that twice if you want it on your PC and quest. do yourself a favor and buy yourself a Vive or an Index

I love my Oculus 2. The amount of free stuff alone makes it worth buying. There are a lot of apps to try out. I highly recommend the app alcove to try out first. The social apps have a long ways to go, because little kids are extremely toxic and make them an enjoyable. I however do have one huge complaint. The battery is absolutely horrible. Good luck getting more than three hours of use before you have to charge it again. It’s a shame too, because I can spend hours on this thing.

This is an amazing headset, and a real leap from the last generation set. I'm seeing improvement in all the little things, resolution, peripheral vision. I'm someone who experiences some motion sickness using VR. It is still there, but there is a small improvement in that as well, likely due to the more seamless experience this headset is providing. Really great.

So I received my quest 2 this evening.  Seems to be well packed and the opening /unboxing experience left the impression that this was going to be awesome and fun... And then I turned it on. Couldn't get past the pairing screen the left controller wouldn't show up even though my phone app showed that it was paired. Got on the support website followed all the troubleshooting steps to fix the problem... No joy. Used the support chat. Followed the directions of the tech including a factory reset and still the device doesn't work. I am told the Tech will email me with what to do next after he takes a bunch of personal info. I am left waiting for an email and no idea what the next step is or how long to expect it to take. After a few minutes I get back on support chat trying to find out how long this process is going to take and find out that I am supposed to wait 3-5 days!!!!! Seriously? I just spent over $400 on something that doesn't work and I can't use at all and you expect me to wait 3-5 days for a response to try to solve the problem??? Depending on how they handle this I may revise this review but for now my opinion is this sucks.
review_title: Probably great if you can get it to work.

one_reviews_text: This VR headset is light weight but can be somewhat uncomfortable after extended wear.  Everything works well and I don't experience much latency.  This device is a good way to immerse yourself in the VR world to take a break from the harsh reality.My main concerned is the FB requirement.  It is rather terrifying to me how much of my personal data these big tech companies own and what they plan to do with that.  It is frustrating that they leverage their size to force you to provide more and more personal information.

This headset would be 5/5 stars all day, if it didn't require you to login with your Facebook account.  Aside from that, this is the perfect headset for anyone wanting to get into VR, but don't already have a high-end PC.  Heck, even if you do have a high-end PC, you can use this headset WIRELESSLY to play your PC only VR games.Oculus are constantly updating the firmware for the Quest 2 and unlocking more of its potential features.  For what you're getting the $299 price tag is better value than any other headset on the market.
review_title: Best VR headset for the price (with a catch)

one_reviews_text: First of all you need a facebook account to even use this thing, which is by itself one of the worst issues about this headset. Second, the app is buggy and trash, and not to mention a lot of features on games such as VRchat are not available and requires you to buy a link cable. Another issue is the lenses aren't great and the graphics are very sub par when compared to its PC headset counterparts. Plus there's no motion tracking besides the basic headset and controller tracking. My advice would be to save up and pay for an HTC Vive or a Valve Index. Best thing I can say about this is it runs sub par iphone games

When playing games, the right lens goes dim at random times. I reached out to oculus support and they wanted to send me a refurbished unit. I had just paid $400 a month earlier so getting a refurbished one was not something I was ok with. After requesting a new unit to replace my faulty one, I have not heard anything from them in 2 days. The games are fun, just hope that you do not get a faulty unit as you won't get a new replacement.
review_title: One lens goes darker than the other at random times

one_reviews_text: I bought the previous version of this about 1.5 years ago. I have a severe disability and have to spend most of my time in a recliner. I was unable to set up the floor. I tried a couple of games but could not play them. The game would want me to move my arms down but I could not do that because of the arms of the recliner.It seems this is made to use standing in a large open area. It not made for the disabled.
review_title: Not designed for use in a chair or for people with disabilities.

one_reviews_text: I have a couple of VR headsets (Pimax, Odyssey+) and the Quest 2 is my favorite to use for VR games. I like showing friends and family the Quest 2 because it’s easy to get setup and use.Anyways, we had family over for Christmas and I turn on VR Drunken Bar Fight and let my cousin have at it. She was having a great time but went around the room and almost punched the TV a couple of times so I had to stay behind her to guide her. Long story short, she turned around and clocked me in the face! My face is fine, just a small bruise and scratch but I was surprised the controller was fine! No rattles, no broken plastic bits and it still works! 5/5 would recommend

So I couldn't find a spot to review on oculus website. I didn't purchase this item on Amazon I picked it up at target. It's fun a d the experience is amazing. But what I have learned is the foam on the head sets gives a rash on the face. I looked up and saw other reviews for the same issue. Not once did it say on the box may give skin irritation. I got it yesterday and played for an hour or so and woke up this morning with my face burning and swollen. It eventually got really bad to where I had to see my doctor to get a shot to calm it. After I looked at reviews they recommend a silicon cover for the foam. I notice I do have one that came with the box. It's painful and the $299 isn't worth it when you go threw this. Do your reviews and take the chance if you would like. I'm so glad my kids didn't play on it because it would be terrible for my kids to go threw this. Be careful and if you don't listen then be prepared if you get the same reaction as me. It's not fun anymore.

I got this as a gift, and it's one of the stupidest things you could ever own. You might play around with it for a few hours, just figuring out the mechanics, or going to a "virtual concert" in a chat room, but in very short order, you're just yearning for a normal joystick, or keyboard and mouse. The technology just doesn't seem to be there yet- it feels obvious that we could do so much better, and that we're falling short of the dream. Please don't let me lead you entirely astray, it's fun for like a second, but perhaps just as a gimmicky new technology, it simply doesn't work well enough- it's like if a car could only drive 25 miles before it sputtered out or responded incorrectly to your turning of the steering wheel. Definitely not worth the price overall though- shame on Oprah for pushing this product on me, which is owned by Zuckerberg, and was sold by Bezos. All three of those billionaires can refund my aunt's credit card, please, for the hopeful, but still quite silly product

Well the gaming is fun as long as it works and you don't need assistance. Google "reset unlocking pattern" and you will find many have been locked out of their oculus. Certain apps force you to create a pattern and if you forget it, you will lose all your progress as you will have to reset to factory settings. Of course, the oculus and oculus website will pretend there's a simple solution to resetting your pin. There is not.

DO NOT BUY THIS! At first the technology is very impressive, but after 6 mths starts to get buggy. If you buy a game and it stops working there is nothing you can do. There is no customer support to contact. I have uninstalled, reinstalled many times. Updated, still the game does not work. I bought a new game today hoping for the best. Same problem, get an error message when I try to play.But some of my other games are working fine.If you don't mind spend $25 here and there on games that won't work, then the Oculus is just fine.
review_title: Stops working, no customer support AT ALL

one_reviews_text: this vr system is great yes it has some flaws like first the strap can be discomforting after some time but with some paddijg it makes it better also with people that have a big nose or smaller face the lenses tend to fog up and that will be annoying the speakers are pretty good and it will take some time to get the sweet spot on the lenses so you can see clearly. once you have it it's a great out of this world experience but before you buy read this many people don't talk about how you feel. well the first day using it you may feel kinda off or dizzy that will go away with sleep but after the first thru the 5th day some people will feel like sh*t it can make you get a headache and stomach ache and make you dizzy and delayed all day that just because it is throwing off your equalimbrium once you get used to it you will be fine with no problem but this very cheep and good VR is great and definitely recommend

Great quality. Great games. Completely worth it.A few problems I’d like to address (for other customers, people reading the reviews…):- A lot of people are complaining about a Facebook account being required. You’ll spend hundreds of dollars on a headset, and you complain that you need to create a free account? Just do it, dude.- A while ago, I had an issue where the tracking kept making me redraw the boundary. I saw a comment about this. Simply hard restart (not just turn off) the headset, and it’ll be fixed.- Some people say that it is blurry/low quality. Adjust your headset so it’s tighter on your head and adjust the eye things on the headset (by pushing to the left or right, depending on the positioning of your eyes) and it should be alright. It’s great quality, usually.
review_title: Don’t listen to the one star reviews.

one_reviews_text: Got the Oculus and had to sign up for Facebook. 7 minutes later my account was locked. Oculus support unable to fix it or explain why the account was locked. Can't use the device now. $400 bucks for an Oculus paper weight.It does function admirably as a paper weight, however.

Game play is pretty cool and some of the VR worlds are pretty amazing but all that is shadowed by its need to link with facebook now meta accounts. If the privacy part of that isn't an issue which it wasn't so much for me its the high probability you may get stuck in a login loop as it tries to link your Facebook account to the oculus account. This by the way is not an option it requires it. Definitly Google the Oculus Quest 2 login loop of death. After 4 different tech support failures I was left to the forum world to assist. In the end by the time I got logged in 7 hrs of my life was gone and it just left an Intial bad taste that none of the VR features simply dissolved.

Got the Quest 2 for my son. Got all the bells and whistles, including the different mask sizes, the extended battery, protective case, etc. worked great for the first couple of months then froze. Returned it after researching and finding that this was a known issue.  Waited about four months for FB to send a refurbished unit. That one worked for less than a month before the fan went out and it stopped working. Returned it again and here I am thirteen months into ownership with only three months of functional unit time. Got an email a few weeks ago saying that they are sending the replacement unit. Still waiting and not holding my breath. I guess rushing to make the cheapest VR headset means cutting some corners. Not worth it, to say nothing of letting FB into your home to photograph your children.
Both kids want it, but unfortunately don't and will not have facebook accounts.

It's unfortunate I have to write this because we loved (note past tense) this headset. The left control stick began to drift and I made a request for replacement through Oculus. After a couple of weeks of back and forth with them claiming how difficult the mailing process is, they ignored me. I am now left with a headset that is unplayable due to a common issue. Purchase at your own risk, as Oculus will not honor their warranty.
Purchasing the product supports Zuckerberg's goals of own a monopoly on  the future of VR, DO NOT BUY

That's all you need to know about this is that you have to have Zuckerberg's mark  on your wrist in order to play.. meaning you have to have a  stinky Facebook account  or you can't use the device. Disgusting. Facebook is vile, intrusive and one of the big reasons society has so many problems.
review_title: Facebook Acct required and that is 100% a deal breaker.

one_reviews_text: Honestly, I bought my Quest 2 off of a limb, I wanted the PS5 but at the time it was hard to acquire so I ended up impulse buying a Quest 2, I do not regret it one bit! I think one thing that I overlooked was that you have to try to fit the glasses in the Quest 2, which is difficult for me because I wear a large frame, or wear contacts. Initially, I used contact lenses to see while using the Quest 2 but after a while it bothered me that I always had to put my contacts on every time I wanted to play because I don't like wearing contacts. One day I was doing some google searches for an alternative and VR WAVE was there to answer my questions! I sent in my prescription for VR WAVE lenses and I have been playing nonstop since! They give you a whole kit to test the blue light through the lenses they send, a card with your prescription on it so you know its your pair, a case for safe traveling, and lens cleaners. They were as much as regular glasses and I don't regret the purchase.
review_title: Quest 2 with VR WAVE lenses are OP

one_reviews_text: i collect vr headsets, and might i say. this headset is by far the worst one i have used.its super uncomfortable, pressing onto my face,its laggy,its slow,everything has baked lighting.oh did i forget to mention the wonderful ads that was blessed onto us?the sde is unbearable.the fov is absolutely tinyits controllers are not ergonomic at allthe sound is lacking.. on EVERYTHING!lacking on bass, mids sound supper muddyhighs are almost non existent.the battery life is horrible.overall i rate this headset a 0/10i will gladly stick to other companies over this, i only bought this for game development, and oh my gosh is it the worst thing i have ever used. oculus, please please do better and make actual quality devices, thank you!
review_title: Worst Headset I Have Ever Used

one_reviews_text: The family Really liked using it at first. I was a bit confused about why it needed a FB account but whatever. Then my FB account was hacked and the device was locked. It wouldn’t let us use it anymore. The only tech support available was via chat and completely unable to sort the situation out because once the oculus is attached your FB account it can’t be used under another one.My recommendation is to just get a different brand unattached to facebook.

Pros:*This is for gamersCons:*Not intuitive.*Get Your credit card out.  Sure you brought it, but you're gonna pay to play the games.*The hype is better than the unit.*$300 bucks PLUS you gotta pay for the games!  No Thank You!*Watch movies?!  Just pull your chair closer to your TV & you'll get better sound & video.*Wadda waste!  Wish I could return it.

Oculus Quest 2 stopped working and can only flash the connection lost at intro screen. It’s been a week and the customer service just keeps you jumping through hopes everyday with little to no effort to repair a faulty product. You would think they would be better at this point with customer satisfaction but everytime I do what they ask and it fails the come up with more things to try, really video record the problem by looking into the eye port so they can verify the same thing day after day. Why? Most likely won’t get anything else from Facebook after this.

I see a lot of people complaining about not being able to play all the VR games out there. Well you can. Add a VR capable PC and plug in and play. There are also a few apps out there you can put on your PC or Android phone, hook up the link cable, create a free oculus developer account, enable developer mode on oculus headset and play 10000s of games.
review_title: Does the oculus store and so much more

one_reviews_text: Owned by Facebook, traitors to USA. Elitist who will use your data against you.

I bought the oculus quest 2 so excited and when I got it, it was the best thing ever really it was. For 2 whole weeks, I loved the thing, the content, the structure of it, it was all great and then it started crashing, then it started kicking me out of games, then it started not letting me start the games. After about a week I contacted oculus support, they are absolutely horrible. They take forever to respond. I finally got someone to start a replacement order. He send he started the replacement order on Jan 26. and I didn’t get another email until Feb 4. and get this there still processing the replacement request. So to sum it up, I wouldn’t say don’t buy a Oculus if you really want one, but just consider the risk of getting one like mine and knowing that it will be a long long ride trying to get a new one

This device is useless unless you sign in with a Facebook account and agree to let Zuck and his minions monitor everything you do and siphon off all the data. Meta is not content with making billions they must control every aspect of your reality to turn you into the ultimate customer, I mean servant, I mean cash cow.
Thought this would be a good product, but it isn't. Forces you to create a FB account to use it is already a bad sign. The unit is cheap and breaks easily.

My right controller mysteriously stopped working after about a month or so. I did some research and found out that this happens to nearly every headset at some point, its a factory defect. This would be fine if Faceboo...Meta had replacements, which they don't, or a system in place to enable repairs in less than a month. When I called they literally told me "we'll get back to you in a week" lol. In many cases tech support appears to not even be calling or messaging people back. I can't use my headset, its an expensive paperweight. Sure, its cheap but be warned, this is almost guaranteed to be waste of money.
review_title: You're right controller will stop working, and it will take a month to get a new one

one_reviews_text: Facebook is the still one of the biggest social networks in the world. Second Facebook is creating immersive environments such as horizon work rooms and a meta verse that will expand build on a big social infrastructure already.  The oculus has been here for years but now it can really breakout on a social platform with multi millions is unimaginative.

Controller drifting upon receipt. Support group two months later says their department is looking for a replacement controller after saying they would send me one when they receive mine. Can’t play without. They also won’t respond when I ask about just sending mine back when I should have returned it fully.
I bought this for my husband for his birthday  he tried several times but everytime made him dizzy and we ended up returning it .Don't buy it.

I will admit - this was a spontaneous purchase influenced by MZ when I saw him use it in a VR meeting with his team, and JF on his show playing Beat Saber. I closed my eyes and hit "Submit" and opened my eyes and like what I saw...the box, when it was delivered. I finally opened it last night and I am in love :)

I would 100 percent give this 5 stars. My son uses it daily. But with use comes needing replacement parts. It's impossible to get new controllers unless you are willing to pay 200 dollars to a scalper on Amazon. Its basically unusable at this point and I refuse to invest any more money in a product that is poorly built

First off the image is NOT completely clear....images are still tiny bit blurry....A new technology should also protect our precious eyes...NOT damaging it...just after a few minutes of use I noticed a slight headache...Eye strain is THE MOST important issue with VR that needs to be solved.second of all, oculus gets foggy..i have to clean the inside constantly so I can see clearly.Thirdly..it weighs a lot on the head...it does not feel comfortable on face. it should not feel so heavy on the head.And lastly, a few free games would be nice..without creating these annoying accounts and paying for some sample games....I was NOT able to enjoy one single game....
It works great while it works, but even under normal indoor use, it breaks up easily and really unreliable device. Customer support is bad and unsupportive. Do not buy.

It is sitting after a few days. There is a very limited game selection. The highest rated game is boring after an hour. Just save your money and get something that is more supported by developers. My opinion.Update: I just saw the charger and was wondering if we had left the Oculus at the neighbors, three days ago!  Yeah, the device is just very limited IMO.

Had it for a year or so and tracking completely went out and stopped working i have had many many games installed and invested tons of money into accessories and fixing stupud issues that shouldnt have ever been just to have more errors and eventually no tracking what so ever worst vr headset ive ever used period never again will i buy a product from meta. Also simce meta wants a closed ecosystem anything you buy on that headset or even through oculus on pc you cant ever use on a different headset so if it breaks your trapped into buying another meta product save your hassle and buy a actual good headset for pc vr meta sucks
review_title: Constant issues and errors, horrible headset

one_reviews_text: I bought this on black Friday for my sons birthday. I received this and it doesn't work. I have spent a lot of time with tech support with no help. They ask for a video and won't accept of video of proof that it's broken. They tried to help me factory reset my brand new oculus and it never worked. Very poor. I asked them to send out a new one and I would send it back but they need proof with a video that can't be sent.

While the quality and setup is great, no need for wires or pc connection. Drawback is the oculus store is not the same as pc since only quest 2 products are supported. Thus, only a few amount of games will transfer over, otherwise you may have to buy the same game twice.
review_title: Excellent quality but read for more

one_reviews_text: I bought this after my vive had been broken for years and I wish I had done sooner. I've had it for two weeks and I can hardly put it down. Airlink for pcvr games works amazingly well with no latency issues to be noticed (on a 5ghz network of course, dont expect wireless pcvr to work well with average wifi.)All in all it's amazing, but I had to give it 4 stars for the horrible IPD fitting and extremely narrow fov. I get a lot of eye strain reading text and it feels like I'm looking through scuba goggles. Ultimately these are very minor problems I have with the device. For this price point it simply cant be beaten
review_title: Completely unbeatable VR experience for this price range

one_reviews_text: This thing is great!  My 13 year old son got in for Christmas, and is still playing it daily.  He plays with his friends, who are starting to buy it!  It’s fun for adults too, I love doing virtual trips around the world!  The best thing, my 13 year old son has lost 15 lbs in 3 months without even knowing it!  He plays this vs X Box.  He can’t feed his face or drink while he is playing it, and he is active when he plays it!  I have a very active son with sports 5 days a week, but unfortunately he was not blessed with a good metabolism.  Great product for kids and adults!  They even have some great exercise programs!

Spend the money on a new age console instead. The simple fact that you need a Facebook account to even play games on it is ridiculous. I constantly would get headaches playing on it, no matter how I adjusted it on my head, even for 15 minutes of playing a game was painful. As soon as I took it off I felt better. I returned mine and got a PS5. Have zero regrets!
review_title: A console is better money spent

one_reviews_text: Very buggy, painfully heavy. As usual, Facebook focuses on flashy features but doesn't bother to get it right. This particular failure may send you to your chiropractor.Overall, a truly lousy system. Somehow they managed to do an even worse job with this than with the Rift.

I purchased 3 Oculus quest devices for my 3 children as an Xmas gift.  You can only app share between 2 of the 3 devices.  When I contacted support, they point to the FAQ where you can add 3 accounts.  I read this before I purchased but this is highly misleading.  You can add 3 accounts to device #1 or device #2.  You cannot add any accounts to device #3, without disabling app sharing on device #2.
