It was really fun for 10 weeks. Then the left controller stopped working. It took 6 weeks to convince the manufacturer to replace it. Then I loved it for another 3 weeks. Now the right controller went bad. Not messing with it anymore. I will wait a few years until the technologyimproves.
Facectap forces you to sign up for the crappy platform. You can not use the device unless you do or it is extremely limited. Enough said

It’s fun and good at first but after 2 months I noticed that there’s dead pixels, terrible tracking. Bad battery life, and a bad strap. I get headaches after playing for 1 hour. Speaking of using it for 1 hour that’s how long it lasts after a bit of using it. The controllers are good are comfortable. The strap and tracking are the worst. Also it gets very blurry sometimes. They need to work on things that will help the oculus rather than add things that make it “cooler”.

The hardware for the quest 2 is great. However, everything about the experience is ruined by the complete ineptitude of the software developers. Doing anything with the headset is an enormous pain due to the buggy, poorly thought out, and often inexplicably complicated interface. Even something as simple as changing a password requires a complete factory reset of the headset. I would recommend literally any other vr developer.
review_title: The hardware is great. The software, not so much

one_reviews_text: This thing is great! Coolest thing in video games

I have two of these for my kids.  The games are fun and some really get your kids a workout!  My only complaint is you have to have a Facebook account to use this.  My favorite game is a mini golf game that you can play with friends remotely.  So much fun!

I had NEVER experienced VR before. None! I pre-ordered it on a hunch. I was not prepared for what I experienced! It was incredible! Highly recommended. If you have played VR on the PS or somewhere else then you'll know what to expect. But it is still pretty remarkable! Lots of PSVR players have bought the Quest 2 and are very happy. it's a standalone experience, if you use the headset unattached as I do.
review_title: Great product for great price! If you're new to VR, it will BLOW your mind! I've seen it happen.

one_reviews_text: This product is fantastic value.I really was torn between this and an hp reverb g2, especially since I only use pcvr, but the poor reviews of the reverb pushed me away. This has great tracking and the pc link works very well. If you only play simulators i would recommend the reverb for the resolution, but not if you play games that need good hand tracking. The only weak spot, other than needing a stupid FB account, is the god awful headstrap. I would recommend the HTC vive deluxe strap. It's great. Needing FB knocks a star off.
Its a fun product but sometimes it will glitch out. Blackscreen glitch or setting up guardian glitches what ive experienced. dont let this stop you from getting this product.

I bought this as a gift so I haven't played it. He said "this is the best gift ever". I was worried about being able to get games for VR headset, but he said it was very easy. You buy and download the games from the app and uploading them directly to the headset. Another good benefit was that people can watch you play from a phone. They are very happy with the VR.

Customer service is garbage. They do not respond on time. They make it difficult to return the product. They will have your product for weeks before acknowledging receipt. The will not send back all the components you send them even if they asked for them. The product was fun while it lasted, but even of I get replacement controllers, odds are they will fail again since my last 2 also failed within weeks of each other. Out of warranty you should expect to pay almost half the cost of a new Oculus to replace them.

This VR headset is low resolution, it commonly has white and black flashing lights in transitions between games, so do not use this if you have epilepsy, This headset will damage your vision especially is you use it for prolonged times. This can only be used online. I don't recommend.

I bought the original quest and two years later replacement controllers are no longer in production. I am just guessing, but I am certain the same thing will happen with this headset. I would stay away unless you want to half the price of a new headset on a single controller in a couple years. Its absolutely pathetic that one of the wealthiest corporations in the world can't provide replacement parts. Shame on them.

Not only does FB steal your data using this, but someone used my stolen CC infoto buy this directly from Oculus.  If the vendor doesn't value security to buy this,think what it will do when you use this.  All VR and AI is evil.  Develop your self andbeing the natural way with God and Angels.  More power there.
review_title: Not secure - Someone stole CC Info to buy

one_reviews_text: The Quest is REALLY good compared to other headsets, but the new updates are KILLING me!So first of all, the quest increased the storage for FREE! And I really need that. Now you get 128GB for the same price! Yes that’s awesome, but it always wasn’t like that… I wonder why….Second, the new AirLink is Very bad, and I thought I got scammed when I bought virtual desktop and new airlink for free came out here’s my opinion:Buy virtual desktop for steam gamesUser airlink for oculus and other games becuase virtual desktop doesn’t work with all games.
review_title: Quest 2 UPDATES suck for older users..

one_reviews_text: Grandson still playing with it 2 months after Christmas. he is having a good time
review_title: Grandson still playing with it 2 months after Christmas

one_reviews_text: Got this for my sons 8th birthday and he absolutely loved it and so did I! Only one thing, he got a really bad rash from the head set so he has to wear a bandanna now while using it.

Headset is awesome, and the wireless experience is truly unbeatable but this headset is INCREDIBLY uncomfortable. The headset essentially has a miniature console plus screen attached to the front of it, only way to offset the weight is to strap and tighten it around your head with 50,000,000 newtons of force. The elite strap is a NECESSITY, but even then it does not get rid of all of the pain.

Even though the photos show a complete set it may be is is not. Read closely and query the vender. I was looking for the link I used to find indicating a product was misrepresented, I could not find it. When did that go away??

 Purchased during a special for Christmas and it was a hit!! Lots of fun! I recommend you purchase the extra strap for the back. Have fun.
Facebook sucks huge roosters !

I've Ordered My Quest 2 A Couple Months It Was Extremely Good Until I Ran I Into A Problem.A Couple Of Weeks After I ordered it I turned it off and when I turned it back on it didn't turn on,I managed to fix it by re-assembling my quest 2 and it turned on but here is the actual problem.Because I Factory Reset It Before it was on the starting screen but my controllers didn't get recognized,I've tried everything changing batteries that were 1.5v,tried using the app etc. i would've given this 5 stars if it had a fix but it doesn't.

Because of your language, I panicked and went to the Oculus web site and ordered and left and right controller, and now I find out that Headset Only doesn't mean Headset Only at all.  It means Headset AND Controllers.  Thanks a lot, guys.
review_title: Headset Only needs to say Headset And Controllers!

one_reviews_text: Headset is a little heavy, but worth it. Lots of good content and lots of fun working out and playing games. I  bought it for my husband, as a gift, and we were on it for hours learning new things to do. Being new to oculus, we thoroughly enjoy it.

The facebook account is a pain, particularly if you do not want it!  Trying to startup and connect the Oculus  2 to FB once your account has been locked out Because of an error , is more than frustrating!  Further more, when your iphone does not receive the verification code, you are stuck with no place to go!  The Oculus quest is definitely a great head set and deserves a good rating.  Facebook requirement is not!  If issue is not resolved quickly, the unit will be returned!
I had to return this and it was bought as a gift, because the person doesn’t have Facebook and you need Facebook in order to use it to its full capacity . It sucks
This was purchased as a Christmas gift.  It was great to see the kids having so much fun with it.It was good to see young and old using this. Lots of fun.
Facebook exists to shove ads in your face. Don't support them.

This is legit amazing. I have dropped it, punched, and broke drywall, and it's an amazing product. Facebook is not a problem. It takes 3 minutes to get that set up and connected. The games are good, and no noticeable screen-door effect. Get it. Its worth it
review_title: So what its Facebook, you already own a phone.

one_reviews_text: Got here on time. Super fun. Don't much like face book but I'm on there anyways. Worth the money. The games average around $20.00 a piece. The best at 40 bucks. Great family fun. If they would only allow another machine to share ownership of game so we don't have to buy the games again for another head unit.
review_title: Having fun out of tha sun

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my son and daughter to share...you have to create a Facebook account in order to use it.that's VERY VERY disappointing as I don't believe children should have Facebook
review_title: You have to make a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest 2 was a big hit for Christmas the grandkids. The boys are only 6 but with help they caught on fast. There has to be adult supervision for setup and instructions. But, most of all, there needs to be strict rules on using them. Kids get pretty excited and need to handle this product with care. Read the small instruction book for all precautions.
this is the second time my wife has bought me a VR headset but this one actually works. I only have one complaint its a bit hard to get into focus.

This is a great product and insanely fun. I have always played Xbox growing up and in my opinion this is the new way of gaming. This product literally makes you feel like you are in the game instead of seeing it on a TV or monitor. My only bad thing with this product is that you have to give your head and eyes time to get use to it. for the first few days my eyes felt heavy and I had a slight headache but as days went on I was able to adjust to it.
Doesn't specify that you NEED a Facebook account, and that if they deactivate your account your $300 device is a paperweight.
review_title: Can't use it without a Facebook account

one_reviews_text: Almost made me jump off a tall ass building but besides that it’s cool

The occulus is an awesome machine and plays well and fits alright and really should be a great purchase. Except if you EVER have an account, billing, or game issue the company will do absolutely nothing to help you. I'm out almost 200 bucks because of it and will never give Occulus another dollar. Make sure you pick a company that actually cares about customer needs, cause Occulus sure won't.
review_title: Got an Issue? OH WELL Too bad.

one_reviews_text: Hate that my kids are REQUIRED to have a Facebook account to use this gaming system.Additionally, one of my son’s hand controllers stopped working and we have spent the last month getting the run around from customer service. There is NO WAY to reach them so they DO NOT honor their warranty. They just keep saying they are working on it. Horrible experience for an expensive system.

Parents, be aware. These are being used to traffic humans. The kids talk "live" to someone, thinking it's someone their age. A 23 year-old man coerced a 13 year old girl to meet him, took her out of state, and they found her in the back of a semi-truck in Utah. Please watch over your children!

Product was awesome, until left lense quit working, my son got this for his birthday at the end of January, it quit working in February. Put in for repair, was told by oculus that they would fix it, but their logistics team was having issues and they would get me a label, but now it's April and still no word when I'll get I'm fix or label. Great product but no fix if it breaks.
I bought this for my nephew a year ago, and it still works.  Unusual for electronics.  I have had to buy 4 cables for it though.

During the setup it NEVER asked us to create a password or pin.  You meet a pin to purchase games.  Ypu need a password ro reset the pin.  You need a password reset link to reset password.  Password email link DOES NOT work.JUNK.
review_title: Password amd Pin setup/reset is a mightmare

one_reviews_text: Listen this product is great, don’t get me wrong. Just imagine investing in the companies that make this product. it’s only the beginning of the future. Buy $META stock and thank yourself in 10 years! Not financial advice
review_title: Buy META STOCK NOT THE PRODUCT

one_reviews_text: Be ready to be asked 20 different redundant troubleshooting methods and for them to prolong you getting a controller replacement as much as possible.Strategic to be honest, I see the controller is $70 on their website and doesn't take a very long time to receive.All about bleeding u$
review_title: Super annoying warranty run around script

one_reviews_text: This isn’t for everyone as for me I’ve gotten extreme motion sickness and migraines, even when i’m not playing a game. I’ve tried other VR headsets before and never got motion sickness. It only happened on this one. Overall its still a good VR but be cautious when buying.
Only buy this VR headset If you have a pc to hook it up too and if you dont mind facebook. The base model and its shop is barebones nothing amazing in it. The good games are on steam

I love this and use it just about every day!Simulator bundle pack is the most genius idea ever. Wander is so cool. Epic roller coasters is so fun and the motion sickness dot is perfect. TOTALLY RECOMMEND!!!Completely worth it. Only one thing that bugs me, that the apps cost money I wish they were free. :( Thats it though
I would no more open a Facebook account than I would eat whale meat. I have scruples.
review_title: The Facebook requirement kills it for me. Darn.

one_reviews_text: I like everything about it... Hell lost my headset in house ..it has a tracking device to help u find it... Games are definitely worth it.. it's alot to learn but once u in.... Game on.

I purchased the oculus quest 2 system from amazon and have pretty much enjoyed it. Last month, my right controller stopped pairing with the headset. I contacted oculus support and they asked for the serial numbers, which I provided. I also provided proof of purchase from amazon. They say that the serial numbers cannot be found in their system and so are stalling on replacing the controller.
review_title: Right Controller stopped working and Oculus is stalling on replacement

one_reviews_text: Someone said it will banned you. If someone complain. You will lost all buy games! No refund!!!
We would purchase this item if it wasn't  connected to Facebook
Oculus “Meta” “Facebook” does not allow for the use of this device for someone under the age of 13.
Enjoying the active games a lot. Thrill of the Fight, Golf +, and Eleven Table Tennis.  I upgraded the strap and added battery pack to compensate for short battery life.
Great VR,But after having to uninstall and reinstall, ALL my games show up in the library but will not load.......
It super sharp, i play mostly games, but at times watch netflix as well, love it.

We got one in July. It’s fun to use at first but the kids haven’t touched it in over two months. And if the kids aren’t into it, well… draw your own conclusions. Meanwhile they can’t get enough of the Xbox and other games.

some annoyances when setting the dang thing up but overall the product is A-ok. Only thing i find stupid is the fact you have to pay an additional 20 buck to have you desktop run on it fine (the virtual desktop app is not free, how nice) and sadly there are still not too many VR games worth while yet. Fun to mess around with for abit for now though.
review_title: Lil rough around the edges, but its been fun so far

one_reviews_text: That you are forced into a Facebook account. Shameful corporate behavior.
review_title: Facebook account required. If you value your online privacy, stay away!

one_reviews_text: Desired and enjoyed while a good experience in gaming and value for money;)

the high resolution screen it the only good thing about this headset. light bleed is bad, LCD glow is bad, audio is a joke, the sweet spot is very small so even though it is hi res it was often blurry. I sold mine.
Value was great. Quality is perfect. He loves them so very much
Love playing ping pong and boxing on my quest 2. Love that it’s all in one package.

I received product and the lenses were foggy. So when I tried to exchange it I was told I have to return it then buy it again. So now I have to wait until they process the return so I can order another one.
review_title: DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON - Defective no exchanges only return option!

one_reviews_text: I was just about to get this but wanted to see what kind of games they have in their library.  That is where I found out that you have to pay for those games and they are not cheap.  They don't say anything about that in the description.
The system is great and all but I have run into many issues, the sound has gone out for a while. The right controller not connecting. It is hard to set up and after a while it gets boring

As long as you’re not a over analytical tech nerd (no offense) you’re going to love this thing. Anybody from kids to grown adults. It’s an absolutely vivid and immersive experience. After reading so many FB comments *I barely go on FB* I convinced myself I would never be able to figure out how to get it to work when it arrives. Doom, Gloom and a lot of Zoom - if I couldn't figure this out by myself I was out a lot of money! By the way, has anyone else notice the huge price comarison of the Quest? Anywhere from $299 - $699 for the same Oculus Quest 2? Anyway, jus sayin...Today - It finally arrived and boy was I terrified opening the box. I stared, should I send it back - can I do this... well, a long time later I did it, I tore the plastic and out came my Oculus Quest 2 with two cool controllers.Within 15 minutes I was hooked up to WiFi, FB and playing tennis. I got tired and did meditation for 10 minutes just floating in space. The realty is - its plain awesome! It looked so real that I found myself suddenly afraid of heights!  Then it was time to charge the quest - which took around 2 hours.Yes, it was that easy!!! I love it! So, lesson to everyone - if I can do it all by MYSELF you can too - because you are awesome! Especially if you reading my review. Thanks!A quick note: You have the option to move the eye piece to make you vision clearer.  The eye piece does not rotate. You must take your thumbs and slide right or left.

one_reviews_text: There will always be VR "enthusiasts" with boatloads of money that brag about their bleeding-edge VR headsets (like the Valve Index, which is over 3 times more expensive than this headset, AND requires a gaming-quality PC to boot). But, in terms of value, there is absolutely nothing better on the market than this headset.Even the previous 64GB iteration (for the same price) was still great value, so this updated version (which also addresses the facial irritations caused by the old face pads) is a no brainer. If you have even a HINT of curiosity about getting into the VR world, this is THE headset to get! You won't be disappointed!(Side Note: The "mandatory" Facebook integration, while a negative to some, is actually a good quality "appstore" interface, that's quite easy to log into and use with your existing Facebook account. Any digital storefront in the world requires some sort of "account," but letting me use my own Facebook actually simplifies the process even further.)
review_title: The best VR headset just keeps getting better!

one_reviews_text: Honestly, the best thing about this sort of VR is that there's no wires to deal with. Turn on, sign in with Facebook, and done.  Also, Beat Saber is pretty much the greatest thing ever. Just...yeah... Beat Saber is life.I know there's something to be said for ohnoes!, - Facebook has more data! Honestly, if they want to see me flail around in Beat Saber, knock yourself out, Facebook.I did pick up the Elite headband/battery/case, and that finishes off the package, but it's by no means necessary - just nice to have. Overall, loving this thing. Yes, the resolution could still be (a lot) better, but for convenience and fun - this is where it's at. We've come a long way from the PSVR days and the crazy setup process and cabling.Excellent stuff, - and great value in its new 128GB configuration. 4.5 out of 5.

More immersive sound and reactive responsiveness. Picture quality also much closer to high end.One star off for not making it abundantly clear that games from prior unit could not be retrieved directly from my already used by me Oculus account. It appears that you must upload to a PC first, then download to the Oculus 2. A direct from account download would have made so much more sense but likely would have raised the price point of $299 definitely the sweet spot for this unit.I truly could not decide if I should buy this (They double storage and kept it same price as it was during first release of the Quest-2.). For those who have asked if we're aware that the price for these units  runs from $299 on PRIME to  $699 (from some individual sellers), here's the deal. Originally released at $299 with 64GB storage. Then units were discontinued due to issue with head straps. Oculus team reworked the head straps but the units weren't available for awhile. So those who purchased them decided they would sell their remaining units for more than twice the Prime price w/o the extra storage. A lot of disgruntled users who apparently didn't stay current on the Oculus news of this item paid the $699 because they didn't realize same unit with more storage was being released by PRIME for the original $299. Oh well.
review_title: Significantly better than the Oculus Go that preceded it

one_reviews_text: Amazing quality image, fluid response, truly a mind blowing experience. Super fast delivery too. So all good on the quality and supplier.BUT! Facebook locked my 16 year history account just days after registering my oculus quest 2, and I have no way of clearing this with facebook as no channels in place for this. Check Reddit - many many people in same position. I now have a useless $300 Oculus Quest 2 and wasted 100's of $$ on apps that I no longer have access to. TOTALLY RECOMMEND NOT TO BUY THIS PRODUCT until Oculus stops the need to associate a facebook account.
review_title: Absolutely blown away - but DO NOT BUY IT until Facebook stopped accidentally banning accounts

one_reviews_text: I have always loved the idea of VR and I have tried it a handful of times through store kiosks and local arcades that have them. But I was never able to actually own one myself because I never had a PC powerful enough nor the room space to be able to use it effectively. But I recently got a new apartment that is huge and I finally scrapped the extra money together to buy the quest 2 and I have nothing but good things to say about it. I love that it does not require any cables to be able to use it when it is charged so the freedom inside the games feels even more immersive. I also love the picture quality, I was nervous at first seeing as how it is not using a PC to be it's graphical power source but I was wrong, it is gorgeous and I literally feel like I am in another world. I will also say for anyone concerned (I didn't give a crap at all btw), it was just announced yesterday that a Facebook account is no longer required to use this device, so if that was a deal breaker for you then you're in luck! So far I have played Superhot, VR-Chat, Arizona Sunshine, and Vader Immortal and they were all breathtaking experiences and I was in my glory the entire time. The controllers are super accurate and feel great to hold, every button is perfectly positioned on the controllers. I also found that the 128gb model is plenty of storage for how small most of the games are install size wise so I feel there is no need to spend an extra $100 on unneeded storage. One thing that may be an issue for some is the head-strap built onto the headset itself. I had heard from a few people that the (sold separately) strap extension is a MUST for people with even remotely bigger heads, I find as someone with a big head that the default head-strap is completely fine for me. Luckily I opted to take a risk and not buy the separate strap extension because it would have been a waste of money for me. You may want it if you wear glasses though which I do not. But, obviously no device is perfect so I will say what I do not like is how short the battery life is but I suppose it is a good thing because it forces you to give your eyes a break so it is what it is. All and all, I would highly recommend this device to everyone. It is amazing.

This is the virtual reality device I have been dreaming of since the mid 90s. I am primarily a PC gamer, so I wanted something that would work with my PC, and I was not all that interested in the standalone functionality. I was amazed at the quality of the standalone quest 2 games. The virtual environments are much more convincing than I expected. It really feels like you are IN these games. The controllers do a great job of mimicking real life hand use, and the haptic feedback can make it feel like you are actually touching/pressing things (example:  saving your game in Resident Evil 4 VR really feels like you are typing on an old mechanical typewriter). The first time I took the headset off, I had to spend several seconds processing the fact that my living room was indeed real. You can also use this to watch shows and movies, and even meet up with people this way. I delayed buying one for years because I was worried I would regret it, but instead it's better than I dared to hope.

Very pleased with the Quest 2 as a replacement for my Rift S. I primarily play DCS and MSFS and this headset works great. I purchased the Oculus link cable and with some tweaking I’m seeing excellent results. The clarity is significantly better than the Rift S although not as clear as the HP Reverb G2. But the ability to use a single cable for PC gaming and then go completely wireless for other games is awesome. The headstrap is sufficient and I didn’t feel like the headset was going to fly off my head. But I opted for the Elite headstrap for added comfort. This thing is incredibly comfortable for extended use. The adjustable IPD is fantastic and there seems to be a pretty large sweet spot.I have only two complaints. One is that there is a slight gap around your nose so you can see light. This is actually beneficial in DCS where you still need keyboard commands but it can be annoying. Secondly is that even while using the Link cable, your battery will die after about 1.5-2 hours. I have mine hooked up to the motherboard of my PC (Asus Rog Strix x570-e) and it doesn’t charge while gaming. That’s a bummer but you’re pushing a lot of data through that cable anyways.Overall I’m happy with the Quest 2. Going from a display port cable to a single USB-C was a big concern for me. But I still get excellent FPS. I can actually read cockpit instruments and labels without putting my face 2” from them like with the Rift S. This isn’t the best VR out there but for the price it’s hard to beat.
review_title: Battery doesn’t charge when using Oculus Link

It came fully charged and ready to use. Took me a few minutes for the software update and the setup but after that everything was easy and simple. one_reviews_text: This is a total blast.  It's a good quality unit and I have no real issues with it.  It's so nice to not be tethered to anything.  That's a huge feature in my opinion.  Makes it completely portable.  The sound that comes out of it is actually better than I was expecting.  I've also plugged in earbuds when I need to for extra isolation and better bass.  It now comes with a silicone cover for the foam face cushion which is great since I guarantee you will get a bit sweaty wearing it over long periods so it's easy to wipe down.  I also bought (and highly recommend) getting their fancy headgear that has the extra battery built-in.  We play for a lot longer than I anticipated so doubling the battery life was well worth it.  I also got a chromecast to stream it to a tv which makes it fun to watch someone do it.

I just got it today, it finally arrived. My first VR headset.overall it looks fantastic, the storage size was reasonable too. So Here goes :Pros :- It's cheaper than other VR I know about- It's pretty light- easy to setup- portable, you don't need a base or camera for it. It's already built in on the headsetCons :- You can easily got motion sickness if you not used to VR- Battery life is super short, like about 2 hours- It's pretty uncomfortable for people with glasses- absolutely need FB ACCOUNT << I literally need to make FB account for thisIt's all good for me, till I got motion sickness and vomiting my entire guts and almost destroying my bath sink. But well, NO REGRET! 8 out 10 will play VR again(For likely just 2 hrs cuz the Battery sucks).
review_title: Good VR with reasonable price, but come with downside.

one_reviews_text: I've wanted a VR setup for years, but was intimidated by the hardware requirements and the hefty entry cost. Enter the Oculus Quest 2, which delivers great quality standalone VR experiences at a fraction of the cost of other VR headsets (which also require you to have a high-end gaming computer). I've enjoyed every moment with this device and will continue to do so, no doubt about it.IPD being locked to three settings is definitely an issue that I can understand other reviewers being upset about. I lucked out by having my IPD exactly match the 3rd setting (68 mm). Make sure that your IPD is within the Quest 2's provided range before purchasing.To all of the people that are freaking out about needing a Facebook account in order to use this headset, there's a very easy solution: Create a Facebook account under a fake name using a junk email address (of which you should already have several). Use that Facebook account with the Quest 2. Done.

I bought this as part of my New Years resolution to move more and get into better shape, and it has certainly made it easy to reach my goals.As a woman closing in on my sixth decade, I don't feel comfortable going to a gym, so I needed something to keep me motivated at home.While the documentation that came with the Quest was sparse to the point I had to go to you-tube to figure out how to set it up, once I had it configured it was fun and easy to use.I need reading glasses, but found that I can use the headset without wearing them, and still get crisp visuals.I've been sticking to rhythm games like Beatsaber, Synth Riders, and OH-Shape to start with, since I do not want to commit to a subscription service that charges a monthly fee, and it has been easy to spend hours moving without realizing how much time has passed.Very happy with my purchase.

I have been buying console games since my daughter was 5, she's 32 now. I brought this for my granddaughter for Christmas and I had to try it. I go back to the days of the arcade and putting hundreds in quarters in the machines and the advent of Atari. I'm 65 now and in spite of my opinion of Mr FACEBOOK (Zuckerberg), the metaverse is coming and it reminds me of my excitement when I was waiting for "The information highway"😏 This was a name that they called the "Internet" before it came to be. VR is going to be the next "big thing". The graphics will improve, the interface will be better and in twenty years, who knows what it's potential will be. I played Pong on Atari and was fascinated and just because I'm 65, doesn't mean that I have to lose my enthusiasm for science and the marvels of it's creations. I am going to buy a Oculus for myself and I will be seeing Mr FACEBOOK in the metaverse 👍
review_title: Brought it for granddaughter, now I want one 😁

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 is the best thing to happen to VR gaming. It finally makes the hardware accessible for the average gamer.  No base stations, no high end gaming computers (unless you want), amazingly easy to use, and a selection of VR titles to satisfy any gamer.It is highly recommended that the strap that comes with the device be replaced with something that offers more rigidity.  This will improve your comfort and user experience quite a bit.  The device has about a 2 hour battery life, so a strap with a battery toward the rear will provide dual benefits.  The extra weight of the battery also helps counterbalance the front heaviness of the device.The two controllers each run on one AA battery which last a surprisingly long time, but I'd still recommend a battery pack for controllers or rechargeable batteries.Most people also find that replacing the foam facial interface with something third party increases comfort and blocks out the little bit of light that leaks in around the nose.There is a huge third party accessory market, so find customization options on Amazon is a breeze.Pair this guy with a capable gaming laptop and there are some very nice AAA games out for VR like Half Life, Fallout, Walking Dead, and a whole library of games available on steam.Great fun for the whole family, and not a cost prohibitive price for entry.  If you're on the fence, just do it.
review_title: Entry level VR for the masses.

one_reviews_text: This VR headset is amazing, it is by far the best VR you can buy for the money! The build quality is very nice and solid, and the unit feels like it's high quality materials.Screen: The screen on the Oculus quest 2 is very nice and clear, it has a resolution of 1,832 by 1,900 per eye. It also has a 90Hz refresh rate.Quality: The unit itself is very well constructed and doesn't feel cheap at all. It has a nice weight to it, but is not so heavy as to feel clunky on the head. The controllers are built well and feel nice in the hands, they don't feel cheap and plastic like.Operating system: The Oculus quest 2 uses a Qualcomm 865 processor XR2 variant and it runs very smooth. I have not had any performance issues so far and the unit has not shown any signs of slow down or throttling.Apps and games: The Oculus quest 2 has a decent amount of content, they have quite a few games that are a lot of fun and they also have streaming apps so you can watch your favorite shows and movies on the headset in VR. I Love the rollercoaster game and the Star wars: Darth Vader game is worth the price alone.Overall, this is a worthy VR headset. It is at a great price point, it is of great build quality, it has fun games for the whole family and it is portable. I can't say enough about this VR headset, if you are on the fence about this headset, just get it already. You will love this VR headset and your family and happiness will thank you!
review_title: Top quality VR at a great price! Lots of fun, family loves it!

one_reviews_text: I had held off buying any VR headset because I never wanted to have a cable attached to the headset, and wireless lag was a real problem. The Quest 2 removes both of these concerns by having its own processor and running the applications directly on the device.This is one of those situations where I can say something stereotypical like "if I could give this more than 5 stars, I would". But in this case, it's no exaggeration. The device is so mazing it makes me rethink the criteria I use to evaluate other products for 5 star reviews. If 5 stars is perfect, then 5 star reviews should be more rare. But I'd still give this 5 stars.This device has literally changed my life. In the month I have had it, I have lost 10 lbs. due to the exercise apps, and have turned an episode of depression completely around. I am happier and healthier, and I can honestly attribute that to the purchase of the Oculus. I was not prepared for how completely VR tricks the brain. I am prone to seasonal depression, and going outside during dreary winter months is not really helpful. But my brain reacts to spending time in sunny VR environments just as it would to real summer days outside.Over the past 5 years or so, it has been harder and harder to motivate myself to exercise. Running on a treadmill or even jogging outside can feel like such a slog. But VR exercise is fun. So fun, in fact, that I have to force myself to take breaks so I don't hurt myself. It's a gamified workout that actually works. I've never enjoyed exercising more than this, not hiking, mountain biking, or any other type of activity.The device and software architecture, I feel, are spectacular. Some people with more experience with VR headsets have said the graphics are not as good on the Quest due to the mobile processor, and I am sure that is true. But for me, the graphics are fine and also kind of beside the point. The experience of the applications does not suffer due to the lack of PC-quality graphics, in my opinion. The level of immersion more than makes up for it. I am sure if I was already a PC-VR-gamer, I'd notice it more. But going from no VR to this, I am often stunned by the quality of the graphics and more-so by how little the graphic quality matters compared to the other parts of the experience. It's hard to explain.Since getting my Quest 2, I have gotten 8 other people to get them just by being honest about how it has changed my life, and letting them try a few basic apps. And they are all also loving the experience. I honestly cannot even believe they are able to sell these things for this price. If you are on the fence, just buy it. I promise you there will be no regrets.

After some research, I settled on getting the Quest 2 as a headset.  The successor of the Oculus Go (which itself was born from Samsung dropping their support of the Gear VR as far as I know), The Quest line is a standalone headset - that is, you can just put it on, turn on the unit, and go.  This is opposite of the other type of headset you'll hear referenced - a "PCVR" headset, which requires a computer to use - and happens to be the type of headset I wanted.But first, some more information on the headset - the Quest 2 has some impressive specs for it's price point.  Firstly, it has a 100 degree field of view.  A bit more restrictive than some other headsets, but from my experience, it works.  You can set one of three positions for spacing the eyepieces apart (push them together or pull them towards the edges of the headsets with your finger) - this depends on each individual's face structure.  The default FPS (refresh rate) is 72Hz, but you can set experimental refresh rates - just as a heads up - it may not be compatible with some software, and your battery life will absolutely decrease a bit quicker, but that's the tradeoff.  Lastly, unlike higher end units that use separate devices to track the unit, this headset - which lends itself to being standalone - has what is known as inside-out tracking.  This means the device itself uses the small cameras scattered around the headset to determine where you are, and how you are facing.  The only drawback is there should be sufficient lighting.  The good news, however is that these cameras use IR light - similar to how the Wiimotes used two infared lights to track movement - so if you purchase an inexpensive IR flood light, you can easily use this headset in a dark room.  As for why you might want to do this.... keep reading.Before I get onto my experience, let me also say this: the device, despite being standalone, supports being linked to your PC via a Wi-Fi connection or with a USB C to USB A cable, giving you a PCVR experience.  This is a really good perk, because not only is this cheaper than the Oculus Rift S, which is a PCVR headset, but it just so happens that Meta backed out of the PCVR space - so it's not like you can just buy the Rift S (and if you did, it's not like you can get support if something breaks - something that apparently was common with that headset), and it's oculink cable is incredibly expensive.  Once connected, the headset loads the Rift VR environment so you'll enjoy an experience not unlike the Rift S.Here's my experience with the headset:It's really solid.  Many complain about the Facebook link, but it is what it is.  If you're dead set against anything Facebook or Meta, don't use it.  If you're heavily anti-data selling, don't use it.If you couldn't care less because you barely use facebook, or if you already have a facebook account?  There's no real reason for you to not buy this if you want an affordable (and high quality) VR experience.  Is there better?  Absolutely.  Is there anything as cheap while providing an equivalent (or even mostly equivalent) experience?  No.Standalone mode runs a modified Android OS (then again, so does most anything these days that isn't a PC or Apple).  It works great.  It's butter smooth, and haven't had a single issue.  Games that are made for this mode might be a bit lower quality than a PCVR title, but you aren't using a high end GPU - you're using an android device.  Most games look good no matter what, and the loss in quality is probably not going to be noticeable unless you're eagle-eyed, or you just have a tendency to notice these things whether or not you want to (like I am... I hate it lol).Once you connect to the PC, the experience is mostly good.  As you're no longer on a closed system, you're at the will of your PC.  Is it an older system like mine, with a decent GPU, and a many-years old Intel Haswell i5 CPU?  You're going to have an experience that reflects that.  Sometimes I get stuttering.  Sometimes not.  I haven't tested Wifi streaming, but quality is spotty so I won't be testing it, just using the usb cable.  I've only used one (already reviewed it), but your mileage might vary depending on the quality of said cable.  Generally, it worked fine for me.  Any apps for the standalone headset that I've used (Beat Saber, VRChat primarily) definitely look a bit better on PC, as one would expect - those titles need to be optimized for the weaker hardware if you aren't running off of a PC).The controllers are really good, and are decent at detecting when you are touching a button or the thumbstick, and detecting when you actually press them.  The experience has been great.  They aren't Valve Index controllers, but this isn't a $1000+ headset.  This is a $300-$400 headset (depending on your bundle/capacity).Regarding my mention of how the device tracks movement/direction and the like... the reason I like using the headset in the dark, is due to the physical construction of the headset.  To accommodate for any head shape, there are some gaps where light can come in.  Depending on where you look within the headset, you can see outside of it - a bit.  It's honestly minimal and I often don't notice it, but times when my brain wants to focus on any little detail, turning off the lights allow me to only see what's in front of me - think of it as you're watching a movie at home with the lights out, but there's a light coming from a room nearby - sometimes you can ignore it, but it might distract you - this is what I deal with at times.  To sovle this, an IR flood light lets the camera still track the room without an issue, while you can enjoy the dark around you.All in all, if you're anti-Meta/anti-Facebook, this will be a terrible device and it'll be the worst thing ever.  If you can look at the device on it's own or don't care about being linked to Facebook, it's a rock solid VR headset, especially for it's price.  I'd love to see this broken out of the integration with Facebook, but it wasn't a deal breaker for me.
review_title: A consistent experience, and the only quality "budget" experience available right now.

one_reviews_text: I have been excited about Virtual Reality since the 1990s, when it was just a thing in science fiction books. I bought a Quest 2 headset a few months ago, and am SO glad I did!VR is just.... fun. The experiences are amazing, there are hundreds of games for every taste, and there really is nothing like it. Many people do enhance and expand their experience by linking to a PC, but I use Quest 2 standalone, and it's amazing.Quibbles about Facebook and "The Metaverse" notwithstanding, the Quest 2 is a great purchase. Play games, interact with friends and/or strangers, workout, watch movies, or just kick back and do something chill. It's all there. Super easy to set up and use.Note that for most games you will need a fair amount of clear floor space to play in. I have a space in my small house that's about 6' x 12', and it is on the verge of being too small for some of the more active games. But I make it work!There are continual software updates to the headset, and tons of new experiences and games coming out all the time. I have added a few accessories, like grips for the controllers and prescription lenses, and although the stock head-strap fits me pretty well, I may add another strap for enhanced stability and comfort. But really the Quest 2 headset arrives with everything you need to get up and running right out of the box, and a lot of games are free, or have free demos you can try out.Oddly, I hear from a LOT of parents who are buying Quest 2 for kids who are as young as 3 years old. To each their own, I guess, but I wouldn't do that. For one thing VR is not recommended for kids under 13 for developmental reasons, so as far as I know there are no parental controls built in, and a lot of the experiences and games are way too intense for kids. I would think the headsets would be too heavy for a kid anyway.All in all VR has been a game changer for me - literally. I have never regretted buying my Quest 2 headset.
review_title: Best way to get into VR, fantastic deal

one_reviews_text: Al usarlo por mucho tiempo te duelen el rostro, pero la experiencia es excelente, soy nuevo en VR y me marea un poco el uso, pero me acostumbrareEs mucho mejor que el PS-VR en calidad de imagen, no ocupas PC, solo un celular para configuración inicial, luego todo es en el Oculus, si quieres más potencia, puedes enlazarlo con tu PC Gamer pero te recomiendo YouTube para que lo hagas, investigaEs liviano, los mandos son cómodos, y los juegos son económicos promedio 30$Pienso que a futuro esta tecnología irá en crecimiento, definitivo necesita mejorar pero dentro de su competencia actual es la mejor gafa VR del mercado

There are lots of free apps.  The technology is amazing. It's actually useful for exercising.  The programs available have trial programs that you can use for free.  My favorite is holofit and fit vr, etc.  Blastron is a dueling game with a robot.  If you get one of these be sure a watch a lot of you-tube videos on what games are free and good etc. I would have been totally lost without that research. You do not have to be a tech wizard to use this system. If you purchase directly from  facebook you get money for games too. I got mine from amazon because of their great return policy.  My husband got his from facebook.
review_title: These things are amazing I am 68 and love my oculus! I am a commercial.

one_reviews_text: This is my first VR since my Gear VR. Has come a long way since then. If you have a powerful PC, this also doubles as a PC VR for the better quality games like Half Life Alyx. The stock headstrap is not very comfortable but with an aftermarket Elite strap clone ($30) it.is amazing.I recommend getting a strap that supports a power bank, otherwise you will.only.have about an hour of playtime before charging.The 90hz native refresh rate and the experimental 120hz refresh rate really helps with motion sickness.Even though it's mostly plastic,, it seems durable and controller batteries last roughly a month with moderate use before replacing.The integrated speakers are plenty loud but lack depth so headphones or earbuds are suggested. The Quest II supports Bluetooth so a wired connection isn't required.This is super fun, but be warned, you need a good amount of space to get the most out of it.

Got it as a gift for my better half. Wanted to get it before the holidays as I figured it would sell out the closer it got to Christmas. It's a blast. It's really out of this world. My only complaint is that the goggles are not particularly comfortable--my forehead hurts pretty quickly after I start to use it while it takes my honey a little longer to feel the pressure. That does not stop me from loving this thing. We'll figure out the comport level somehow. It's an extraordinary toy. Does not disappoint.
